loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a forty-six-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming where he mainly grows bananas in addition to cattle and goat fattening to earn extra income. He started this business so as to earn a living and improve his standard of living. Moses hopes to own a big banana plantation farm in the future though his main challenge is competition and the banana bacterial wilt disease.

He is requesting a loan to buy more manure for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more manure for his farm.

loans.name: Zhazgul

texts.ru: Жазгул, 30 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, работает в детском саду. Также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Жазгул на сегодняшний день имеет 3 коровы, 2 овцы. Также у Жазгул есть 1,0 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой она выращивает люцерну. Она в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Жазгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en:
Zhasgul is 30 years old, married and the mother of three. She has received secondary education. She works in a kindergarten. As an additional source of income for her family, she raises livestock and grows farm crops. Thanks to Zhasgul's hard work, she now owns three cows and two sheep. She also owns 1.0 ha [2.5 acres] of land, where she grows sainfoin [a plant used for animal feed].

 In order to develop her business further, Zhasgul has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy sheep for fattening and resale. Zhasgul plans to invest the revenues from her loan into an additional growth of her business, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase  sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel es un joven de 20 años de edad el cual tiene una papelería con la que genera el ingreso para el sostenimiento de su familia y estudio, su negocio es algo informal y trata de vender ambulantemente para cubrir sus necesidades.
Este joven genera un empleo, a una persona que se queda en un local vendiendo, mientras el sale a la calle a buscar los contratos, tiene muy buena mentalidad y ganas de salir adelante.
Daniel quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, libretas, colores entre otros.
Este préstamo le permitirá tener un muy buen inventario para trabajar durante tres o cuatro meses.
Del negocio espera rentabilidad para seguir siendo ese apoyo para su familia y poder finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Daniel is a young 20 year old who has a stationary shop with which he earns the income to support his family and his studies. His business is somewhat informal and he sells products buy travelling around to cover his necessities. 
He employs one person who stays at the shop selling while he goes around the streets looking for contracts. He has a good mentality and wants to get ahead in life.
Daniel wants to ask for a loan to buy exercise books, pencils, erasers, notebooks, coloured pencils and other products.
This loan will allow him to have a good inventory to work with for 3 or 4 months. 
From the business he hopes for profitability in order for it to continue to support his family and so he can finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy stock such as exercise books, pencils, erasers, notebooks, coloured pencils and other products. He is a young 20 year old who looks after his household.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 20 años de edad que aspira a convertirse en el soporte de su familia, se desempeña como vendedor de alimentos donde genera un empleo, es soltero y su ambición es poder abrir un local y volver viral sus platos de comida.
Este joven trabaja de 6 a 7 días por semana, ya tiene un lugar donde distribuye y busca apoyo para comprar mesas, sillas e insumos, pues planea convertir una parte de su vivienda en un restaurante.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de estos artículos su principal beneficio es que queda cerca una carretera y los viajeros se detendrá a comer algo pues encontraran sillas donde hacerlo lo que antes no tenía.
Con su préstamo espera atraer cliente, impulsar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos que los destina todos al mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a young 20 year old who hopes to become the support of his family. He earns a living selling food products with which he has created a job. He is single and his ambition is to be able to open a place and make his meals very popular.
This young man works 6 or 7 days a week. He already has a place where he distributes products and is looking for support to buy tables, chairs and supplies as he plans to turn part of his home into a restaurant.
He is asking for this loan to buy these things and the main benefit is that there is a road close by and the travellers will stop to eat something as there will be seats there to do so where there was not before.
With this loan he hopes to attract customers, promote sales and improve his income which all goes towards improving the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: to turn his business into a restaurant, to buy seats, tables and supplies to make lunches and dinners.

loans.name: Griselda Dionisia

texts.es: Griselda de 38 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene 12 años de dedicase a esa actividad con la cual ha logrado salir adelante, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo, etc. todo por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y tener junto con sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Griselda is 38 years old. She is a single mother, and lives in her own house with her two children. She earns a living selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas]. Her business is located in her home, and she has been dedicated to this occupation for 12 years. With this work she has been able to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale corn, beans, shredded pork, cheese, etc. to be able to continue with her sales and have a better quality of life together with her children.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn, beans, shredded pork, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
Blanca es una mujer muy persistente, supera adversidades, ella quedo viuda y a cargo de tres hijos convirtiéndose en una madre cabeza de familia, ella  vende mercancía en las calles del centro de Medellín, gracias a sus lindas correas, calidad de productos y un fuerte horario laboral de 12 horas por día, ha sacado su familia y negocio adelante.
Blanca quiere mejorar sus ventas, lograr una sostenibilidad, seguir trabajando en el sector, tener un local comercial para evitar los hurtos y seguir haciendo lo que desde el año 2004 hace, tratar de mejorar las condiciones de su familia y que no lleguen a pasar necesidad.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de correas, busca prosperar y tener más estilos para ofrecerles a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca is a very persistent women who overcomes setbacks. She is a widow and is responsible for three children, this making her the head of her family. She sells merchandise around the streets of the centre of Medellin. Thanks to her beautiful belts, the quality of the products and her long working hours of 12 hours a day, she has moved her family and her business forward in life.
Blanca wants to improve her sales, achieve sustainability, continue to work in the sector and have commercial premises so as to avoid thefts. She wants to continue to do what she has been doing since 2004. She wants to improve the conditions of her family and not let them go without.
She is asking for a loan to buy belts, she looks to prosper and have more styles to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy a wide range of belts in order to continue moving forward with her family and fighting to have her own business.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
This nice woman is 37 years old and lives in Dilijan city. She lives there with her mother and two school-aged children. Karine has a higher education as an economist, but she never managed to work in her specialty. Karine likes cooking very much and now she works at a restaurant as the head cook. She works very hard and she also helps her mother with her small business.

Dilijan city is famous for its magnificent nature. The city is one of the best places and during the summer and autumn seasons it is much visited by tourists. Karine and her mother did a little bit of reconstruction work on their big house and they have several rooms of the house for rent. They made cute, comfortable rooms with nice balconies from which people can admire the city. Karine cooks for their guests also and, being already a master in this field, the food and the dishes that she makes are in great demand. All their guests prefer to have breakfast and dinner made only by Karine. With her mother, Karine does her best to provide her children with better living conditions. So now little by little she is getting prepared for the quiet season.

This loan will greatly help her, as with it, she wants to buy a new refrigerator and gas-stove for her house. This purchase will help her to cook faster and keep all the ingredients and products for cooking safe and fresh.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator and gas stove for her guest house.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is an adult hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in the growing of bananas as her main source of income and sells coffee and goats as her side source of income. She started this business so as to look after her family and educate her children. She hopes to become rich and have a modernized farm; however, her main challenge is thieves who steal her goats and ripe bananas.

Rosemary is asking for a loan to buy manure for her farm.

loans.use: to buy manure for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies in pharmacy.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwanasha operates a grocery stall selling vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 35,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is a forty-year-old hardworking married man with three children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming in addition to owning a retail shop to earn himself extra income. He started this business so as to have a better standard of living. He hopes to become a model farmer in his area and have educated children up to higher levels, although his main challenge is inadequate capital.

He is requesting a loan to buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.use: to buy manure for his banana plantation.

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es:
María madre de 3 hijos menores de edad, vive con su pareja donde juntos busca la mejora continua, tener una vida digna y que sus hijos puedan acceder a un estudio, tener buena alimentación, un techo y dos seres que los aman por encima de todas las cosas.
María tiene un negocio muy divertido  y buscado por sus clientes, ofrece bebidas, tiene un sonido envolvente, cuando hay fiesta donde María la cosa se pone buena es lo que dicen sus clientes, bailan beben, comparten y dicho negocio es lo que ha mejorado la calidad de vida en su hogar puesto que antes era ama de casa y solo desde el 2012 administra dicho negocio.
María quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de cerveza y aguardiente que son las bebidas más consumidas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is the mother of 3 minor children. She lives with her partner, and together they look to continually improve, to have a decent life, and that their children have access to schooling, good nutrition, a roof, and two people that love them above everything else.

Maria has a business that is fun and sought after by her customers, and offers drinks, and has a surround sound. Her customers say that when there is a party at Maria's, things are done well, and they drink, dance, and share. This business is what has improved the quality of life in her home, because before this she was a homemaker and has only been running this business since 2012.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy a supply of beer and liquor which are the drinks most consumed in her business.

loans.use: to buy a supply of alcoholic drinks, and help her business to continue being recognized as a fun place.

loans.name: Giovanis Maria

texts.es:
En el año 2013 la señora Giovanis quien es madre de 5 hijos 4 de ellos menores de edad inicio una venta de productos congelados, la razón es que en su hogar carecían de recursos y busco una actividad que le ayudara a su esposo a solventar las necesidades económicas.
Poco a poco La señora Giovanis se ha ido afianzando en el mercado y esto impacta mucho en su hogar pues se ha visto un notorio mejoramiento de calidad de vida, evidenciando en estudio para sus hijos, alimento, servicios públicos al día y proyecciones de expansión en tiendas de veredas cercanas.
Giovanis quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de carne y abarrotes, utensilios y comprar cerdos para iniciar un criadero del que se ocuparan sus hijos
texts.en:
In 2013, Giovanis, a mother of five (four of whom are still minors), started a business selling frozen foods.  She started this business because her family was struggling and she was seeking a way to help her husband cover their financial needs. Little by little, Giovanis has positioned herself in the market, which has had a big impact on her home as their quality of life has improved.  This is evidenced by her children's education, their nutrition, being able to pay their utilities on time and the projected expansion of her business to local stores.

Giovanis is seeking a loan to purchase an assortment of meat and groceries, utensils, and pigs to start raising them for her children.

loans.use: purchase meat, groceries and utensils.

loans.name: Getsemani Group

texts.es: Getsemaní es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres laboriosas cada una con negocios diferentes pero con un solo objetivo como es seguir creciendo en sus negocios para ofrecerles mejores condiciones de vida a sus familias. Es coordinado por Dominga una señora que a sus 50 años de edad y soltera ha sido ejemplo de superación para muchos, ella ofrece el servicio de elaboración y venta de comida en su domicilio, es el sexto ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una personal con alto espíritu de superación y responsable con sus obligaciones, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de arroz, aceite, frijol, queso, maseca, yuca, quequisque, chayote, naranja agrías, leña, etc., ya que con los créditos anteriores ha logrado la compra de utensilios para la cocina lo que le permite ofrecer un servicio de calidad. Las demás de integrantes son las señoras, Martha quien ofrece productos artesanales como es calzado, vestidos bordados, lunas y soles en barro, etc.), y María que tiene la edad de 71 años y es propietaria d una pulpería desde hace seis años.
texts.en:
Getsemaní is a group made up of three hardworking women who each have different businesses but share the goal of growing their businesses and providing their families with better living conditions.  The group is coordinated by Dominga, a 50 year old single woman who has been an example of success for many.  She makes and sells food from her home, and this is her sixth loan with ADIM for her business.  She has demonstrated that she is a person with great desire to get ahead, who is responsible with her commitments.  

The current loan will be used to purchase rice, oil, beans, cheese, corn masa mix, yucca, taro, squash, oranges, firewood, etc. With the previous loans, she was able to purchase cooking utensils that allowed her to provide better service.

The other members of the group are: Martha who makes artisanal products such as socks, woven dresses, and clay suns and moons; and María, 71, who owns a convenience store.

loans.use: purchase rice, oil, beans, cheese, corn masa mix, yucca, taro, squash, oranges, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Reseda Y Sontol Group

texts.es: Resada y Sontol es un grupo solidario integrado por tres mujeres exitosas en su vida laboral, es coordinado por la señora Rosa que a sus 71 años de edad, viuda ha sido ejemplo de superación  y de perseverancia en su negocio, ella se dedica a la comercialización de sandalias de manera ambulante en el departamento de Rivas, ella impulsó su negocio hace diez años con ayuda de su cuñada, es el séptimo ciclo que ADIM le brinda el financiamiento y ha demostrado ser una mujer responsable con sus cuotas de pagos, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de sandalias para niñas, calzado de bebés, sandalias altas y sandalias bajas, con los créditos anteriores ha logrado aumentar la clientela por lo que la ha motivado a seguir solicitando los financiamientos. El resto de las integrantes son las señoras, Lizeth que tiene la edad de 28 años y es propietaria de una pulpería, y Gerdia que a sus 54 años comercializa sandalias en el mercado de Choluteca.
texts.en:
"Resada and Sontol" is a group made up of three successful businesswomen.  The group is led by Rosa who at 71 years old has been an example of success and perseverance through her business.  She works selling sandals on the streets of Rivas.  She started her business 10 years ago with the help of her sister-in-law.  This is her seventh loan with ADIM and she has demonstrated that she is responsible with her payments.

The current loan she is seeking will be used to purchase children's sandals, baby shoes, high-heeled sandal and flat sandals.  With the previous loans, she has been able to increase her customer base, which has motivated her to continue seeking loans. 

The other members are: Lizeth, 28, who owns a convenience store; and Gerdia, 54, who sells sandals in the Choluteca market.

loans.use: purchase children's sandals, baby shoes, high-heeled sandals and flat sandals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase bee honey,  dyes, foot exfoliants, nail paint, lipstick, chains, rings, bracelets, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 38-year-old tailor, a boutique proprietor from Kilifi, Kenya. He is a father of four, whose spouse is a housewife. He has been in his business for the last six years with a great income.

This marks Mohamed's sixth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase clothing materials for making school uniforms in preparation for second term. He will use the anticipated profit to educate his children. He hopes to have several boutiques and a happy family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing material for making school uniforms

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefania es una hermosa Joven de 19 años de edad, ella quiere iniciar un negocio de venta de mercancía de uso personal como lo son cremas de más, productos capilares, faciales, la razón es que ella desea convertirse en el soporte de su familia, mejorar las condiciones de vida.
Por eso con el ánimo de iniciar empresa, empezara como vendedora pro catalogo y aspira en unos años tener éxito y montar una tienda de productos de uso personal.
texts.en: Estefania is a young and beautiful 19 year old woman.  She wants to start a business selling personal use products such as creams, hair products, and face products.  She hopes that by doing this she can support her family and improve their living conditions.  For these reasons, she will start this business by selling products from catalogs and in some years, she will be successful enough to open her own store.

loans.use: to start a business selling personal use products.

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
Victor es un joven de 27 años que está a un paso de cumplir un gran sueño, en la foto se encuentra en las instalaciones de Interactuar solicitando un préstamo para iniciar un negocio propio que será una venta de alimentos, tiene el local, solo el faltan activos fijos que es el motivo de su visita.

Esta decisión porque quiere convertirse en el soporte y generador de sueños de su familia, pero se preguntaran que sueños quiere generar, a partir de un mejoramiento de calidad de vida, piensa apoyarlos para que estudien y se motiven a buscar un futuro más prometedor.

Con el préstamo desea comprar una freidora, mesas, sillas y un congelador. 

Ayuda a este joven a iniciar un negocio de venta de alimentos.
texts.en:
Victor is a 27 year old who is about to make a big dream of his come true.  In the picture he can be seen at the Interactuar offices requesting a loan to start his own business, which will be a restaurant.  He already has the location, he is only missing the fixed assets, which is why he is seeking this loan.  He is starting this business in order to support his family and be able to make their dreams come true.  When asked what these dreams are, he says they include improving their quality of life, supporting them in their educations and motivating them to seek a more promising future.

With this loan he plans to purchase a deep frier, tables, chairs and a freezer.  Help this young man start his restaurant.

loans.use: purchase a deep frier, freezer, tables, chairs and an assortment of food.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 52 years of age, married, and the mother of four children. She practices poultry and dairy farming and she is requesting a Kiva loan to buy chicken and dairy feed, which will improve production of eggs and milk, hence, more income.

Rachael joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to access enterprise development and financial management training. She believes her Kiva loan will help her expand her farming business. Rachael appreciates Kiva and promises to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy chicken and dairy feed, which will improve production of eggs and milk, hence, more income.

loans.name: David De Jesus

texts.es:
El cultivo de frutas es lo que le ha generado al señor David el sustento para su familia, su negocio lleva una larga tradición familiar donde se heredan las actividades y conocimientos a las próximas generaciones, en la foto lo vemos recogiendo tomates de árbol que quedan exquisito en jugo y estos tomates los cuales comercializa en el mercado.
Su sueño es poder pagar la educación de sus tres hijos, darle a su esposa un gran hogar y procurar estar en el mercado para dejarles en un futuro el negocio a sus hijos.
David  quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, insecticidas, insecticidas, y fungicidas, la razón del monto es que estos tienen un alto costo y sus terrenos son amplios.
Este préstamo le permitirá abonar y mantener sus campos.
texts.en:
By cultivating fruit, David is able to support his family.  He is carrying out a family tradition by working in agriculture, where the knowledge of farming is passed down through the generations.  In the photo, we see him collecting tamarillos, which produce an exquisite juice and are sold in the market.

David's dreams are to be able to pay for the education of his 3 children, to give his wife a great house, and to be able to secure a place in the market so that in the future he can leave his business to his children.

David wants a loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and fungicides.  The reason for the sum requested is that these products are high in cost, and he has extensive fields.  With this loan, he will be able to fertilize and maintain his crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Living in the frontier village of Khashtarak in the Tavush region, this woman is engaged in farming and agriculture with her all family members. Gohar is 38 years old and has already had 20 years with her beloved husband and parents-in-law where she does farming. In the farm she has a lot of cows and calves, pigs and piglets, and also chickens. She organizes the sale of milk, macun (a national dairy product), meat and eggs with her mother-in-law. Also, with the help of her husband, Gohar cultivates potatoes and greens on her land, which she sells to re-sellers right from her house. Gohar has two boys; the elder helps her about the farm and the younger is passing his military service in the army.

Gohar is asking for this loan in order to buy a lot of animal fodder, as her rather large amount of farm cattle have a great lack of it.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder, as her rather large amount of farm cattle have a great lack of it.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
O senhor Francisco tem 35 anos de idade, é casado, pai de 6 filhos todos maiores de idade e vive na casa propria.Dos filhos, um frequenta o ensino secundário e 3 estão no ensino primário.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar um carpete e uma mala de madeira.
Seus sonhos e esperança para o futuro são concluir os estudos e a sua obra e adiquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal.
Diz que tem como desafioa insuficiência de fundos e para ultrapassa-los faz uma poupança e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Mr Francisco is 35 year old, married and the father of 6 children who are all of school-going age and lives in a house he owns. Of his children, one goes to high school and 3 go to primary school.

He says that with this loan he will buy a carpet and a wooden trunk.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to finish his studies, the building work on his home and to buy a vehicle for personal use.

He says his challenge is the lack of funds and to overcome this he saves money and will ask for further loans to carry out his plans.

loans.use: buy a carpet and a wooden trunk

loans.name: Faustino

texts.pt:
O senhor Faustino tem 34 anos de idade, é casado e é  pai de 3 filhos. Além da sua família sustenta a sua mãe e avó enviando, vive  na casa própria. 
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar ferros, cimento, areia e pedra para dar continuidade a sua obra.
Seus sonhos e esperança para o futuro são adquirir uma viatura, construir mais uma casa maior e melhorada e concluir os estudos.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz uma poupança e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Mr Faustino is 34 years old, married and the father of 3 children. As well as his family he also supports his mother and grandmother by sending money, and he lives in a house he owns.

He says that with this loan he will buy iron, cement, sand and stone to continue building his house.

His dreams and hope for the future are to buy a vehicle, build a larger and more improved home and to finish his studies.

He says his challenge is the lack of funds and to overcome this he saves money and will ask for further loans to carry out his plans.

loans.use: buy iron, cement, sand and stone to continue building his house.

loans.name: Dique

texts.pt:
O senhor Dique tem 28 anos de idade, é casado, pai de 2 filhos e vive na casa da sua mãe. 
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar cimento, areia, pedra e carinha de mão para a produção e posterior  venda de blocos.
Seus sonhos e esperança para o futuro e ver seu negócio a crescer e tornar-se um grande empresário para poder ajudar os outros dando emprego.
Diz que tem como desafio a insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz uma poupança e pagar o emprestimo sem entrar e moras e solicitar mais emprestimos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Mr Dique is 28 years old, is married, the father of 2 children and lives in his mother's home.

He says that with this loan he will buy cement, sand, stone and a wheelbarrow to produce and sell bricks.

His dreams and hopes for the future are to see his business grow and become a great businessman to be able to help others by giving them employment.

He says his challenge is a lack of funds and to overcome this he saves money and plans to pay his loan back on time and request further loans to carry out his plans.

loans.use: buy cement, sand, stone and a wheelbarrow to produce and sell bricks.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 34-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids in a small humble house. He works as an employee in the public sector. He is also a student in a local university where he studies business administration.

Osama took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. This will help him to do his homework and write reports easily.

Osama appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a 31-year-old single lady who has been working in her clothing shop for five years to cover her needs and expenses. She is an ambitious lady who has a good reputation among her region. She has succeeded throughout the years in gaining loyal customers.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business by increasing her business merchandise with a new collection of clothes for the upcoming spring and summer seasons. This loan will help Diana increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of clothes for the upcoming spring and summer seasons.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Christina, 63 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer, who lives in Saosa, a remote village in Molo. She is happily married and is blessed with an adorable family. She has been practising mixed farming for the last five years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Molo area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She states that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a woman seeking to access funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbours and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a forty-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He runs a retail shop in addition to farming to earn himself extra income. He started this business so as to look after his family. He hopes to be a rich man and have the best shelter for his family with a well built permanent house despite his main challenge of inadequate capital.

He needs a loan to buy building materials to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to complete his house.

loans.name: Hugo Alberto

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre de 58 años de edad un verdadero ejemplo, por motivos de edad se quedó sin empleo y es muy difícil volver a empelarse considerando sus 58 años, por eso de inmediatamente busco una alternativa y aprovecho sus empleos como panadero para montar su propio negocio y seguir siendo ese apoyo y el hombre de la casa que compra los alimentos y pagas las cuentas.

Inicialmente empezara desde su hogar es por ello que con el préstamo que se encuentra solicitando comprara un horno.

Apoya este hombre de 58 años de edad que con trabajo, humildad y alegría sacara adelante su negocio, y no descansara hasta poder juntar los recursos para comprar una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
Hugo is a fine example of a 58 year old man. Due to his age he was left without a job and it is difficult to go back to work considering his age. Due to this he is seeking an immediate alternative to make the most of his skills as a baker, to set up his own business and continue to support, and be the man of his household, who buys the food and pays the bills. 

Initially he will start from his own home, with the loan that he is requesting he will buy an oven. 

With this support, and with work, humility and joy this man will continue to take his business forward, and will not rest until he has been able to gather enough resources to buy his own home.

loans.use: to purchase an oven and to start a bakery business, with the hope of purchasing a house

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 50 años de edad, soltera y sin empleo que llego a la corporación interactuar en busca de un préstamo para iniciar un negocio que será una venta de arepas ambulante, la decisión la tomó por superación por querer cumplir sus sueños de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, de tener un empleo de donde no la puedan echar y prosperar con sus propios esfuerzos.

Ella quiere invertir el préstamo en un asador, carbón, maíz, sal, mantequilla, un molino, plástico para cubrirse de las lluvias.

Tu préstamo puede hacer que esta persona tenga un negocio para llevar el alimento a su mesa.
texts.en:
María is a 50 year old single and unemployed woman. She came to the corporation in search of a loan in order to start her own travelling business, selling corn cakes. She made the decision wanting to fulfil her dreams of improving her living conditions, and to haver a job from which she can prosper from her own effort. 
She wants to invest the loan in a grill, coal, corn, butter, a mill and plastic to shelter from the rain. Your loan could help this woman to have her own business in order to bring food to her table.

loans.use: to start selling corn cakes, and to buy a grill, corn, coal, salt and butter.

loans.name: Veronicha

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Veronicha. She is 39 years old, married and blessed with two children. Her economic activity is vegetable farming. She also does poultry farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feed and vegetable seeds. Veronicha feels that the loan will assist her to expand her farming and improve her farming practices, hence improving her income.

Veronicha is very grateful to Kiva for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed and vegetable seeds to improve farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials to complete the building of his house

loans.name: Napoleon Fernando

texts.es:
Napoleon es un hombre de 34 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 5 años, y su negocio es la decoración de eventos.
Él es buen padre, independiente, emprendedor, de buen gusto, amable, responsable  y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Sur de la ciudad, de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por encontrarse las redes viales que comunican a la ciudad y porque se encuentran 1 de los 2 aeropuertos internacionales, de clima cálido tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Napoleon es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la decoración de eventos como; fiesta de quince años, matrimonios, cumpleaños, bodas y todo tipo de acontecimiento. Para realizar su trabajo cuenta con vajilla como; platos planos, platos soperos, cubiertos, vasos, copas, mesas, sillas, manteles, etc. Según sea la fiesta y la capacidad de personas se realiza la decoración. “inicié mi negocio por la experiencia que tuve cuando trabajé como mozo de restaurante, observaba la cantidad de eventos que existían y con un poco de ayuda me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con amplia experiencia, la desventaja es que no cuenta con mobiliario para acontecimientos con muchos invitados. Su sueño es ser el mejor decorador de fiestas, él desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para alquilar a acontecimientos con muchas personas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que desarrolla esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Napoleon solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para decorar acontecimientos con muchos invitados.
texts.en:
Napoleon is a 34 year old man, married, has two children who are 7 and 5, and his business is event decorating.  He is a good father, independent, entrepreneurial, has good taste, and is friendly, responsible and hardworking.  He runs his business in the area south of the city, an area characterized by its road networks that connect it to the city and it also has one of the two international airports.  It has a warm, tropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day from 21 to 31 degrees Celsius.

Napoleon is dark-skinned, has short black hair, brown eyes, a short stature and a medium-sized build.  His native language is Guaraní, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish with the general public and for his business.  He lives in a rented home made of brick and cement with a metal roof that has drinking water, electricity and plumbing.  His business decorates events like quinceañeras (traditional 15th birthday celebrations), weddings, birthdays, and all other kinds of events.

For his work, he has tableware like plates, soup bowls, cutlery, glasses, cups, tables, chairs, linens, etc.  He decorates according to the party and the number of people.  “I started my business from the experience that I had when I worked as a waiter in a restaurant.  I observed the various events that there were, and with a little bit of help, I went out on my own,” he comments.  The advantage of his business is that he has extensive experience, and the disadvantage is that he does not have the furnishings for events with large amounts of guests.

His dream is to be the best party decorator.  He wants to purchase tables and chairs to rent out for events with large numbers of people.  This is the first sequence of loans with this institution in the four years that he has independently grown his business.  For these reasons, Napoleon is requesting a loan to purchase tables and chairs to decorate events with many guests.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs to decorate events with large numbers of guests

loans.name: Issa's Group

texts.fr: Issa, au premier rang à droite sur la photo et portant  une chemise manche courte, est membre d'un groupe de 13 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Diran Tabacoro, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Issa, qui est âgé de 31 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 24 personnes. L’agriculture lui permet de satisfaire ses besoins alimentaires. Il a décidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour le système de paiement et intrants agricoles. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Issa a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs pour son champ de 0.5 hectare. A travers cet achat, Issa espère bénéficier beaucoup de rendements afin de pouvoir  assurer la sécurité alimentaire, la santé, et la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Issa is seated in the front row of the photo and is wearing a short-sleeved shirt. He is a member of a group of 13 farmers who work and live in the village of Diran Tabacoro in the southwest of Bamako in Mali. Issa is 31 years old and lives with his 24 family members. 

Farming allows him to meet his nutritional needs. He decided to join “myAgro” for their payment system and farm inputs.  For his first year with myAgro, Issa bought a packet of open-pollinated variety (OPV) seeds and fertilizer to grow corn for his 0.5-hectare field. With this purchase, Issa hopes to have a productive yield so that he can ensure his family’s dietary needs and education.

loans.use: acheter un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo es un increíble, perseverante y luchador joven de 21 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de uso personal, con esta actividad genera el sustento para su hogar, conformado por padres y hermanos, él quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de camisas, abrigos, camisetas, desodorantes, talcos y perfumes, los cuales ofrece a compañeros, familiares y personas del común.
Mateo quiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, que sus padres sean felices y orgulloso de lo que hace y poder en un futuro estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Mateo is an incredible, persevering, determined young man, age 21, who sells clothing and personal use products. With this activity, he generates income for his family, which is composed of his parents and brothers.  

He wants to request a loan for the purchase of shirts, coats, t-shirts, deodorants, talcum powder, and perfume which he offers to his friends, relatives, and ordinary people.

Mateo wants to improve his home’s conditions so that his parents will be happy and proud of what he does, and in the future, he wants to attend the university.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, coats, deodorant, talcum powder, and perfume in order to supplement his income.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Célibataire et âgée de 57 ans, Marie est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants. Dans son quartier, Marie vend des tourteaux afin de trouver son revenu indispensable pour leur épanouissement. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Marie s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Marie demande ce crédit pour commander des tourteaux et réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider ses enfants dans leurs éducations.
texts.en: Marie is 57 years old and single. She lives in Adidogomé with her two children. Marie sells oil cakes (cattle feed) in her neighborhood in order to earn the income necessary to help her children thrive. Marie buys her supplies once a month in the market so that she can easily meet their needs. Marie is asking for this loan so that she can order oil cakes and earn more income so that she can help her children with their education.

loans.use: buy 600 oil cakes (cattle feed).

loans.name: Monica Andrea

texts.es:
Ella es Mónica, una madre cabeza de familia, sus dos hijos tienen 4 y 10 años de edad, ella trabajaba como empelada en un puesto de comidas, pero no podía dedicarle mucho tiempo a sus hijos, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar con un negocio de venta de arepas, el motivo es que quiere tener una entrada de dinero estable, poder cuidar a sus pequeños y sacarlos adelante que estudien y se conviertan en unas excelentes personas.

Con el préstamo solicitado espera comprar lo siguiente:
-	Maíz
-	Plástico
-	Salsas
-	Carne
-	Pollo
-	Queso
-	Horno
-	Carbón
Este préstamo motivara mucho a Mónica y tendrá un negocio para buscar una mejora calidad de vida para ella y su hijos
texts.en:
This is Mónica, a mother who is the head of the family.  Her two children are four and ten years old.  She had a job working at a food stand, but she could not dedicate much time to her children. This is why she wants to request a loan to start a business selling arepas (a traditional cornmeal flatbread).  Her reason is because she wants to have a steady income, to be able to care for her children and to move them forward in life so that they study and become great people.

With the loan she is requesting, she hopes to purchase corn, plastic wrap, sauces, meat, Chicken, cheese, a grill and charcoal.  This loan will motivate Mónica very much and she will have a business to seek a better quality of life for herself and for her children.

loans.use: to start a business selling arepas by purchasing corn, plastic wrap, meat, sauces, cheese, a grill and charcoal

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single man from the city of Jabalia. He lives with his family in a small, humble house. His father works as an employee in the public sector, where he earns a low income. Mohammad is a student at a local university, where he studies physiotherapy. He wants to complete his studies and find a job in the future.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This will help him to do his homework and write reports easily.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, brick, and iron to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Mirna Margoth

texts.es: Mirna de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia desde hace 10 años con su hijo de 20 años de edad que es su único apoyo y alegría, ya que lo ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. Ella es una mujer que  muestra su esfuerzo prestando sus servicios domésticos para sostener su hogar. Mirna desea instalar agua potable y construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda, ya que actualmente no cuenta con estos servicios tan básicos y necesarios, ya que al no contar con ellos su hogar y su comunidad están expuestos a contaminación, es por ello que ha solicitado un crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, ladrillo, tubos de pvc, grifos y mano de obra para instalar agua potable y construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: Mirna is 55 years old and has lived in her own house for 10 years with her 20 year old son, who is her only support and her joy, since she has been able to move forward as a single mother.  She is a woman who makes an effort by providing her domestic services to sustain her home.  Mirna wants to install drinkable water and to construct a septic tank at her home, since currently she does not have these very basic and necessary services; without them, her home and her community are at risk of contamination.  This is why she has requested a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand, bricks, pvc pipes, faucets and labor to install drinking water and to construct a septic system in her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, bricks, pvc pipes, faucets and labor to install drinking water and to construct a septic system in her home

loans.name: Rancho Los Mangos Group

texts.es: Cuatro microempresarias laboriosas solicitan por segunda ocasión en ADIM el financiamiento para sus negocios, con el objetivo de continuar creciendo en sus negocios y por ende mejorando la vida familiar. Es coordinado por la señora Zenelia quien a sus 28 años es propietaria de una mini pulpería, además comercializa ropa en su comunidad, este negocio lo impulsó hace nueve años con ayuda financiera de su compañero de vida, el crédito actual lo solicita la inversión en granos básicos, blusas, camisetas de varón, pantalones de marca jeans, levis, big time, licras, shorts, talladores, etc., con el crédito anterior le permitió comprar al por mayor lo que le permite obtener mejores ganancias, ya que ella comercializa al por menor. El resto de las integrantes son, Tania que tiene la edad de 26 años y su negocio es la hecha y venta de nacatamales, Llibeth de 24 años de edad y quien se dedica a la elaboración de vestidos para niñas bordados, y La señora Reyes que a sus 61 años de edad es ejemplo de superación y es propietaria de una pulpería, desde hace trece años.
texts.en:
Four, hardworking micro-entrepreneurs are applying for a second time for financing from ADIM for their businesses, with the goal of continuing to grow their businesses and improve their family life. 

The group is coordinated by Ms. Zenelia who at 28 years old is the owner of a small grocery store. She also sells clothing in the community. She started this business nine years ago with the financial support of her partner. 

The current loan she is requesting is for investing in basic grains, blouses, men’s t-shirts, jeans (Levi’s, etc.), tights, shorts, etc. The previous loan allowed her to buy wholesale, which allowed her to earn better profits for when she sells retail.  

The rest of the members are 26-year-old Tania whose business is making and selling tamales; 24-year-old Lilibeth who makes a living sewing embroidered dresses for girls; and Ms. Reyes who at 61 years old is an example of success and has been the owner of a grocery store for 13 years.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and blouses, t-shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Tanjung Rijasa Group

texts.en:
Several months have passed and Tanjung Rijasa Group was able to pay off the previous loan on time. In the journey of business, the group members are progressing quite rapidly. They can raise pigs in a good way so that they get a satisfactory result. Because they get a satisfactory result, some of the members of the group earned enough money for saving. During this time, their activities were monitored by the Loan Officer for their achievement and served as an example for other farmers. 

Luh Putu sold all of her piglets and earned enough profit after deducting other costs. From the profits, she can fulfill her family's daily needs and save money. She and all the members of the Tanjung Rijasa Group said they are grateful to all lenders, Kiva and MUK.

Because the price of feed is high, the  Tanjung Rijasa Group requested a new loan in the same loan amount. Each member gets 2,000,000 IDR. The loan will be used to buy super quality piglets and feed.

Luh Putu will use the loan to buy three superior piglets and quality feed. To reduce costs, she still gives the mixture feed. She hopes the pigs will grow healthy and not be attacked by disease. When she has enough savings for venture capital, she will raise pigs with her own capital. 

Two members are not in the picture because of illness.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets and quality feed.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 25-year-old married mother of three children, who started working as a hairdresser six years ago to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Fatima is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying desperately to improve her family's living conditions. Due to increasing living costs, her income and her husband's income are becoming very limited. Today, Fatima is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy special gifts for her mother and mother-in-law for the occasion of Mother's Day. She hopes to open her own beauty salon in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy special gifts for her mother and mother-in-law for the occasion of Mother's Day

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and iron to build a septic tank in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to repair the roof of her home

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 51-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in farming alongside having a retail shop to earn him an extra income. He started this business so as to look after his family.  He hopes to achieve his dream even though his main challenge is pests and diseases that attack his crops and reduce his expected output.

He is requesting for a loan to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.use: to buy manure and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 43-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He buys and sells produce alongside his monthly salary, which earns him an extra income. He started this business to educate his children. He hopes to become a prominent businessman and expand his business; however, his main challenge is limited capital. 

He has asked for a loan to buy more produce like maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy more produce like maize for resale.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun has been providing electronic supplies repair services in Artik town for more than 20 years. 

He lives with his wife: elderly retired housewoman Sonya from Artik town. 

Harutyun rents a garage, where he receives orders from his clients and organizes repair of all type of electronic supplies. In order to cover current orders, Harutyun needs some financial resources to invest in his work. He asks for this loan to purchase materials needed for doing repair work.
 
His loan has been approved within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program started in 2012, and since then, has been providing business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify for loans through normal channels.

Thus, Harutyun applied for this loan to receive lenders' support and invest in his business, so he will be able to earn income for his lovely wife.

loans.use: to pay for materials needed for repair of electronics.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
This is Jane; she is 26 years old, married and a mother of three children. Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training has enabled her to improve on her savings skills and enterprise management, as well as financial management skills.

She is a vegetable farmer and also rears goats. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy vegetable seeds that will help boost farming. She hopes for more sales, thus an increase in her profits, which will provide a better life for her family.

Jane is happy for Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds that will help improve farming.

loans.name: Khudija

texts.en: Khudija is a 45-year-old widow. She has been doing a business of cattle purchase and sale, with the help of her son, who is also shown in the photo.  After raising small animals for a year or two they sell them in the local market. Her business has provided her family with a decent life.  For the growth of her business she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR from Murabaha to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.name: Ahmmed

texts.en:
Because of high rates of the poverty in the community, Ahmmed couldn't provide his house with some of the necessary home appliances, despite the fact that he has a salary. His salary is a very small and there is no other source of income to help him in covering the main needs of his family. 

Ahmmed applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to purchase some necessary home appliances, such as a refrigerator, that he needs inside the house. With a new refrigerator, Ahmmed's family will have cold drinks and the family will be keeping some food in the refrigerator, too. 

The loan will make suitable the living conditions inside Ahmmed's house.

Ahmmed looks forward to having his own house to save the money that he pays monthly for rent.

loans.use: to purchase some necessary home appliances, such as a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Marlene Concepcion

texts.es: Marlene de 38 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 3 hijos 2 varones de 11 y 13 años y una niña de 8 años de edad que es su mayor alegría. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y pupusas, actividad que ya lleva 5 años realizando y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos, además gracias a su amabilidad y a sus precios accesibles cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Marlene desea construir una fosa séptica en su vivienda y de esta manera evitar la contaminación en su vivienda y comunidad, además desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su vivienda, para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, tubos de pvc, grifos, ladrillos, etc., para construir una fosa séptica e instalar agua potable.
texts.en:
Marlene, 38, lives in her own home with her three children—two boys, ages eleven and thirteen, and a girl, age eight. That is her greatest joy. 

She makes and sells tortillas and pupusas (stuffed tortillas), an occupation that she has been engaged in for five years, that has allowed her to support her children. In addition, thanks to her friendliness and affordable prices, she has a large number of customers who prefer her more and more each day.

Marlene wants to build a septic tank at her home, and in this way, avoid contamination in her home and community. In addition, she wants to install potable water in her home.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan with FUSAI in order to invest in cement, sand, PVC pipes, faucets, brick, etc. to build a septic tank, and install potable water.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, PVC pipes, faucets, bricks, etc. to build a septic tank and install potable water.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: cement, sand, gravel, brick, and metal sheets to change the roof and build a retaining wall in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: galvanized steel, wood and nails to change the roof of his home.

loans.name: Dalila Elizabeth

texts.es: Dalila de 32 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de productos básicos en una tienda que instalo en su vivienda hace 16 años, por lo que cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que gustan de sus productos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida, sus padres y su hermana desde hace 32 años, por lo que se siente feliz de tener un lugar donde vivir. Dalila desea invertir en su negocio ya que sabe que entre más surtido esta mejores son sus ganancias, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: frijoles, azúcar, café, huevos, leche, golosinas, etc.
texts.en: Dalila is 32 years old and is an entrepreneurial woman who makes a living in the sale of basic products in a shop that she installed in her home 16 years ago, so she has a lot of customers who like her products. She lives in her own home together with her husband, her parents and her sister for 32 years. She is happy to have a place to live. Dalila wants to invest in her business because she knows that the more variety the better your earnings, which is why she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in: beans, sugar, coffee, eggs, milk, and sweets, etc.

loans.use: to invest in: beans, sugar, coffee, eggs, milk, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Noha

texts.en:
Noha is a 56-year-old Lebanese widow living with her two children who are attending school. 

Noha has been working for 20 years at her house in the tailoring business to help her family meet the needs of life. She is well-known in her region through her good reputation. 

To better develop her business, Noha is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new materials for her business, such as textiles, scissors, and many other items. This will allow her to offer a greater variety of products and, therefore will improve her income.

loans.use: to buy new materials for her business, such as textiles, scissors, and many other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cattle to add to his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more general merchandise, like crates of sodas, sugar, salt, soap and other items, to sell during the Easter season.

loans.name: Saverino

texts.en:
Saverino used his previous loan to mulch his coffee plantation and buy more coffee to sell. He is a coffee  farmer who also sells produce and milk to earn extra income. He started this business to earn a living and educate his children. 

He still faces a challenge of price fluctuation and also prolonged drought. In spite of the challenges, he has a dream of becoming a model farmer and constructing a good residential house.

He is requesting a loan to buy coffee husks and manure for his coffee farm.

loans.use: to buy coffee husks and manure for his coffee farm.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 49-year-old father of six who lives in the Kitale area, which is located in the Rift valley province of Kenya. He has farmed for 24 years and earns an honest and decent income. Samuel has both crops and a dairy farm and has a small business to make ends meet. 

Although he has been making a profit, life has not been easy for Samuel. However, he has managed to overcome every challenge he faces. 

Samuel seeks a loan, via Juhudi Kilimo, to venture into horticulture farming. His location is favorable to other types of farming, due to the good road network, climate and market demand. Samuel and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life. 

Samuel is disciplined regarding finances and he plans to enter international markets to earn more income and to obtain a stable future for his family. Please support Samuel so that he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to venture into other areas of farming.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en:
Akmal is a 29-year-old married woman. She and her husband have been running a business buying and selling animals. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them, while her husband sells them to different markets in the city. Their business is providing them with enough income to support their family. 

In order to increase her earnings, Akmal has requested from Murabaha a loan of 20,000 PKR to buy more baby goats for resale purposes. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more baby goats for resale purposes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
This is John. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014, to benefit from training, especially enterprise management, to boost his business. He is 43 years old and has two children who are still in school.

He does welding to earn a living. He is applying for a Kiva loan to buy welding materials, such as metal and soldering materials. He hopes this will help meet his customers' demand, thus earning him more income to provide for his family's needs.

He is happy for Kiva's help and support.

loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en: Saeeda, age 40, is a married woman with six children.  One of her sons (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. For this reason, Saeeda has requested a loan from Murabaha of 30,000 PKR for her son, who will buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima, age 27, is a married woman. She deals in a business of selling animals with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. Currently, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more animals, such as baby goats.

loans.use: to purchase more animals, such as baby goats.

loans.name: Chaman

texts.en:
Chaman is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. Her husband (also shown in the photo), some time ago started a van driving business. Her husband owns one van and needs some financial help. He will use the amount to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van to provide better services. 

Therefore, Chaman has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR for her husband. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the van to provide better services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business buying and selling cattle along with her husband (also shown in the photo). She earns a good amount of income to cover her everyday expenditures. 

For the improvement of her business, Musarat has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market, in order to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a wall in his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice and drinks for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Thanks to John's perseverance and courage, his household can have a respectable life. John is a very energetic, hardworking and focused farmer. He hails from the Kitale area of Kenya, an area referred to as “a maize region” and their staple food is “ugali,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from maize. He is a family man, and he has three beautiful children that he really loves and adores. 

John has a wealth of experience in farming because he has farmed for 15 years and has all the farming techniques at his fingertips. John loves dairy farming. John practices mixed farming, and through that he has been able to take care of his large family, but not everything has been good for this humble and hardworking man. The Kitale area has a ready market for poultry products and eggs, and John being an enterprising person would want to take advantage of that and make profits. That is why he is kindly seeking a loan to start poultry farming. 

John has enough space on his farm and wants to make use of the space through poultry farming. Other than income from selling eggs and poultry products, John will also get manure to use in his farm, hence the money that could have been used in buying it will be saved. John projects that after a few months he will have more income to buy more poultry and also pay back the loan.

loans.use: To start poultry farming

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a 27-year-old single woman. She has been running a beauty parlor business for about two years. The man shown in the photo is her brother. 

Sidra offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hairstyling, facials, etc. Over time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. 

Now she needs to provide more customers with regular services. Therefore, she requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin care products, and creams for bleaching and whitening, in large quantities. She is confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin care products, and creams for bleaching and whitening, in large quantities.

loans.name: Vahram

texts.en: Vahram is a furniture maker from Goris town, where he lives with his parents. He makes different types of furniture: chairs, tables, wardrobes and beds. Due to his high-quality work, he receives several orders during the month. To be able to invest in his furniture production business and purchase materials needed for covering current orders, Vahram has applied for this loan. His loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program started in 2012 and since then has been providing business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify for loans through normal channels. Vahram hopes for lenders' support for his business, so he will be able to boost the furniture production and earn income for his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for materials and tools for making furniture, cover current orders and earn income for his family

loans.name: Ansar

texts.en: Ansar, age 29, is a married lady. She has been running a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. Now, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase one more cow for milking. She is hopeful that she will be able to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for milking.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 38-year-old day care operator from Mombasa. She is a married mother of a one-year-old child whose husband gives additional support. For the last ten years Linda has operated this day care and has done well.

This marks her seventh loan with VisionFund Kenya to finance her business by purchasing plastic chairs and tables for her day care center.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand more classrooms. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to have her school fully established and grow it into a primary school.

loans.use: to finance her business by purchasing plastic chairs and tables for her day care center

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-years-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small humble house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies science. He wants to complete his study and find a job in the future.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. This will help him to do his homework and write his reports easily.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Farah

texts.en:
Farah is a 21-year-old married lady who started selling clothes from her house two years ago to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of her family.

Due to the increasing living costs, Farah's income is becoming very limited. Thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary linens for her house.

Fatima hopes to expand her business further in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy necessary linens for her house

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is a designer from Gyumri town.  She lives there with her husband, two children, and mother-in-law. 

Five years ago, Alvard started her own business. She designs different types of accessories for ceremonies (candles, boxes, flower design). Realizing that the income from this service is important for her family to tackle financial hardships, Alvard would like to enlarge it. 

She asks for this loan to purchase tools and materials for providing designing service for different ceremonies. 

Her loan has been approved within the framework of joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program started in 2012 and since then has been providing business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify for loans through normal channels. 

Alvard is proud of her cooperation with SEF and Kiva and hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing designing service for different ceremonies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum, Irish potatoes, and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en:
Lamara, her husband and 11-year-old son live in Gyumri town. Four years ago, Lamara started her own business from her house. She trades in cosmetic supplies. Lamara's undertaking was successful. Over the years, she efficiently implemented her trade and receives many orders from her loyal client base. 

To be able to develop her retail business and purchase cosmetic supplies needed for current customer orders, Lamara has applied for this loan. Her loan has been approved within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program started in 2012 and since then, has been providing business start-up loans to informal businesses that do not qualify for loans through normal channels.

This is a loan that will help Lamara to invest in her business, develop it and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetic supplies needed for her current customer orders and developing retail business, so the family will have an additional source of income

loans.name: Williamson

texts.en:
Farm work is one of the most difficult jobs today due to the huge effort needed to progress. But Williamson is a man who has never given up despite the weather or the circumstances that can occur. He is always willing to get the resources for his family. He is 37 years of age and a very aggressive, hardworking and ever smiling farmer from the Thika area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns that favor farming. 

Because of the high unemployment rate, Williamson never secured any white collar job, but that never killed the inspiration he had of getting out of the poverty bracket, and he started farming five year ago. He has been making great strides. His personal source of income is milk, maize, and some small personal business that he does to make ends meet. 

Although this dedicated and hardworking farmer makes profits, he is faced with one challenge, and that is a lack of funds to start poultry farming. Thika area is a highly populated region and has a ready market for eggs and poultry products; that is why Williamson wants to take full advantage of the situation. 

Through the loan, Williamson will be able to sell his poultry in the nearby market and also to his neighbors, and he will be assured of reaping more profits and achieving his desire of succeeding.

loans.use: To pay for poultry

loans.name: Allah  Rakhi

texts.en: Allah Rakhi is a married woman.  She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales

loans.name: Bright Future School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is William. He is the head teacher of Bright Future Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kasubi in Kampala with 500 students. 

Bright Future Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. 

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Bright Future Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. William ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es:
El Sr. Primitivo tiene 55 años de edad es casado y su esposa es amas de casa, tiene 4 hijos de (20-17-15-7)años de edad todos van a la escuela. E l sr. Primitivo es una persona entusiasta y alegre que le gusta la agricultura porque gracias a ella a podido sacar adelante a toda su familia.
Dentro de los sueños de don Primitivo están la educación de sus hijos y que su parcela cuente con riego tecnificado; el préstamo servirá para la compra de abono orgánico de tara, con 23 años dentro del negocio le gusta por ser un producto forestal donde para la realización del manejo y cosecha intervienen todos los miembros familiares reduciendo así los costos de inversión.
texts.en:
Primitivo is 55 years old and married. His wife is a housewife and they have four children who all go to school, ages 20, 17, 15, and 7. Primitivo is an enthusiastic and happy person who likes agriculture because thanks to it, he has been able to get his entire family ahead.

Among his dreams are the education of his children and technical irrigation for his plot of land. The loan will serve to buy organic fertilizer for his tara trees. With 23 years in this business, he likes it because it is a forest product for which all family members are involved in carrying out the management and harvest, thereby reducing the investment costs.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his tara trees.

loans.name: Ayshan

texts.en: Ayshan is a 43-year-old, married woman who has been running a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has nine children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing her milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales to earn a good amount of income

loans.name: Fanny Cecilia

texts.es:
