En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Fanny, tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 5 hijos de 22, 18, 13, 11 y 8 años de edad, los cuatro menores estudian en colegio y escuela y son os que aun viven con ellos. Su marido es mecánico.
Doña Fanny realiza el crédito para ayudarle a su esposo el cual tiene un taller mecánico, el realiza diversos trabajos con ayuda de un operario a quien le paga por su labor, él trabaja todos los días en su taller y también sale a donde lo requieran sus clientes, allí también vende aceites, líquidos de frenos y muchos otros repuestos que el emplea en su trabajo para lo cual el requiere del crédito. Su esposo lleva más de 30 años dedicado a esta actividad con la cual se gana el sustento de toda su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar aceites y repuestos que el necesita en su taller. Lleva 7 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido ayudarle a su esposo en su trabajo. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In the canton of Olmedo, every 15 days the loan group Esfuerzo y Poder gets together. This place is known for its beautiful landscapes and for its hardworking people, dedicated to agriculture and raising animals.

Fanny lives in this place. She is 36 years old, married, and from this relationship has five children, ages 22, 18, 13, 11, and 8. The youngest four study in school and still live with them. Her husband is a mechanic.

Fanny requests the loan to help her husband with his mechanic shop. He carries out diverse work with the help of a worker that he pays for his labor. He works every day in his shop and also goes out to where his customers need him. He also sells oil, brake fluid, and many other spare parts that he uses in his work, for which he needs the loan.

Her husband has worked more than 30 years in this business, through which he is able to support his entire family. This loan is to buy oil and spare parts that he needs in his shop. She has been in the loan group for 7 years and likes it because with the loans she has been able to help her husband with his work. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy oil and spare parts.

loans.name: Nouhad

texts.en:
Nouhad is a 60-year-old married mother of five children who started a year ago selling clothes from her house to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family.
 
Nouhad is a hard worker and an ambitious woman who is trying hard to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of clothes for the upcoming spring and summer seasons.

Nouhad hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own clothes shop to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of clothes for the upcoming spring and summer seasons

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moisés tiene 29 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida en un tiangue desde hace varios años, pero además cuenta con un pequeño negocio de elaboración y venta de pupusas y bebidas frías, actividad que les permite sostener la economía de su hogar. Él habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus3 hijos una niña de 9 años y dos varones de 5 y 2 años de edad, que son su mayor alegría. Moisés desea adquirir un crédito con FUSAI para invertir en el negocio de venta de pupusas y bebidas frías que tiene con su compañera de vida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, sodas, jugos, maíz, harina de arroz, etc.
texts.en:
Moisés is 29 years old.  He is a hardworking man who has earned a living in a cattle market for several years, but he also has a small business making and selling pupusas [stuffed tortillas] and cold drinks, an occupation that allows him to support his home financially. 

He lives in his own home with his life companion and their three children—a nine-year-old girl, and two boys, ages five and two—who are his greatest joy. 

Moisés wants to get a loan with FUSAI to invest in the pupusas and cold drink sales business that he has with his life companion.  Therefore, he is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in pork rinds, soft cheese, beans, soda, juice, corn, rice flour, etc.

loans.use: to invest in pork rinds, soft cheese, beans, soda, juice, corn, rice flour, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 37 years old. She is married and blessed with eight children. 

Nancy has had a farming business for five years and it has been profitable. She will be using the loan to purchase poultry for rearing and later sell and get more income to educate her children and provide food for the family.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a great poultry farmer as well as poultry and eggs supplier and to  get the best education for her children.

loans.use: To buy poultry for rearing and later sell at a profit

loans.name: Ahmed T

texts.en: This is 40 year-old Ahmed.  He is married, and has three children aged 17, 12 and 9. In 2013, Ahmed established his Pharmacy business. He began his business just after coming back from medicine school to improve on his skills. Working six days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 2,500,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Ahmed requires a loan in order to buy more drugs for resale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits and to add to his income. In the future, Ahmed plans to expand the business and to educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Umaru.  He is married, and has three children aged 15, 10 and 5. He has one additional dependent, who assists him in the business.  

In 2000, he established his garrie (cassava flakes) and palm oil store business. He began his business just to develop himself and his family. Working six days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,726,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Umaru requires a loan in order to buy more bags of garrie to add to his business for resale. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits. 

In the future, he plans to expand his business and to build a house.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more garrie  for his shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Susan.  She is married, and has two children aged 16 and 12 years old. She has two additional dependents who live with her, and she helps them with their schooling.  In 2013, Susan established her provision shop and bar business. She began her business just to improve her income capacity and assist her husband. Working six days a week, 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,881,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000.  Susan has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more cartons of powdered milk, sugar, mayonnaise, sardines, etc. for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and improve her business. In the future, Susan plans to assist her husband in the running of the home and to educate the children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her shop

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Meet Henry, a hardworking farmer from the Nyamira area of Kenya, who is proud to be a husband and a father of three children. Henry started farming in 2008, which is the same year he married his lovely wife. On his small farm are a dairy cow, 13 heads of poultry and over 1,000 trees. Henry's main income sources are milk, lumber and a monthly salary from his job. 

Henry is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed. The cowshed will shelter his calf from harsh weather and provide a good environment for her development. Henry will use income from other sources to make loan repayments. His cowshed investment will pay off once the calf grows healthy and strong and becomes productive.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: This is 37 year-old Isatu.  She is married and has three children aged 18, 15, and 7 years old. In 2005, Isatu established her rice, onions, salt and assorted items business. She began her business because she wants to help develop her family and to be self-reliant. Her business is located at city centre and her main customers are both men and women. Working six days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy more bags of rice, onions, salt and assorted items. She hopes that this loan will increase her stock level of her additional income. In the future, Isatu plans to build a dwelling home and educate her children up to university. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, onions, salt and assorted items.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a farmer with many years of work experience. He has enjoyed working independently all his life. He always believes that was best for him, and today he confirms it. Thomas is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who hails from Molo, a rural town in Kenya. He is a family man, and he has a lovely family whom he really loves and cherishes. 

Thomas and his wife work as a team supporting each other, and have practiced mixed farming for the past ten years. Thomas has always had an affinity for farming. Because of the liking that he has for farming, he has even nicknamed one of his cows, which makes him a very proud farmer, especially when he is milking his cows. 

Through his dairy cow, he is able to get between 10-20 liters a day, and this helps him support his family. Thomas practices crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements; that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. 

Through the loan, he will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Thomas is very visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. 

Thomas believes that through the loan, he will turn around his family life and be able to give his children a solid education background. He hopes to get this loan so that his dream becomes real.

loans.use: to buy farm implements, high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil for resale

loans.name: Xaverine

texts.en: Xaverine is 60 years old. She is married with six children between 6 and 19 years old. They all go to school.  She has a restaurant and she has been doing the business for the past 21 years. Her husband is a businessman. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes, beans and meat in order to make more food to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, beans and meat in order to make more food to sell.

loans.name: Bena

texts.en: Bena is 27 years, married with two children and currently working with Bundibugyo district local government as an office typist. She took the job due to her desire for career development and wants the family to own a decent home in future. Her main challenge is the low salary. Bena has requested a loan to buy building materials such as bricks to construct her family house.

loans.use: to buy  building materials such as bricks to construct the family house.

loans.name: Medard

texts.en:
Medard is a 30 year old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. His dream is to build a permanent house for his children and give them basic education plus buying a car to ease their movements. 

He has been a retailer for the last six years and his major hardship is market competition. He gets additional income from farming which helps him to meet his daily obligations. He has a vision of  expanding his business to other areas. 

He intends to use the loan to buy construction materials such as cement and sand and to pay for labor.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement and sand and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell. 

She still sells second-hand clothes as her main source of income. The main reason why Gladys ventured into this business was to supplement her husband's income which was not enough to sustain  their family. 

Though she still faces the challenges of competition and seasonal markets for her clothes, she has hopes of owning a wholesale boutique and educating her child. Gladys is requesting for a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell during the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell during the Easter season.

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos is a 38-year-old hardworking man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He owns a retail shop as his main source of income. He started this business with the aim of boosting his income. He also earns extra income from being a produce farmer. He hopes to increase his profits, however he faces a main challenge of inadequate capital to meet the increasing demands and price fluctuations. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more general merchandise like crates of sodas, sugar, salt, soap and others to sell during the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy more general merchandise like crates of sodas, sugar, salt, soap and others to sell during the Easter season.

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a twenty-six-year-old hardworking married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a bar shop as her main source of income alongside farming. 

The main reason why Claire ventured into this business was to get self employment. Though she faces the challenges of competition and price fluctuations, she has hopes of owning a wholesale depot and educating her children.

Claire is requesting a loan to buy more crates of sodas and beer to sell during the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy more crates of sodas and beer to sell during the Easter season.

loans.name: Good Daddy School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Grace. She is the Head Teacher of Good Daddy Nursery and Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Kakoba in Mbarara with 280 students. 

Good Daddy Nursery and Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. 

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.  The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Good Daddy Nursery and Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Grace ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is a farmer from Mkchyan village of Ararat region. She is married and has three school-aged children. 

Armine is 39 years old, and she is already skilled and devoted to her work as a farmer. On her farm, Armine owns three greenhouses where she cultivates different types of agricultural goods (flowers and vegetables).  Her husband helps Armine around their farm and the harvest which they get is very important for family's living. 

With the hope of enlarging their farm and earning greater profit from it, Armine has applied for this loan. She needs to purchase supplies for renovation of the greenhouse (pipes, wires, polyethylene cover) and fertilizer for land cultivation to enlarge the farming business. 

Because this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who did not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for renovation of the greenhouse (pipes, wires, polyethylene cover) and fertilizer for land cultivation to enlarge the farming business

loans.name: Mbarara Preparatrix School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Deus. He is the Head Teacher of Mbarara Preparatrix School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Biharwe in Mbarara with 520 students. 

Mbarara Preparatrix School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. 

Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Mbarara Preparatrix School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Deus ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Morning Star School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is John. He is the Head teacher of Morning Star Junior School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Kawaala in Kampala with 350 students. Morning Star Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Morning Star Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. John ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Daystar School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Stephen. He is the Head Teacher of Daystar Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-Urban area of Nyakakoni in Mbarara with 435 students. Daystar Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. 

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Daystar Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Stephen ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Gedeon

texts.en: Gedeon is 32 years old. He is single, but he has his own house where he is living with his parents and his brothers. Gedeon is a mason and he works very hard to support his family. In fact, Gedeon is the only person at the house that earns some money, nevertheless he is happy to have his family. He needs a loan to make improvements at his house and do some repair work. He hopes you can trust him.

loans.use: to make improvements at his house and do some repair work

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.en: Fabiola is 25 years old, married and she lives at her parents-in-law's house. Fabiola is the mother of a three-year-old daughter. Fabiola is a seamstress and she makes sweaters and other clothes. Fabiola's husband is a taxi driver and although he works all day he can t help his wife to improve her business. Fabiola needs a loan to buy fabrics to make more clothes. She hopes you can help her. In the picture Fabiola is in her workshop located in her parents-in-law's house. She would like to have her own house in the future.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for her business

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina is a farmer. She grows and sells rice. She is a 49-year-old married woman with five children from Talibon, Bohol. Two of her children are still attending school. Aside from that, she also engages in a fruit vending business. Her husband is a carpenter.  In order to continue her livelihood, she has decided to take a loan.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers for the farm and additional stock of fruit. These will improve the yield of her farm and enable her to sell more fruit.  Thus, this will augment her income and help her be able to balance her finances. She could continue to send her children to school and provide them with proper diets.

 In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the farm and additional stock of fruit

loans.name: Sama

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Sama.  She is married and has two children aged 10 and 8. She has one additional dependent to assist in the business.  In 2000, Sama established her plastic shoes, household utensils like plastic buckets and sets of pans, etc. business. She began her business just to be self-reliant. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,376,400 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Sama requires a loan in order to improve her business by buying more pairs of shoes, buckets, sets of pans, etc. for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and improve her capital in other to generate more profit. In the future, Sama plans to expand her business, to build more houses and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more slippers for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy PVC tubes, faucets, and elbows and to pay for laborers to instal potable water in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more crates of sodas and beer to sell during the Easter season.

loans.name: Esau

texts.en:
Esau used his previous loan to buy cows for slaughtering and stocking his butcher shop ahead of the Christmas season. He is a 33-year-old, hardworking married man with three children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He still operates a butcher shop where he earns his living. However, he also practices farming to earn extra income. He started this business to improve his family's standard of living. Esau still experiences hardships due to the market's price fluctuations. Nevertheless, he hopes to expand his business, educate his children, and become rich.

Esau is requesting a loan to buy cows for slaughtering and stocking his butcher shop ahead of the Easter season.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughtering and stocking his butcher shop ahead of the Easter season.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 29 years old, married with two children and currently working with the Bundibugyo district local Government as an office attendant. He took  the job due to lack of school fees to pursue further studies. He wants to buy land and be able to construct a house in the future; His main challenge is low pay. Nicholas has requested a loan to complete payment for land.

loans.use: to pay for land for house construction.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 38-year-old hardworking married man living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in livestock whereby he rears cows for fattening, alongside motor vehicle transport to earn an extra income. He started this business to earn enough money and educate his children. He hopes to expand his business, however his main challenge is prolonged drought. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more bulls for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more bulls for fattening.

loans.name: Oomnath

texts.en:
Oomnath once again thanks all the Kiva lenders for their help and for doing such a great job. He repaid his loan fully, and with the profits he could pay for the tuition of his children and save for the future of his family. 

Oomnath wants to continue his rice cultivation and for this he wants to borrow SRD 12,000.

loans.use: To purchase diesel, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en: Barbara is a married woman but her husband works traveling around Bolivia. Barbara sells milk to earn some money and she needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Barbara is a senior citizen but she still has the energy to work hard. She hopes you can help her because she only has her husband to collaborate with her, and the money he makes is not enough.

loans.use: To buy a milking cow

loans.name: Ashel

texts.en:
Ashel, who is 19 years old, lives with her brothers and parents and helps with their rent. She works hard selling cosmetics, visiting clients at offices and beauty parlors, but she also wants to go to college.  

Ashel needs a loan to buy more beauty products to increase her sales. She needs your help.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a compressor for his business, which will allow him to maintain his tools in better conditions and to improve the appearance of his shop.

loans.name: Roopchand

texts.en:
Roopchand thanks all of his Kiva lenders from the bottom of his heart. He repaid his loan fully. Roopchand wants to renovate his house, and with the profits from this season he could save some money. But that is not enough.

Roopchand is planning to continue with his rice production, so he can save more, enough to renovate his house. He wants to buy inputs like diesel oil, fertilizers and pesticides for the coming season, so he applied for a loan of SRD 10,000.

loans.use: To purchase inputs for his rice production.

loans.name: Roopchand

texts.en: Roopchand is very happy with the help he got from the Kiva lenders and thanks them a lot. He repaid his loan fully, and with the profits he could save money for a rice plot, but that is not enough. He also wants to build a house for his family and for this he will work hard. To continue with his rice cultivation, he needs SRD 13,000 to buy inputs like fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: M'balu

texts.en: This is 37-year-old M'balu. She is married and has two children aged 8 years and 15 years. In 2005, M'balu established her provision and grocery business. She began her business because she wants to earn more profit and to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Her business is located at the city center and her main customers are both men and women. Working six days a week, 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,500,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. M'balu requires a loan in order to buy more drinks and provisions. She hopes that this loan will help her to increase the level of her additional income. In the future, M'balu plans to be a big supplier to the business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Mechie

texts.en:
Mechie is 39 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Mechie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Mechie requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mechie has been farming rice for two years, and she has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mechie would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 44 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Merly has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Merly requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Merly has been in this business for five years. In the future, Merly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Assanatu

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Assanatu. She is married and has two children aged 23 and 20 years old. In 2012, Assanatu established her rice, cement, and building materials business. She began her business to help her husband support the home and family. Her business is located in the outskirts of the city and her main customers are men and women. Working six days a week, 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Assanatu requires a loan in order to purchase more bags of rice, cement and building materials for resale. She was not able to meet her plans but has improved her business as previously planned.

She hopes that this loan will help her expand her business and get more profit so she can adequately take care of her needs. In the future, Assanatu plans to support her children’s education to university level and improve her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of rice, cement and building materials for resale.

loans.name: Anne J.

texts.en: This is 39-year-old Anne. She is married and has four children aged 20, 13, 9, and 11 years. In 2001, Anne established her pharmacy business. She began her business because of low salary income. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are people of the general community. Working six days a week, 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 850,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Anne requires a loan in order to buy more drugs for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her. In the future, Anne plans to become a drugstore owner and open a pharmacy in a different business outlet. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale

loans.name: Suglo Mali Nyori - Tampoin Group

texts.en:
Alimatu is a 40-year-old businesswoman from Tampion in the Northern region of Ghana. Alimatu is married and has six children. Alimatu is the individual pictured raising her hand among members squatting.
	
Alimatu is a member of a shea butter processing group that has been in business for the past 20 years. The name of the group is Suglo Mali Nyori - Tampoin. Alimatu earns a good profit from the business, as the group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on more improved ways of extracting shea butter in the shea butter processing business, such that they can always produce premium quality for the Ghanaian market and for export markets.

Alimatu and Suglo Mali Nyori - Tampoin have asked for a loan of GHS 6,400. Her share of the loan is GHS 300 which would help her to buy shea nuts for processing. With this loan, Alimatu would earn more income so as to repay this loan and pay her children's health care expenses and food.

Alimatu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To buy shea nuts for processing.

loans.name: Reina Cristina

texts.es: Reina de 36 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que cada día pone todo su esfuerzo para salir adelante apoyada en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir actividad que realiza desde hace 7 años, pero además buscando obtener mejores ingresos económicos vende platillos típicos por las tardes. Reina habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 10 años ambos, ya que son gemelos. Reina desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que desea realizar la mejora antes del próximo invierno.
texts.en:
Reina is 36 years old. She is an enterprising woman who every day makes every effort to succeed with her business selling clothing, an activity that she has done for the last 7 years. Also, she looks for increased income by selling typical dishes in the evenings.

Reina lives in her own home with her two children, both who are 10 years old because they are twins. Reina wants to change the roof on her home, so she has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized steel, wood, and nails to change the roof of her home as soon as possible, as she wants to make the improvement before next winter.

loans.use: to invest in galvanized steel, wood, and nails to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Terrous Group

texts.en: Rosemary, who is in her early 30s, is single with one kid who is in school.  She has been running a grocery store for three years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to after midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Rosemary's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to increase drinks in the grocery store and meet her customers' demands.  She dreams of having a big grocery. Rosemary will share this loan with her loan group, Terrous, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase drinks in the grocery store and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Meliza Estefania

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Meliza, tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen una hija de 5 años la cual estudia en escuela. Su marido trabaja en el municipio local.
Doña Meliza es una mujer que le gusta trabajar con sus ingresos ayudarle a su marido a salir adelante, ella tiene un comedor en un local que arrienda en un centro médico de la ciudad, allí ella todos los días prepara deliciosos desayunos y almuerzos que son del agrado de su distinguida clientela que a diario se sirven en su local, también vende allí colas, golosinas entre otras cosas, ella varia el menú para que sus clientes siempre tengan variedad en sus platos y estén a gusto con lo que ella prepara, lleva 3 años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse algo por su cuenta.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan la fundación y las personas que hacen posible que ella reciba su crédito.  Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante y darles lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
The “Esfuerzo y Poder” Credit Group meets every fifteen days in the Olmedo Canton. It is known for its beautiful scenery and hardworking people who devote themselves to agriculture and raising animals.

Meliza lives here. She is 22 years old and she maintains a common-law marriage, from which she has a 5-year-old daughter who is studying in school. Her husband works in the local municipality. 

Meliza is a woman who likes working, and with her income, she helps her husband to get ahead.  She has a cafeteria in a space that she rents in a medical center in the city, where every day she prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches that please the distinguished customers that she serves daily. She also sells colas and snacks there, among other things. She varies the menu, so that her customers  always have a variety on their plates and enjoy what she prepares.  She has been in this business for three years, and it allows her to earn something on her own. 

She is going to use this loan to purchase meat, seafood, and other supplies for preparing the food.  She has been in the credit group for three loan cycles, and she likes it because of the help that the foundation gives her, and the people who make it possible for her to receive her loan. 

Her dreams are to have a large restaurant and to give the best to her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, seafood, and other supplies.

loans.name: Lesvia Margarita

texts.es:
En el cantón Olmedo cada quince días  se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Esfuerzo y Poder, este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales. 
En este lugar vive la señora Lesvia, tiene 58 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad, uno de ellos  aun viven con ellos. Su marido es agricultor.
Doña Lesvia  es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar en vista que él en el campo no gana mucho, ella  tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de colas, aguas, golosinas, hielo, entre otras, tiene un billar en el cual muchas personas se reúnen en las tardes y noches, ella también tiene un corral en el cual cría pollo, esto lo empezó hace poco tiempo pero le ha servido de mucho ya que sus ganancias han aumentado por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sodas, dulces, golosinas y alimento para los pollos que tiene.  Lleva más de 6 años en el Grupo De Crédito  y le gusta por la ayuda que reciben con los créditos. Sus sueños son tener una gran tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The Esfuerzo y Poder communal bank meets in the Olmedo canton every 15 days.  This place is known for its beautiful scenery and for its hard-working people who work in agriculture and raise animals.

Lesvia, age 58, lives in this place.  She is married, and they have four adult children.  One of them still lives with them.  Her husband is a farmer.  Lesvia is a woman who likes to work in order to help her husband with the household expenses because he does not earn a lot in the fields.  

She has a small business selling sodas, water, candy, and ice, among others.  She has a pool hall where a lot of people get together in the afternoons and evenings.  She also has a pen where she raises chickens.  She started it a little while ago, but it has served her well because its profits have increased for the good of her family. 

She will use this loan to buy sodas, sweets, candy, and feed for the chickens that she has.  She has been in the communal bank for over six years.  She likes it for the help they get with the loans.  Her dream is to have a large grocery store.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sweets, candy, and feed for chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fast-moving medicines and meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Kisarawe One Group

texts.en:
Mather, who is in her mid 50s is married with seven children, three boys and four girls who are still going to school.  She has been running a small store for six years where she sells things such as sugar, beans, salt, sweets, biscuits, disposable napkins, soap, cigarettes, flour, cooking oils, paraffin, milk, juice, sodas, water, sarongs, fabrics, etc.  She works from 8 am until 7 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mather's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase the small store stocks and has paid back all of her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, build her own house, repay the loans and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase the items in her small store and meet her customers' demands. She dreams of making her store into a big general store.

Mather will share this loan with her loan group "Kisarawe One", which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase the items in her small store and meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Alice works hard to support her family. She has a laundry business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising chickens and selling peanuts.

Alice has been sustaining her business activities through her past thirteen loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She is now borrowing 14,000 PHP to buy additional detergent for her business.

Alice hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to earn enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional detergent for her laundry business.

loans.name: Isunga Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a 40-year-old male Ugandan Munyoro by tribe and is married with three children aged 15, 13 and 10, all of whom attend school.

Josephine is a farmer and produce dealer but he also sells waragi in order.  Josephine has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to buy bananas to make local gin which he expects to sell to his customers in Kampala and pay back the loan.

His dream for the future is to educate all of his children to university level, but he says he faces challenges of  high transport costs and limited capital.

loans.use: To buy bananas for processing into local gin

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz, a 30-year-old housewife, is a mother of two children. She lives with her family in Lahore. Her husband owns a fruit shop. He has been in this business for the last five years. Given their family's big size, meeting the regular expenses is not easy. Their children are growing up and their needs are increasing. 

With the hope to make his business more lucrative, her husband wishes to buy fresh seasonal fruits such as oranges, bananas, apples, etc. With this investment he is hopeful that he will attract more customers and increase his customers. Shehnaz has therefore requested a loan to help her husband from BRAC Pakistan, a Kiva field partner. They are pleased and hopeful to reap its benefits in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fruits for her husband's business

loans.name: Ngan's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ngan is a Thai ethnic woman who has been participating in the program of M7-MFI since January 2009. She lives with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family lives mainly based on cultivation and breeding, so the income after deducting all costs is just about 50 to 60 VND million per year. This income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses with a little amount left. She cannot do anything with that remaining amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for the corn tree and sugar cane but she does not have enough money. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for that purpose. She will try to find an extra job to work hard to get the money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time. She hopes the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in growing corn trees and sugar cane, and that next year it will bring double the productivity as compared with the last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the corn tree and sugar cane

loans.name: Elio Cesar

texts.en:
Elio Cesar is 41 years old, married and has a daughter who is 16 years old. He works in retail. He has been selling plastic home products for the last four years. Before that he used to work in an industrial maintenance company. Elio Cesar sells hangers, plastic curtains for bathrooms and all types of plastic items. 

He is asking for a loan to buy inventory and hopes to increase his sales. He says that his biggest accomplishment is supporting his family and sending his daughter to school.

loans.use: To buy inventory of plastic home products.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro is an experienced dairy farmer who decided to invest in a biodigester in order to take advantage of his cows' and sheep's manure. He is looking forward to transforming something he used to consider as waste into productive resources: biogas to cook and heat water, and organic fertilizer to increase his corn and kidney beans fields' yield in a sustainable way. 

This investment will allow Pedro to displace the expensive LP gas and chemical fertilizers, as well as the wood his family used to collect in the surrounding area to cook. Inhaling toxic smoke on a daily basis used to be part of this family's daily routine. By treating the waste and providing a clean option to wood, the biodigester will contribute to improving Pedro's family's health and direct environment, while he will be saving money and become more self-sufficient. With his savings, Pedro plans to buy additional cows to expand his milk production.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to purchase a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.en:
Maria Antonia is 32 years old, married and has a 9-year-old son. She lives in her parents' house and has been teaching fitness classes for more than 10 years in a place that a friend lends her. She also works in a beauty saloon. 

She is asking for a loan to buy equipment for her fitness classes. She says that her biggest achievement is achieving financial stability and building a house.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her fitness classes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is a 40-year-old woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She earns a living through her hog-raising business. She is requesting to take a loan to pay for the repair of her pig pen and to buy piglets to raise. Marilyn believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her pig pen and to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Amelinda

texts.en: Amelinda is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is meat and fish vendor. Amelinda has been in the business for more than 19 years. This is her source of income. She also earns additional income from hog raising and through her small grocery store. Amelinda is asking to take a loan to buy more meat and fish to sell and additional piglets to raise. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more meat and fish to sell and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. Alma lives in the town of Ormoc City, Leyte with her family.  For more than 7 years, Alma has operated her sari-sari or grocery store selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She also has a rice farm in her place. Alma is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, rice, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, cooking oil, bread and biscuits, etc. A loan will help her improve her inventory thus attracting more buyers into her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, rice, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, cooking oil, bread and biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Ramilyn

texts.en:
Ramilyn is a 27-year-old married woman with two children, who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ramilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Ramilyn requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

In the future, Ramilyn would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna works hard to support herself. Myrna is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Myrna requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old and is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Evelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines and has being in this business for four years. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Haydee is 38 years old and all of her children are in school.

Haydee has a frozen food retail business in the Philippines. Haydee requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Haydee has been in this business for five years. In the future, Haydee would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 45 years old, married and has four children. One of her children is in school.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for eight years, and she has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 45 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. 

Edna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Edna has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jacklyn

texts.en:
Jacklyn is 33 years old and has three children. Jacklyn is married and all of her children are in school.

Jacklyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jacklyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jacklyn has been raising pigs for three years, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jacklyn would like to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 48 years old, married with one child.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, milk, soft drinks, detergent, spices, personal care products, etc.

Jenelyn has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell charcoal business.

Jenelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, coffee, milk, soft drinks, detergent, spices, personal care products, etc

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 37-year-old married woman with seven children. Five of her children are in school; she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Nenita has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing.

Nenita has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Catherine works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Catherine is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to  buy fish nets, bamboo and other materials to use in her fishing business.

Catherine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, bamboo and other materials to use in her business

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a 46-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Riza has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Riza requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy item such as pants, blouses, slippers and school uniforms.

Riza has been in this business for five years. In the future, Riza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy item such as pants, blouses, slippers and school uniforms.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are still in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been in business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Teresita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, sacks of feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Vien's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vien, is a Thai ethnic woman. She is living with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation so the annual income after deducting costs is just enough to cover her family’s living expenses at their most economical spending and save a little amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for corn trees and sugar cane for the next crop but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer.

Mrs. Vien really hopes the loan amount will help her family invest effectively on corn trees and sugar canes at high productivity, and the next year it will reward her family with a redundant harvest. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn trees and sugar cane.

loans.name: Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario, está integrado por 3 mujeres luchadoras (AUDELIA, JUANA y OFELIA), todas de la etnia miskita, viven en la comunidad “Kilometro 51” que comunica a la carretera Puerto Cabezas-Managua. Se organizaron recientemente, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios. Decidieron nombrar al grupo “Buena Esperanza”, porque a través del financiamiento les trae una buena esperanza de mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios. Tambien, porque es el nombre de la finca de una de las integrantes del grupo.

Audelia: Es la coordinadora del grupo, es una joven amable de 26 años de edad, con cualidades de líder y deseos de superación. Casada con 4 hijos que estudian su primaria. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor y electricista de manera informal. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde hace 2 años estableció una mini pulpería en el corredor de su vivienda de tambo y madera. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Bilwi: Chiverías y granos básicos, venderlos a precios accesibles a sus clientes de su comunidad. Ella sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
This communal bank is comprised of 3 enterprising women: Audelia, Juana, and Ofelia.  They are all of the Miskita ethnic group, and they live in the "Kilometer 51" community that connects with the Puerto Cabezas-Managua highway.  They organized the group recently with the goal of getting financing for their small businesses.  They decided to name the group "Buena Esperanza" (Good Expectations) because these loans are giving them good expectations for increasing their income and improving their living conditions, ensuring the education of their children, and expanding their businesses.  Also, the name is that of a farm owned by one of the members of the group.

Audelia is the coordinator of the group.  She is a kind, 26 year-old youth who has the qualities of a leader and a desire to succeed.  She is married and has 4 children who attend elementary school.  Her husband works as a farmer and he also works informally as an electrician.  Audelia started up a mini-store two years ago on the patio of her home, built on stilts and made with wood, with the goal of having her own income and contributing to the household expenses and the education of her children.  She is requesting her first loan to buy products in Bilwi, including snacks and consumer staples, to sell at affordable prices to her customers in her community.  Audelia dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy products for her store

loans.name: Han's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Han, born in 1971, is a Thai ethnic woman. She lives with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province. 

Her family life is mainly based on cultivation and breeding, so the income of harvesting is about above VND 50 million, but after deducting all costs, it is just enough for covering the family’s living expenses and to save a little amount. However, the saved amount is not enough to buy fertilizer for the coming crop of coffee. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the coffee.

She will work hard to earn money to repay the loan for M7-MFI and hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively on the coffee field, and thanks to it together with her working hard, the next crop of coffee will be laden with fruits.

loans.use: to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the coffee crop.

loans.name: Thoa's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoa, born in 1990, is a Thai ethnic woman and has been part of the program of M7-MFI since 2013. She currently lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.  

Her family’s main income is from cultivation, so the income after deducting costs is just enough for covering food for the whole family and saving a little amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for coffee, but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the next coffee crop.

She very much expects that the loan amount will help her family with good conditions to invest in their coffee field, and the coming crop will bring her family coffee trees laden with fruit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the next coffee crop.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Lorenzo is a typical small dairy farmer, who owns a few cows and lives from selling their milk. He also produces their forage by cultivating corn in a field close to his house, for which he used to buy expensive chemical fertilizers, in addition to the costly LP gas for the house. He made the decision to purchase a biodigester in order to take advantage of a free and widely available resource on his farm: his cows' manure. The natural methanization process taking place inside the biodigester will produce enough biogas to cook and heat water in the house, as well as nutrient-rich organic fertilizer to increase the yield of his corn field in a sustainable way. As Lorenzo will shift to an efficient and cost-effective way of producing his own energy and fertilizer, he will reduce the operational costs of his farm, protect the environment and improve his family's quality of life. Indeed, treating his animal's manure will lead to the elimination of flies and bad smells it used to attract and eliminate the production of greenhouse gases. With his savings, Lorenzo plans to expand his milk production by buying additional cows and investing in a milking machine.

This loan represents 20% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part is covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 6 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. 

Juditha is engaged in the retail sales of video tapes, cellphone batteries,  and accessories. 

Judith has been in this business for more than 9 years now. 

Juditha wants to take a loan to buy more video tapes and cellphone batteries to sell. 

Juditha believes that a loan will help her improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more video tapes and cellphone batteries to sell

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 47 and a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is single and started her own business to support herself and her aging parents and their personal and household needs.

Cherry has had a doormat-making business for seven years already. Doormats in the Philippines are such a major and common household item. Every household has at least two or three doormats in their homes to keep/minimize the dust. Her doormats are of different colors and designs that make them look nice and attractive in homes. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 900 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan which she will use to buy additional raw materials like fabric and thread. This will in turn boost her business income as she expands her business. She is thanking God in advance for the financial help that will be given to her and for a good return on her investment, for it will be a great help in their daily sustenance.

Cherry trusts that by God's grace her business will continue to increase.  She prays for guidance, good health and long life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabrics, thread and other materials to make doormats.

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina, 43, is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is widowed and has dedicated her life to raising her two children, one of whom is a high school student and the other one who is already working. She works hard to to support herself and her children.

Ma. Cristina has had a rag-making business for seven years already. She makes rags for different uses and of various sizes. These are round palm-sized ones used for washing, cleaning, dusting cabinets and kitchen counters, and she also makes large doormats. In the Philippines, rags are a major item for housekeeping and cleaning; every household has them. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan which she will use to buy additional materials like fabricand  thread for her to sew rags. This will in turn boost her business income as she expands her business.  She is thanking God in advance for the financial help that will be given her and for a good return on her investment, for it will surely help send her high school child to school and fund their daily needs.  

Ma. Cristina hopes to maintain and grow her rag-making business and aims to give her child a college education. She prays for God's guidance and blessings for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for cloth, threads and other materials need to make rags.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is engaged in a food vending business selling home cooked foods to the people in her place. Editha has been in the business for several years. Editha would like to take a loan to buy more ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, rice, etc. Editha believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients such as meat, vegetables, cooking oil, condiments, rice, etc

loans.name: Perpetua

texts.en: Perpetua is a 53-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children from Ormoc City, Leyte. Perpetua runs a small sari-sari or variety store in her place. Perpetua has been in the business for more than 10 years. Perpetua would like to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell such as rice, canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and detergents, cooking oil and condiments, etc. A loan will enable her to improve her inventory thus attracting more buyers into her store. In the future, Perpetua hopes of making her business a profitable one.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as rice, canned goods, noodles, sodas and beverages, soap and detergents, cooking oil and condiments, etc

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna is 43 years old and married with five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Juna has a fishing business in the Philippines. Juna requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Juna has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Juna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Ma. Cecile

texts.en:
Ma. Cecile is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Cecile dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fouzia

texts.en:
Fouzia, aged 35, is a mother of two sons and one daughter. 

Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, cloth etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Fouzia, is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. Her husband will purchase a cloth stitching machine with the help of the loan. 

Fouzia is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cloth stitching machine for her husband's tailoring work.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 48 years old, married, and has seven children, three of her children are presently in school.

Merlita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.  Merlita has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Merlita requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, sacks of feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, sacks of feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 61 years old and is married with ten children, one of whom is in school.

Rosario works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her store. Rosario has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Rosario aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 44-year-old married woman with four children. Three of her children are in school.

Josephine is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a business selling sea-shells in the Philippines, and has been in this business for nineteen years. Josephine has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more sea-shells to sell.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea-shells to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Arlena

texts.en:
Ma. Arlena is 51 years old and is married with six children. With two children in school, Ma. Arlena works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Arlena runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as bread, soft-drinks, canned goods and other groceries.  She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Ma. Arlena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 39-year-old house wife who looks after her family including two children. She is a very hardworking and punctual lady. 

Her husband is the sole earner for the family. He works in a business buying necessary raw materials from the market for the preparation of laundry related items, such as laundry soaps, detergents, surfs etc. He works hard and honestly for the better earning to support her family; he is providing better detergents and other necessary cleaning items to the launders as well as retailers.

Amina wants to take loan so that her husband would be able to get more raw items and prepare maximum and reliable laundry items. In this way Amina's husband is able to provide better financial support to the family to maintain their living standards.

Amina is very thankful to kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's business making laundry related items such as soaps, detergents, surfs etc.

loans.name: Nhung's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung, born in 1993, is an ethnic Thai woman. She currently lives with her husband and her lovely daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from cultivation, so the income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and to save a little amount. She wants to buy fertilizer for the coming coffee crop but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the coffee.
	
She very much expects the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in buying fertilizer for the coffee field leading to high productivity, and next year it will bring her family coffee trees laden with fruits. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for their coffee plants

loans.name: Anh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Anh, born in 1971, is an Kinh ethnic majority woman. Her family consists of three members, including her husband, her son and her. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from breeding, so the annual income by selling several pig herds after deducting all costs is about VND 50 million to VND 60 million. However, that income is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and they have saved the little amount left. Nevertheless, that saved amount is not enough to invest in expanding the sow-breeding business. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.
	
She expects the loan will help her family have money to invest effectively in breeding, and the next year this breeding model can provide her family enough breeding sows by itself so that she doesn’t have to buy sows from the outside. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the sow-breeding business

loans.name: Kimhak

texts.en:
Kimhak,a farmer and a village chief, lives with his 6 children in Koh Tamao village that is far from a power grid. 

As a farmer and also a village chief, Kimhak and 2 independent children earn a living from 4 hectares of land. 

He needs to get up early each morning to go to the field. However, his home energy source (car battery) is not reliable. It is easily damaged and needs to be charged every 2 or 3 days. Sometimes because of his busy schedule, he doesn’t have time to charge the battery and the whole family ends up in pitch black conditions for the whole night. 

He decided to apply to KIVA for a loan to a buy high quality home solar energy system. After using solar home energy, he believes his family condition would be better and safer. He also can save time and money on utilities.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Koh Tamov Village, Kampong Preahkorki Commune, Bor

loans.name: Mai's Group

texts.en: Mrs Mai, born in 1961, is the Kinh ethnic majority woman. She has been participating in the program of M7-MFI since January 2009. Her family consists of four members, including her husband, her son, her daughter and Mrs. Mai. Her family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main income is mostly based on her salary, so it is just enough to cover the family’s living expenses and save a little amount. However, the saved amount is not enough to invest in raising chickens. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in raising chickens. She hopes the loan amount will help her family have capital to invest effectively in breeding chickens, and in the future the breeding-chicken model will bring her family a considerable profit. For herself, she will work hard to get money to repay the loan from M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to borrow a loan to invest in raising chickens

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Hin and her husband (Au) own a small business with a rice milling machine and make Khmer white wine in Sror Mor village Kompong Thom. Besides their small business at home, Hin and her husband own two hectares of rice field. They need a lot of energy to run their business till night time; however, a car battery is not reliable. Sometimes the battery runs out without warning. They have no choice but to stay in pitch darkness for a day until morning. 

Hin is applying for a KIVA loan to buy solar home systems to sustain her business’s energy and also her family's usage. After using solar home systems, they can increase their working hours, save time and also money on utilities.

They have three dependent children.

loans.use: to pay for solar home systems.

location.town: Sror Mor Village, Phann Nheurm Commune, Prasat Bal

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Living in Chhnok Tru fishing community with his wife and two children, Sarin has worked as a Forest Service law enforcement officer over 30 years. 

Beside working for government, his wife (Sarorn) sells vegetables and desert to contribute more income to family. Living in an area without power, he has to spend time and money everyday to charge batteries because his family needs energy to generate light during early morning preparations for their business. After attending a community visit held by a reliable solar energy company, he and his wife decided to apply to KIVA to buy reliable solar home systems. He believes solar home systems will reduce his utility fees and also make his family's conditions more convenient. His wife can get up early morning with bright light, and he also has no concern about sudden power outages from the battery.

loans.use: to pay for solar home systems.

location.town: Chhnok Tru Village,Chhnok Tru Commune, Boribo Dist

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
