Say, a 70-year-old man with two independent children, earns a living by farming in Koh Tamov village. Spending almost the rest of his life raising two children, he wants to have a comfortable life. Currently, he is still keeping on farming and helps his childrens' businesses. 

Say is of retired age; however he still needs to recharge batteries every several day since his children are busy with their farming. Seeing the difficulty of using car batteries, Say was recommended by the neighborhood to buy solar home energy. As a result, Say decided to apply to KIVA because he believes solar home energy can enhance his living lifestyle and also save utility fees for his family.

loans.use: to pay for solar home systems.

location.town: Koh Tamov Village, Kampong Preahkorki Commune, Bor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for solar home systems.

loans.name: Melogen

texts.en:
Melogen is a 44-year-old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is engaged in selling soft drinks and other beverages. Melogen has been in the business for several years now. This is the source of her income.   

Melogen is asking to take a loan to buy more soft drinks and beverages to sell. Melogen believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks  and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a sari-sari store owner from Ormoc City, Leyte. Arlene is 43 years old, married and has two children. She has been in the business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. 

Arlene is asking to take a loan to buy more groceries to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits, among others. Arlene believes that a loan will help her improve her inventories thus attracting more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Arlene hopes of making her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, cooking oil and condiments, bread and biscuits, among others.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is 45 years old, married and has four children. Her youngest child attends school. Gina used to manage a hog raising business but due to unstable income she decided to stop it. Now Gina and her child are involved in a motorcycle transport business. Her son provides the transport business for income. Gina is now asking for additional revolving capital to be used in the business. She will buy crude oil and gasoline and pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle. She hopes to improve their income and keep offering safe travel to all her son's passengers.

loans.use: to buy crude oil and gasoline and pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 45 year old married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte and a mother of two children.

Jocelyn has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.

Jocelyn is asking to take a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and animal feed. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
Magnolia, 58, is a married woman from Ormoc City, Leyte, and a mother of five grown up children.

Magnolia has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than five years now. Magnolia is asking to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

Magnolia believes that a loan will help her improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio, 55, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Emerita, a homemaker, who takes care of her grandchild who goes to elementary school. Virgilio works hard to provide for his family's daily needs and helps to send his grandchild to school.

Virigilio owns and operates his own transport jeepney service. He has a single unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney. Jeepneys are the most common and cheapest form of public transport in the Philippines. Its origin is from the American military vehicle used during World War II.  The Filipinos used their imagination to make it longer and installed two long seats as a means to transport people, goods, and even sometimes little animals. Since then, the sight of colorful jeepneys are all over the country. 

To help continue operations of his business, Virgilio is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to pay for the registration, tire replacement and maintenance of his jeepney. It is very important that his unit is always in good running condition to ensure efficient service. He thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to him for it will be a great help to sustain his family's daily needs.

Virgilio hopes to buy another jeepney unit. He wants his grandchild to go to college and someday become a professional. He prays for his and his passengers' safety on every trip. Every week, Virgilio faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tire replacement, spare parts and registration of his jeepney

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 29 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hija en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica al comercio, crianza de animales y agricultura y se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar los servicios de limpieza, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 1 año de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus clientes. Solicita préstamo para la compra de herramientas nuevas para su negocio, con esto ella espera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que se verá reflejado en un mayor nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old and lives with her spouse and her daughter in a rural part of the district of Cayaltí. It is a community that works mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising animals. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the North Coast of Peru.

Rosa works offering cleaning services. She has her own tools and more than one year in this business. She has good personal and work references from her clients. She is requesting a loan to buy new tools for her business. Doing this she hopes to provide better service to her clients which would be reflected in a higher level of income and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy new tools for her business.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin is grateful that he was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which he used to purchase scrap materials needed in his business. His earnings were a big help for the education of his children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan which he will use use to buy scrap and recyclable materials. His profits from business will definitely help sustain his family's daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He is thanking God and you for the financial help and a good return on his investment for it will greatly help cover their daily needs and fund his children's schooling.

Erwin aims to grow and expand his business and acquire a truck to easily transport his scrap materials. He prays for God's guidance and good health for his family. Each week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business where he also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials to sell.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 38 years old and married with one child who is in school.

Diana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

Diana has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 13 years and also earns an income from frozen foods.

Diana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 41 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are in school. Sandra works very hard to provide for them.

Sandra runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Sandra has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack food and other groceries. 

In the future Sandra would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bernarditha

texts.en:
Bernarditha is 52 years old and married with seven children. Two of her children are in school.

Bernarditha works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Bernarditha aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 65 years old and married with six children.

Esterlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Esterlita has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Esterlita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Dilijan city with her big family; she lives with her husband, two children and parents-in-law. Gayane now takes orders for translations from English to Armenian and this makes a small income for her big family. The main part of her family income is from her husband’s work. He has a car repair service in a small garage of his own in their city.

Gayane’s son is still school-aged and her daughter is a student. She studies at the Yerevan State Medical Institute in the Department of General Medicine (fee-paying division). This places very important demands on her family which they manage to solve with great hardship. Now Gayane is worried since her family’s income is too little to make the payment right now. This loan will help her very much when she receives it.

She asks for this loan of 400.000 AMD in order to pay her daughter's second semester tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a 63-year-old widowed woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Erlinda has a fishing business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for five years. Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other materials for her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Sugeng

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Sugeng. Sugeng lives in Kudus, east of Semarang, the capital of Central Java, about a nine-hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.  He lives there with his wife and his only daughter. Sugeng owns a stall that provides mobile phone accessories and mobile airtime credits to his community. He knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to his stall and he decided to join Ruma because he wants to expand his business. 

As the business grows, Sugeng needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Sugeng’s goal related to Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business to his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Sugeng is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Retchelyn

texts.en:
Retchelyn is 29 years old, married, and has two children who are still in school.

Retchelyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been in business for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Retchelyn has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sumarni

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Sumarni. Sumarni lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.  Sumarni is a housewife who has a big spirit to become an entrepreneur. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to her house and she decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to start a business. As a woman, Sumarni realized that she has to help her husband to improve their life.  

For now, Sumarni is becoming an agent who sells mobile airtime credits for her community. As the business grows, she needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are. Sumarni’s goal related to Ruma in the nearly future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Sumarni is the one who is standing. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 64 years old, single and has one child.

Lucila is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lucila requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rakhteeja

texts.en:
Rakhteeja is a 51-year-old woman and mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession; he sells fruits such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. Rakhteeja's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn the maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a position to purchase fruits for his business purposes. Therefore Rakhteeja has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purposes. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Rihlah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Rihlah.  Rihlah lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.  Rihlah owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. She knew Ruma from Ruma’s sales executive that came to her house and she decided to join Ruma because she wants to learn about how to expand her business in technology. As a woman, Rihlah realized that she has to help her husband to improve their life.  

As the business grows, Rihlah needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Rihlah’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Rihlah is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, 55 years old, resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family, consisting of three sons and three daughters. Her son has been running a restaurant for the last five years, providing good and fresh meals. His restaurant is situated in the main market, and many shopkeepers come to his restaurant for the delicious food. 

Paraveen's son needs some crockery and fresh food items to develop his business. In this regard, Parveen made contact with Kiva's field partner, Brac Pakistan, for a loan. Brac issued the loan to Parveen for the development of her son's business. Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy crockery and fresh food items for her son's restaurant

loans.name: Mutakin

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Mutakin.  Mutakin lives in East Serang, located about two hours drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his two children. Mutakin works as security in a private company. He knew Ruma from one of the sales executive that came to his house. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn about how to start up a business. Right now, Mutakin sells mobile airtime credits for his community. 

As the business grows, Mutakin needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, so his community can easily connect with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. Mutakin’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan.  

As seen in the photo, Mutakin is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Mussarat

texts.en:
Mussarat, 30 years old, lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 2 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years, and he is responsible for fulfilling the family's needs. Mussarat provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute, with her husband, to manage the household. 

Mussarat needs different types of goods, such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc. for her business, but is unable to purchase these accessories due to insufficient financial means. She has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to enable her to purchase these items. This will also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services. Mussarat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy accessories to increase her sewing business

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en: Saira is a 32-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three daughters and one son. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building making. In this regard, her husband needs some raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. This will help him generate more income to financially support his family. Saira is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Sadaqat

texts.en:
Sadaqat is 50 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. 

Sadaqat's husband owns a shop selling chicken in the market. He has been running his chicken shop for the last ten years. He buys chickens from the wholesaler and sells in his shop to the customers. His number of clients has increased due to his good attitude towards his clients. Moreover, he is the sole earner of his family. So, he wants to increase his income. In this way he would be able to meet his family's requirements. He is a very honest shop keeper, and behaves politely to people. He wants to buy broilers to sell from the chicken shop to improve his standard of living. For the development of his business, he needs a loan. So his wife, Sadaqat, contacted BRAC Pakistan who issued her a loan for her husband's chicken shop. 

Sadaqat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: assist her husband to develop his chicken shop.

loans.name: Korotoumou's Group

texts.fr: Korotoumou qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, et qui porte un vêtement de couleurs rouge et blanche avec un voile et un bracelet sur la main gauche, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Congola au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Korotoumou, âgée de 46 ans, est la mère de 12 enfants âgés de 3 mois à 22ans, dont 11 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Korotoumou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 30 ans. Korotoumou cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'engrais de qualité. Korotoumou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Korotoumou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 30 ans que Korotoumou cultive l'arachide. Korotoumou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter un semoir et d'assurer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Enfin,Korotoumou espère aussi pouvoir faire du commerce.
texts.en:
Korotoumou, who is   on the right-hand side in the first row, wearing a red and white outfit with a headscarf and a bracelet on her left hand, is a member of a group composed of 11 farmers who have signed up with myAgro. They work and live in the village of Congola, to the southeast of Bamako in Mali.

Korotoumou, 46 years old, has 12 children ranging from three months to 22 years of age; 11 of her children are now in school. Traditionally her family has been doing farm work, which is the main source of income as well as food for own consumption. Korotomou has been doing farmwork for some 30 years. She grows peanuts  on her land plot, but struggles with challenges such as insufficient rainfall and lack of quality fertilizers.  Korotoumou  is in her first year with myAgro; she signed up in order to help increase her harvest thanks to the services offered by myAgro. This year Korotomou is making [loan] payments in order to buy a myAgro package of OPV [Open Pollinated Variety] seeds and fertilizers for growing peanuts, with the view of increasing the yield on her land plot of 0.0625 ha [0.15 acre]. Kortomou has been growing peanuts for 30 years already. Thanks to an increased yield and thus an increased revenue, she plans to buy a seeder and cover the school fees for her children. Finally she also hopes to become a vendor.

loans.use: Acheter  des semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide

loans.name: Nargis

texts.en:
Nargis is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her son and three daughters, who are all studying. 

Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for eight years. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these clothes. Therefore, Nargis is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount. 

Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: assist her husband to purchase clothes in bulk for his clothes selling business.

loans.name: Riveras Del Río  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En  la Ciudadela  San Alejo  de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 11 socias y el 1 socio del Grupo De Crédito Riveras Del Rio. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como el comercio en general, la prestación de  servicios entre otras cosas. Ellos decidieron unirse y formar este grupo de crédito con el cual esperan mejorar sus negocios y su  calidad de vida.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Aracely, tiene 38 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8  años, el mayor  estudian en colegio y el  menor en escuela. El marido es agente vendedor.
Doña Aracely para ganar algo por su cuenta para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar y los que generan los estudios de sus hijos se dedica al comercio,  ella vende ropa de todo tipo, interiores, zapatos por catalogo y bisuterías, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale casi todos los días y  también vende en su casa lugar hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda o producto de los que ella vende, los mismos que deja a crédito y  cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana sus ingresos que le sirven para los gastos de educación de sus hijos, ella agradece a la institución y a las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir los créditos ya que es su forma como saca  adelante sus negocios.
Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, blusas, camisetas, zapatos y bisuterías ya que tiene varios pedidos. Este es su primer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito aunque ya estaba en otro pero se cambio a este grupo porque está más cerca de su hogar. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
Las dos fotos pequeñas son de tres socias que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 11 woman and one man of the "Riveras Del Rio" communal bank meet every fortnight in the San Alejo citadel of the city of Portoviejo. They work in different businesses like general commerce and providing services amongst others. They decided to get together and form a communal bank through which they hope to improve their businesses and their quality of living.

One of the members of the group is Aracely who is 38 years old and is in a common-law relationship. From this relationship she has 2 children, aged 14 and 8 years old. The oldest studies in secondary school and the youngest in primary school.

Aracely in order to earn something for herself and to help her husband with the household expenses and the expenses generated by her children's studies, works in commerce. She sells clothing of all types, underwear, shoes and jewellery by catalog. Her method of selling is door-to-door. She goes out most days and also sells from her house when her clients come needing some piece of clothing or product that she sells. She sells on credit and collects every 8 days.

She has been in this business for more than 5 years and she earns the income that provides for the education of her children. She is grateful to the institution and the people who make it possible that she can get these loans as a way to get her business ahead.

This loan is to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts shoes and jewellery as she has a number of orders. this is her first loan with this communal bank, but she was in another and changed to this group as it is closer to her home. Her dream is to provide the best for her children. The two attached photos are of 3 members who couldn't be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, shoes and jewellery.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. 

Miraluna lives with her family in the town of Ormoc City, Leyte. 

Miraluna is engaged in pig raising.  She has been in this business for more than three years now. 

Miraluna would like to take a loan to pay for the repair of her pig pen, to buy piglets to raise and animal feed. 

Miraluna believes that a loan will allow her to improve her hog raising business and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her pig pen, to buy piglets to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Yolanda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to resell.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to resell.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felipa is 39 years old and both of her children are in school.

Felipa has a pottery making business in the Philippines. Felipa requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials for her pottery business.

Felipa has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Felipa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Marianne

texts.en:
Marianne is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marianne is 35 years old and both of her children are in school.

Marianne has a general store business in the Philippines. Marianne requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft drinks, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

Marianne has been in this business for three years. In the future, Marianne would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, noodles, sardines and other groceries.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Daisy is 32 years old and all of her children are in school.

Daisy has an ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

Daisy has been in this business for five years. In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice cream business.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 43 years old and has two children.  Marieta is married and has one child who is still in school.

Marieta is in the agricultural business  in the Philippines. Marieta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Marieta has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and married. 

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, diapers and other groceries. 

In the future Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gersel

texts.en:
Gersel works hard to support herself. She is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Gersel requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

In the future, Gersel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Melanie

texts.en:
Ma. Melanie, 48 years old, is married and has ten children, four of them in school. Ma. Melanie is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Melanie has been farming sugarcane for ten years and has previously borrowed 23 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Ma. Melanie would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tina Marie

texts.en:
Tina Marie is 26 years old and married with one kid. 

Tina Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Tina Marie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Tina Marie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Mwanamisi has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers come. She faces a major challenge of fluctuations in the number of clients, hence perishing of goods leading to losses.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to include a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 44 years old and a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mary Jean has a frozen food business in the Philippines. Mary Jean requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Mary Jean has been in this business for two years. In the future, Mary Jean would like to repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn works hard to support her family. Lyn is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  Lyn has been in this business for 3 years now.

Lyn requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like cooking oil, spices, flour, and other ingredients.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like cooking oil, spices, flour, and other ingredients

loans.name: Nghiep's Group

texts.en:
Born in 1989, Nghiep is an ethnic Thai. She lives with her husband and two children in Mai Son district, Son La province. Nghiep is also the leader of this three-member group that is applying for a 60,000,000 VND loan through M7-MFI, which will be apportioned among themselves.

Nghiep’s family farms and raises chickens, which also helps to improve the quality of their family meals. Their harvests bring them tens of millions VND, but after they deduct costs it is just enough to cover the family’s expenses while allowing them to put aside a little in savings.

However, their savings are not enough to buy a cow, and so she will use her loan portion to buy one. She expects great results from this loan in the form of a lovely calf next year. She will work hard to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Maqbool's Group

texts.en:
Maqbool, 38 years old, resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three daughters and two sons. She is a housewife who looks after her family at home. Her husband provides shuttering work services for building. 

Maqbool's husband needs raw material such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and iron sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work so that he can generate more income to financially support his family. Maqbool is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work. She is thankful to Brac Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and has three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity or piped water. 

Fatuma has operated a tailoring business for the past six years. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 35 years old and is the mother of two children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Nasreen's husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. However, for the past few days his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to their lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing  his rickshaw. Therefore, Nasreen has requested  a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Nasreen is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Iqbal Bibi

texts.en:
Iqbal Bibi is a 50-year-old mother of three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession, selling fruit such as apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Iqbal Bibi's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit to re-sell so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to their unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a position to purchase fruit for his business purposes. Therefore, Iqbal Bibi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purpose. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: help her husband purchase fruit for his business.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 30-year-old married woman, living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns an electric generator shop in which he sells generators to the people. He has been doing this work for many years. To carry out his work, he has to stay at the shop to deal with the general public. He wants to buy more generators to cope with demand, but due to high costs, he is unable to purchase any. Therefore, Farzana requested a loan to support her husband's business. She hopes that with the loan amount her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make his payments on time. Farzana requested a loan so that her husband could buy an additional generator to enhance his business. 

Farzana gives thanks to KIVA and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: assist her husband with buying an additional generator to enhance his business.

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en:
Elvin is 43 years old and has two children, that are in school.

Elvin is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.  Elvin has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elvin requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Memie

texts.en:
Memie is 45 years old and has four children. Memie is married and one of her children is still in school.

Memie is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Memie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Memie has been in business for 10 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Neama

texts.en:
Neama is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She is conservative woman and asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Neama has always wanted to provide her children with the best education. Her 21-year-old daughter Waed is a university student majoring in law.. She is seeking to finish her Bachelor's so that she can have a career. Waed, an ambitious young lady wants to be a successful and productive woman in the future, and wants to make her parents very proud of her when they see her defend of the oppressed. 

But because of the financial problems her family has been facing, Neama couldn’t pay for Waed's upcoming semester fees. For that, Neama wants to apply for this loan to cover her daughter's university fees and help her achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university fees

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 26-year-old single man who has been working in making car furniture for the last five years to cover his needs and expenses. 

He gained experience in this domain when he was a child, since he left school at an early age to help his family. 

He is a hard worker and an ambitious man who has a good reputation among his customers.

Ayman is trying hard to develop his business, thus he is requesting a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy car furniture in order to satisfy his customers' special needs.

Ayman hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy car furniture in order to satisfy his customers' special needs

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a father of four school-age children and has worked as a driver for a living. His business involves a motorcycle for hire or public transport. He does this work to support his family. 

For him to continue his business, he asked for a loan to pay for motorcycle spare parts and a repair. Francisco dreams of owning more motor units to sufficiently provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle spare parts and a repair

loans.name: Melan

texts.en:
Melan is a businessman from Oroquieta. She is 58 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari (variety) store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. 

Melan is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default. Now, she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Melan continues to look for better business opportunites, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a 39-year-old single mother. To earn a living she engage in a sari-sari store business as a source of income to provide for her child. 

She joined GDMPC just this year and decided to take a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more grocery items to sell and enable her to increase her store's inventory.

In the future, Tita wants to improve her and her child's living condition.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. 

She would now like to apply for a 19,000 PHP loan, which she will use as part of her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales, and thus, increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Olivia dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Segundo Camilo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene un hijo, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito son personas amables que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicios de albañilería, contando con herramientas propias, con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Solicita préstamo para brindar mantenimiento a la infraestructura donde guarda sus herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio; con esto Segundo espera mejorar la productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los clientes de la zona lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Segundo is 25 years old, in a civil union, an dhas one son. He lives with his family in Oyotun district, a rural area located in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work primarily in agriculture, business, and livestock.

Segundo works as a bricklayer using his own tools. He has more than 5 years of experience in his business and has good references from the inhabitants in his district. He seeks a loan to provide maintenance to the space where he keeps his tools. This investment will enable him to have better conditions for his equipment and tools, thus greatly influence the business. Segundo hopes to improve the productivity of his services and in this way be able to meet the various needs of his customers in the zone, resultin gin an increase in income which will then improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to provide maintenance to the space where he keeps his tools.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 40 years old, married, and has three children.

Lucresia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, cooking oil, spices, personal care products, etc.

Lucresia has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell fruit and vegetable business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lucresia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, sugar, cooking oil, spices, personal care products, etc

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is 27 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, May works very hard to provide for them.

May runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, spices, soft drinks and other groceries.

May has been in this business for five years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, spices, soft drinks and other groceries

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of two children.  One of her children is still in school. 

Maria Lourdes is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a construction supplies business in the Philippines.  Maria Lourdes has been in this business for 5 years. 

Maria Lourdes requested a 29,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more construction supplies to sell.

She would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a very loving farmer with great passion for nature and working with animals. He has a lot of admiration and respect for the animals.

Thomas is a hardworking, middle-aged man who lives in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. He is married to a lovely, diligent wife. He has been doing dairy farming for a living for the last seven years. His primary income source is milk. 

Thomas has always wanted to do poultry farming as a business. He has a few birds that give him eggs for food, but he feels it is time to upgrade it to becoming a business. He is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase a brood of hens for egg production. He will be selling the eggs he collects to neighbors, institutions, hotels, and to retail shops. Income from this business will help him deal with the high transportation costs that are eating into his profits. He will also use the increased income to meet his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Begimzhan

texts.ru: Бегимжан, 55 лет, вдова, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 17 лет назад. Также торгует канцелярскими изделиями на дому. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, на 2,76 Га земли она выращивает картофель для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду, Бегимжан на сегодняшний имеет хорошую прибыль от бизнеса -15,000 сом в месяц (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бегимжан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян картофеля элитных сортов. Бегимжан является одной из 5 участников группы "Нуркунай". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Begimzhan is 55 and a widow with four children. She has a high school education and works in animal husbandry and agriculture as a source of income for her family, a business she started 17 years ago. She also sells office supplies from home. She has two cows on her farm as well as 2.76 hectares of land where she grows potatoes for sale. Thanks to her hard work, she now has a good income from her business of 15,000 KGS per month.

With the goal of further developing her business, Begimzhan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase fertilizer and high-quality seed potatoes. She is one of five members of the Nurkunai group. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and renovating her home.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes and fertilizers to grow organic produce

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 44 years old and married woman with seven children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Daisy has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish business.

Daisy has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her dried fish business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella who is in her early 40s is married and has four kids, two sons and two daughters who are still going to school.  

She has been a food vendor for three years now.  She works from 5 am to 12.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Stella's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her inventory and she managed to improve the quality of the food sold.  

She is happy with the results of the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  She used the profits to pay school fees, loan repayment, and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase her product inventory to meet her customers' demand.  

She dreams of having a book shop.

Stella will make sure she pays her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy inventory to meet her customers' demands

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 23-year-old, single man who opened his barber shop a year ago to cover his needs and expenses. He has fourteen years of experience in this domain, as he left school early and started working as a barber to help his family. Mahmoud has a good reputation among his customers, as he has professional skills. Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business by buying a sterilization machine, hair washing machine, and towels. This loan will facilitate Mahmoud's work and satisfy his customers' needs. He hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sterilization machine, hair washing machine, and towels

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a food vendor from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is married and has been in the food-vending business for more than five years now. Gina sells home-cooked foods like pork barbecue and sausages, grilled chicken and others. 

As of now, Gina wants to take a loan to buy more ingredients like pork meat, chicken meat, sausages, hot dogs and others. Through a loan, Gina believes that she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like pork meat, chicken meat, sausages, hot dogs and others

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Monina works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Monina is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle passenger vehicle.

Monina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en: Florentina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell for her general store business. Florentina successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is relisting Florentina's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Perlie

texts.en:
Perlie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Perlie requested a 13,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Perlie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Ajali

texts.en:
Ajali is married with three school-going children. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Ajali has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. With this loan she is requesting, Ajali wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas [women's wrap cloth] for resale.

loans.name: Ningome

texts.en:
Ningome is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Ningome operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over four years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Ningome dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 
	
With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inventory for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods for his store

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en: Rochelle is a 34 year old married woman and a mother of five children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for several years now. Rochelle would like to take a loan to buy more piglets to raise and animal feed on which to raise them. A loan will help her improve her business as well as her income. In the future, Rochelle dreams of making her business successful and stable.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and animal feed to raise them.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a businesswoman from Oroquieta City. She is 55 years old and is married. 

Cecilia owns and operates a fancy jewelry business, a specialized retail store where she sells fancy jewelry in her local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2009, Cecilia joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to access financial services, as well as improve both her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. 

Now, Cecilia is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue she earns to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Jeanita

texts.en:
Jeanita wants to provide her child a good life. 

She decided to engaged in a sari-sari store, with the help of her husband, as a source of their income.

It is a good business for the family because they earn 2,000 PHP  a month to provide the needs of their family. 

Jeanita is taking a loan again to buy more grocery items to sell so that they can increase their income.

Jeanita hopes that someday her business will uplift her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

loans.name: Al-Hajeri Group

texts.en:
Al-Hajeri is a loan group that has been working together since their first Kiva loan. This group consists of Asma'a, Joma'a, and Fawziah. They are still working toward repaying the first loan and have applied for a concurrent loan of 160,000 YER.

Fawziah is the new leader of the group and is responsible for all its members. She runs a beautician business inside her house with minimal equipment. Fawziah applied for a first loan to purchase some of the necessary beautician materials to grow her business. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their support of the first loan, which has already helped her to improve her business. 

She has applied for a concurrent loan of 70,000 YER (of the group's total 160,000 YER) from AMB in order to purchase additional beautician materials and equipment, to further expand her business. With the help of this loan, Fawziah will be able to attract a lot more customers and increase her profits, thus improving her family's living conditions. 

Fawziah and all the members of the group thank Kiva lenders warmly for their first loan and hope this loan will be funded too.

loans.use: to purchase materials and equipment for her beautician business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 51 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Delia is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Delia has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Serisi

texts.en:
Serisi is 30 years old, and he is not married. He owns a shop, and he has been doing business for the past year. 

With his loan, Serisi would like to buy more sugar, rice, and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from his business will be put into savings. In the future, Serisi hopes to earn at least 300,000 RWF per month.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 19 years old, a single freshman who resides in the Kratie province of Cambodia. She is pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in finance and banking at a university in the province. 

Chanthy's parents are rice farmers. Due to the fact that she is short of the finances needed to pay her tuition fees from first to second year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to earn an associate’s degree successfully. 

After earning her associate’s degree, Chanthy is going to pursue her bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from first to second year.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 24-years-old single man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a small house. His brother works as an employee in the public sector where he earns low income. This income is barely cover all the family's needs. 

Mostafa is a student in the university where he studies Accounting. He wants to complete his studies and find a job to improve the family's living conditions. Has has taken out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies, which will help him do his homework and reports easily.

Mostafa appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income, which is barely cover all the family's needs. 

Nidal is a student in the university where he studies Accounting. He wants to complete his studies and find a job to improve the family's living conditions.
Nidal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. Through this loan, Nidal will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

Nidal appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married and has six children. Leonila personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost 3 years. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 6,000.00 for the purchase of new nets. Having essential fishing supplies minimizes the chances of a low or zero catch. 

Leonila also wants to be able to her neighbors' catch, so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. She wishes to see herself and her children have stable jobs.

loans.use: to purchase new nets.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 21-year-old single man from Rafah City. 

He lives with his family in a small house. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Hasan is a student in the university and studies Nursing. He wants to complete his studies and find a job to improve the family living conditions. 

Hasan took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Hasan will be able to do his homework and reports easily. 

Hasan appears in the photo with his new laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from Rafah City.  He lives with his family in a small house. His mother works as an employee in the public sector where she gets a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all of the family's needs. 

Ahmad is a student in the university and studies Elementary education.  He wants to complete his degree and find a job to improve the family's living conditions.

Ahmad took a $650 USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies.  By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

Ahmad appears in the photo with his new laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents. 

Evelyn owns a sari-sari store that sells groceries and other consumable products as the source of her living. She's been in the business for 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP each month from this business. 

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable goods for resale. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. 

In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries and other consumable goods

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is married and lives in Oroquieta, Philippines. 

For a living, he cultivates a small rice land for their consumption and engages in selling firewood to the local community. Manuel has been doing this for 15 years. 

He hopes to live comfortably, with simple yet comfortable living quarters for all of those in the family. Therefore, he applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repairs and expansion. 

Manuel is a new member of PMPC.

In the future, he hopes to save money for future emergencies. 

He wants nothing more than to live a happy and healthy life.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for house repairs and expansion

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is a businesswoman, who earns through retailing various items. Her husband is a farmer focusing on rice farming, and he manages a small piggery. Cherry is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Cherry wants to renovate her house to live comfortably with her family. Recently, she applied for a loan. This loan is intended to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks and pay for loads of sand and gravel. She is on her way to renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks and pay for loads of sand and gravel to renovate her house

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy, a diligent and hardworking mother, requests a loan from Paglaum MPC, which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store. This way, she will be able to sell more goods, which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en:
Mateo is 65 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. He is widowed with 2 adult-aged children.

Mateo has been engaged in hog-fattening activities for 4 years already. He earns approximately 6,000 PHP each month from this type of work. He is also an elected Barangay Official in his community. 

Mateo has requested a loan to purchase 5 sacks of booster and grower mash feed. 

Mateo has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 2 years. In the future, he hopes to expand his hog-fattening business.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of booster and grower mash feed.

loans.name: Dalencio

texts.en:
Dalencio is single and lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City. 

He joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the coop. 

He's requesting a loan in the amount of 35,000 PHP for additional working capital for his existing business to buy a variety of rice for retail in the local community. 

Dalencio hopes to continue his business and to be able to save enough money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a variety of rice for retail in the local community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools to run her business.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 43-year-old married woman and mother of seven children, four of which are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ana has a general store business in the Philippines.  Ana has been in this business for five years. 

Ana requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more products like shampoo, snack foods, noodles, and other groceries.

In the future, Ana would like to save enough money in order to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more products like shampoo, snack foods, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en: Theoneste is 27 years old. He is not married. He sells shoes and has been doing this as a business for the past year. With this loan, he would like to buy more shoes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to put into savings, and he wishes to one day become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario “El Paraíso”, es un grupo mixto integrado por 1 hombre y 2 mujeres (ANASTASIO, DERLIN y MARIANA) pertenecen a la etnia miskita, viven en la comunidad “Kilometro 43” que comunica a la carretera Puerto Cabezas-Managua. Son hombres y mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios. Se organizaron hace 2 semanas para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana. Decidieron nombrar al grupo “El Paraíso” en honor al nombre de su iglesia Morava.

Anastasio: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, es un señor cordial de 40 años de edad, con cualidades de líder y deseos de superación. Casado con 6 hijos en edad escolar. Su esposa es ama de casa. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 4 años estableció una pequeña pulpería. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar en Bilwi: Chiverías y granos básicos, venderlos a precios accesibles a sus clientes de su comunidad que localiza a 3 horas de la cabecera municipal de Puerto Cabezas. Sueña con dedicarse a actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
The “El Paraíso” group consists of 1 man and 2 women (ANASTASIO, DERLIN y MARIANA) who are of miskito ethnicity. They live in the “Kilometro 43” community which is located on the Puerto Cabezas-Managua highway. People here are very enterprising and work every day to make their businesses grow. The group organized 2 weeks ago to access loans as a group through Pana Pana. They decided to name their group “El Paraíso” in honor of their Morava church.

Anastasio is the coordinator of the group. He is a cordial 40 year old man who has leadership qualities and desires to be successful. He is maried with 6 school-aged children. His spouse is a housewife. With the goal of helping his famiy get ahead, 4 years ago he opened a small convenience store. He seeks his first financing to buy snacks and basic staple groceries in order to sell them at accessible prices to his customers in his community which is located 3 hours from the muninciple seat of Puerto Cabezas. He dreams of being successful with his agricultural activities.

loans.use: to buy snacks and basic staple groceries.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with 7 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has 4 children who are all in school.

Elvie has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Elvie has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is 45 years old. She is married and has a 15-year-old child. Her child is currently attending school. 

She sells food items and has been doing this for the past 20 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy beans and sorghum to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 26-year-old single man who has been working as a coiffure for four years to cover his needs and expenses. He learned this profession from his father.

He is an ambitious man who has professional skills in this domain and succeeded throughout the years to gain loyal customers.

Today, Maher is requesting a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business by buying hair tools which will facilitate his work and satisfy his customers' special needs.

Maher hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hair tools which will facilitate his work and satisfy his customers' special needs

loans.name: Boushra Group

texts.en:
Majeda is the featured borrower for Boushra Group. She got together with the other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living standards.

Majeda is a 27-year-old Syrian married mother of two children.  She is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to start a new business of selling cosmetics in order to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their children. 

This loan will increase Majeda's income and provide her family with better living conditions. Majeda is the first lady on the right of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Fayza is the lady standing in the middle, and Maysaloun is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to start a new business of selling cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Edgardo Fabian

texts.es:
Edgardo Fabian tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge en casa propia en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Edgardo Fabian se dedica al servicio de reparación de celulares en el distrito de Cayaltí desde hace 05 años aproximadamente. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de accesorios para reparación de celulares (táctiles, baterías, cargadores,etc), lo que le permitirá atender con una mejor calidad a sus clientes dándole el valor agregado a su servicio para diferenciarse de sus competidores, lo que en un corto plazo le permitirá captar un número mayor de clientes y por ende sus ingresos aumentarán, sus ganancias mejorarán y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de su familia también.
texts.en:
