Edgardo Fabian is 28 years old and lives with his spouse in their own house. They live in a community that works in commerce, agriculture and raising animals found in the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Edgardo Fabian has earned a living repairing cellphones in the Cayaltí district for about the past five years. He has experience in this business and good personal and work references in his district.

The loan's use is to buy accessories for repairing cellphones (touch screens, batteries, chargers, etc.) which will allow him to provide better service to his customers. He will give them value-added service to differentiate himself from his competitors. 

This will allow him to attract more customers in the short-term, increasing his revenue and his income, and thus his and his family's quality of life as well.

loans.use: to buy accessories to repair cellphones (touch screens, batteries, chargers, etc.)

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is 48 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now in their adult and school age. Elsa's source of income is coming from the sales in her sari sari store business. She's been in the business for three years already and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries and other consumable products for retailing. Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 13 years. She is very active and supportive of all the programs and services of the cooperative. In the future, Elsa hopes to expand her sari sari store business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Her name is Aurora, 35, and she is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Rodel, a dried fish vendor and has three children. The eldest is in Elementary School and the younger two are not of school age yet. She manages their household and her husband is her business partner. Her earnings from her business are a great help in their daily needs.

Aurora buys dried fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys several kilos of "tuyo" (sun dried fish with a pungent smell that tastes really good). It is usually consumed at breakfast and best eaten with spicy vinegar dip and fried rice. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 700 in sales every day.

To help continue and expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 15.000 loan, which she will use to pay for several packs of dried fish. Her steady earnings are a great help in meeting the family's everyday needs and for the schooling of her child. She is thanking God for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her.

Aurora aims to grow her business so she can send all her children to good schools and see them become professionals someday. She prays that her family will always lead a happy and quiet life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for several kilos of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Eddie Rodolfo

texts.en:
Eddie Rodolfo is a married father of 7 children. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur. He is 43 years old and 6 of his children are in school.

Eddie Rodolfo has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. He has requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy materials needed for his blacksmith business.

Eddie Rodolfo has been in this business for 7 years now. In the future, he would like to save enough money so he can continue to send his children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for his blacksmith business.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 47 years old, married, and has five children, three of which are in school.  

Angelita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.  Angelita has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Angelita requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs.

In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Farmers from Nandihills are generally small-scale farmers. Gilbert is a very honest, hardworking, and dedicated farmer who is 37 years of age and lives in Nandihills, Kenya, an area known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming. 

Gilbert has much experience in farming, which he has been doing for three years. He is considered one of the best farmers in his village. Gilbert’s primary sources of income are selling milk and eggs and crop farming. He is a very dedicated dairy farmer, and has nicknamed his cow “Lelgina” (black and white). Dairy farming is close to his heart, and every day he wakes up to milk his cow and that makes him very proud. 

However, the income Gilbert makes from selling milk, eggs and crops is insufficient to meet his family's expenses, yet he has kept hope alive that this will improve. He is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality dairy cow. He plans not to buy just an ordinary cow but to buy a quality breed of cow that will produce between 10-20 litres of milk a day. 

The additional milk will result in additional income and thus improved living conditions, the ability to repay the loan, and investment in his children's education. The cow manure will also provide benefit, being used to increase the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Finally, the loan will allow Gilbert to build a bio-gas digester, which will be helpful in saving energy. 

This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions. Gilbert waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow and build a bio-gas digester.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 41 years old. She is married and has two children aged between 11 and 15 years. Both of them go to school. 

She owns a store and she has been in this business for the past 2 years. Her husband is a business man also. 

With the loan, she would like to buy rice, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to put away for savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is 44 years old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and one son. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. 

Her husband provides services making shutters and he wants to develop his business. For this reason, her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods, and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his business.  This will help him generate more income to  financially support his family. 

Rubina is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work.

She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her husband's shutter business

loans.name: Nankuyu Group

texts.en:
Abegail thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her. She used the loan to purchase different kinds of vegetables. She used the profits obtained  to pay school fees for her children and provide them with their basic needs.

She is requesting another loan in order to buy five bags of beans, as her main aim is to diversify her business. She hopes to build a permant house for her family and she plans to further increase her business, as this is her main source of income.

loans.use: To buy bags of beans

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is a 34-year-old married man from Rafah City. He lives with his wife in a small house. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs. Islam is also a student in the university where he studies Accounting. He wants to complete his degree and find a better job in the future to improve the family's living conditions.

Islam took a $900 USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Islam will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

Islam appears in the photo with his new laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Adela

texts.en: Adela is a widow residing in Oroquieta, in the Philippines. She joined PMPC in January of 2012 in order to access the programs and services of the coop. Recently, she's accessed her third loan in the amount of PHP 50,000 for additional working capital for her existing business to buy a variety of goods which she sells as dry goods in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Agapito

texts.en: Agapito is from Oroquieta City and he is a widower. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his children and grandchildren, since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He is earning a living in his retailing business. To generate more income, Agapito decided to expand his resources after he learned that he can access financial assistance from PMPC. Consequently, he requested a loan to restock more inventory for his store to increase sales. Agapito smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family a better life.

loans.use: to restock more inventory for his store to increase sales

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma makes a good earning by hog raising in Oroquieta. This is how she supports her husband in raising their family and sending her children to school. She wants to increase her profit, so Gemma approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase an additional two heads of piglets. She has high hopes that she will have more savings for the college education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase an additional two heads of piglets

loans.name: Aice

texts.en:
Aice is 24 years old. She is married and has two children aged 1 and 5 years. One of them is in school. 

She owns a store and she has been in this business for the past year. Her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan, she would like to buy sugar, rice, and cooking oil to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve her family's standards of living and to put away for savings.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a hardworking married man living in Kamwenge Uganda. He deals in livestock where he rears cows for fattening as his main source of income and in addition runs a retail shop to earn extra income. 

James is inspired by the need to develop himself and educate his children. He hopes to become a modernized cattle farmer.  However, his main challenge is inadequate capital and weather changes. 

He intends to use the loan to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 43 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.

In the future Cecilia would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jina

texts.en:
Jina is 54 years old and has six children. She is married and two of her children are presently in school.

Jina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Jina requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jina has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 50 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Brenda has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  Brenda has been in this business for 15 years. 

Brenda requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Brenda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca esta estudiando la licenciatura en educación inicial, es una persona que viene esforzándose para poder ser alguien en la vida, y poder ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de su profesión. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar sus gastos de titulación.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder comprar pagar sus cuotas,y con ello poder seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Francisca is studying for her degree in early education. She is a person who works hard so she can be someone in this life, and to be able to help her loved ones through her profession. She says that she used her previous loan to be able to pay her degree fees. Now she is requesting a new loan in order to pay her university fees, which will enable her to continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Sotero

texts.en: Sotero has a collection of ornamental and botanical garden plants which has become a business. He finds pleasure in doing and managing gardening activities and earns a good income as well for his family. As a microfinance member of PMPC, he has sought financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental and botanical plants that he can grow and sell. In the future, Sotero wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental and botanical plants that he can grow and sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Retailing helps Mary Ann's family survive. She retails bananas, fruits and vegetables. Mary Ann also makes copra and she buys coconut for this. Doing this type of activity brings her a meager income of PHP 6,000 per month. Mary Ann plans to expand her retailing business. She applied for a loan to PMPC for the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of bananas, fruits, and vegetables for retail and pay for whole coconuts to make copra. Mary Ann smiles at the fact of seeing all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, fruits, and  vegetables for retail and to pay for whole coconuts to make copra

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 49 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children now at school age. Evelyn is a dried fish stall owner at the public market. She’s been engaged in this business for 13 years already. She earns approximately PHP 15,000 each month from this business and this amount is so helpful to meet their needs. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of dried fish for retail. Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her dried fish vending business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of dried fish

loans.name: Jeanie

texts.en:
Jeanie is 34 years old and is married. She is known in her area for her direct-sales business. 

Jeanie is actively participating in the various programs and services that Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house. And for this reason she has applied for a loan to purchase additional inventory of her direct-sales products. 

Jeanie hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. She is very thankful for all the financing support provided by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase additional direct-sales inventory product.

loans.name: Huazhen

texts.en:
Huazhen is a 49-year-old divorced woman who is raising her three children alone and also supports her elderly mother. 

Last year, Huazhen sold clothes in a town with the help of her mother. Without any experience of selling clothes, it failed at the end of the year which made her lose much money. Huazhen is an aggressive and hardworking woman; she began to search for a new program that fit her. 

This year, Huazhen engaged in setting up a stall as a street vendor. Her major business is making a food which is named ”Doener” (Chinese hamburger). She is working very hard and is also polite to her clients so that her business runs very well.

Huazhen requested ￥10,000 (CNY) from MicroCred China, and this is the fourth time she has borrowed money. She has a good credit record. She will use part of the money to purchase raw materials and the rest of the money she will use to improve her family's living standard. 

Huazhen has a big confidence in her future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Aneeta

texts.en:
Aneeta is a 28-year-old woman and a mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession. He sells fruits, e.g. apples, bananas, grapes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Aneeta's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore, Aneeta has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes.
 
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's fruit business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 32 years old and is married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional inventory of rice to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory of rice to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 43 years old. She is known in her neighborhood for her retailing business of buying and selling various seafood. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the Co-op offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Biru Muda Group

texts.en:
The Biru Muda Group is led by the 36 year-old farmer Mat, who is wearing black hat, second row. The other Farmers in the group are Amin, Boim, Tri, Seto, Arni, Lilik, Yudi, Sujito, and Nur. They are standing in front of a cow-house. Mat has a family with four children. All of them live in a small village in the Lampung Tengah region of Indonesia.

Mat has been running a small-scale vegetable farming for more than six years. His business runs well. He also have a small cow-fattening business. However, he was troubled with the high price of chemical fertilizers and he get protested by the neighbors because the cow dungs, which is not used as fertilizer, is causing a pungent odor.

After socialized by Yayasan Rumah Energi and Lembaga Pengembangan Pertanian Nahdatul Ulama/LPPNU (a local NGO – biogas construction partner of YRE) about Household Biogas (BIRU) program, Mat saw the biogas program is a solution of his problem. He saw opportunity to reduce his dependence on non- renewable cooking gas. In addition, he also wants to use bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer for his plants or sell it to increase revenue. Mat is keen to purchase a bio-digester, but he does not have sufficient capital for it. A loan from Kiva will help him and other group members to make it possible.

He hopes that if he can build bio-digester, he can use the bio-gas for cooking, and bio-slurry (biogas residue) as fertilizers for his plantation. He also want to sell the remaining bio-slurry to increase income.

loans.use: to build bio-digester and utilization of bio-slurry (biogas residue) as organic fertilizer

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can receive financial assistance for her chosen business. Rufina has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were paid in a timely manner. 

Recently, she took a loan to purchase additional pigs and pay for bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her hogs. Rufina wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs and pay for bags of feeds and animal vitamins

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es:
Raquel es una profesional ya recibida, hoy está en busca de ir mejorando sus conocimientos, es por ello que se está esforzando mucho y sigue estudiando hoy la carrera de docente universitario.
Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que se esfuerza mu-cho.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su carrera como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Raquel is a professional, already licensed. Now, she's searching for a way to improve her knowledge and is working hard and continuing to study for a career as a university teacher.

She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person who puts in a lot of effort. She's seeking this loan to cover the expenses for her studies as she has done.

loans.use: to pay costs for her studies.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 22 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   

She has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Jacqueline has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Jacqueline has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jacqueline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cows for fattening.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 52 years old, lives in Lugdungan, Dipolog. Anita is married with six children. She and her husband are both farmers. Anita has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member will always help her husband in plowing the rice field, planting vegetables and other varieties of agricultural commodities.
 
In need of additional working capital, she decided to join Paglaum Cooperative and has received several loans already. Recently, she requested PHP 7,000 for buying farm and garden fertilizer and paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the Cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Anita is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to repair and expand her house to live a happy and comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy farm and garden fertilizer and pay labor costs for cultivating the land

loans.name: Jay Mark

texts.en:
Jay Mark is 21 years old and single. He is living with his parents and three siblings in Tagmanokan, Siquijor. He is earning an income working as a bagger in a retail store. 

Jay Mark also engages in a hog raising business to generate additional income. This is how he helps his parents in sustaining their family needs. He  joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to learn about insurance and financial assistance. 

He is a responsible son who has a strong determination to pursue his goals. Someday, he hopes to have a stable financial status to continuously support his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is 39 years old and married with four children.  With two children in school, Florentina works very hard to provide for them.

Florentina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Florentina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future, Florentina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 49 years old, married and lives at Siquijor, Philippines. In order for her to help her husband to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30, depending on their agreement.  

With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well. Through Pagluam PC, she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets and feed. Now, she requests a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy bags of growth pellets feed and pay for an additional two piglets. She really hopes and prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy bags of growth pellets feed and pay for an additional two piglets

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is 50 years old. She is mother of four children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past several days his rickshaw has not been working properly. Because of this he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Parveen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Parveen is very much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Al Sadaka8 Group

texts.en:
Eman is the featured borrower for Al Sadaka8 Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Eman is a 21-year-old single lady who started working as a nurse in a hospital a year ago. Eman is working hard to cover her needs and expenses. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay the expenses of necessary medical treatment for her leg. Eman is the lady sitting in the middle.

With respect to the other group members, Sanaa is the lady on the left, and Maya is the lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of necessary medical treatment for her leg.

loans.name: Atilano

texts.es:
Atilano tiene 29 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Callayuc una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la destilación de aguardiente, una bebida tradicional de la sierra del Perú, que es utilizada para días festivos, antiséptico y con fines curativos, también se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, tiene una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de caña que es materia prima de su producción y de esta manera producir mayor cantidad de aguardiente lo que le permitirá obtener mayores ingresos que mejorarán su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Atilano is 29 years old and lives with his wife and children in the Callayuc district, a community with green landscapes where the people work in farming, trade and cattle-raising. Callayuc is in the Cutervo province of the Cajamarca region, in Peru’s northern highlands.

Atilano makes a living producing “aguardiente”, a traditional drink in the Peruvian mountains. The drink is consumed on holidays and used as an antiseptic and medicine. Atilano also makes a living raising bovine cattle. He has a close-knit family. 

Atilano is applying for a loan in order to buy more sugar cane, the raw material used in production at his business. With this loan, he can produce more “aguardiente”, allowing him to earn a higher income, and improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more sugar cane, a basic material at his work.

loans.name: Debi's Group

texts.fr: Debi, assise au centre sur la photo et portant un foulard blanc et noir avec une carte blanche dans les mains, est membre d'un groupe de 14 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Faradie (Keleya), au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Debi, qui est âgé de 50 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 9 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d’assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille. Elle a décidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour acquérir de  nouvelles connaissances agricoles. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Debi a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champ de 0.0625 hectare. A travers cet achat, Debi espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements  afin de pouvoir rendre sa famille heureuse et renforcer de la cohésion sociale dans le village.
texts.en:
Debi, who is seated in the middle of the photo and is wearing a white and black scarf and holding a white card in her hands, is a member of this group of 14 farmers who live and work in Faradie (Keleya), south-east of Bamako, in Mali. She is 50 years old and lives in a family with nine children. Farming allows her to independently provide food for the whole family.

Debi decided to join myAgro in order to learn more about farming. During her first year with myAgro, Debi bought a pack of OPV seeds and fertilizer to grow groundnuts on her .0625 hectare of land. 

With this new purchase, Debi hopes to be able to increase her yields in order to make her family happy and to strengthen social bonds in the village.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow groundnuts

loans.name: Ligia Maria

texts.es: LIGIA MARIA: Es una señora luchadora y cordial de 40 años de edad, originaria de Waspam de la etnia miskita, madre soltera de 3 hijos que estudian su secundaria y carrera universitaria. Trabaja como docente de educación de adulto. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de madera, sin embargo con su salario no le cubre para realizarle algunas mejoras como construir un anexo de madera que será utilizado como cocina. Es por eso que solicitan su primer préstamo para poder hacer estas mejoras. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, clavos, postes de madera y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ligia María is a plucky and polite 40-year-old. She is originally from Waspam, and of Miskito ethnicity. She is a single mother to three children who are studying at secondary school and university. Ligia herself is a teacher at an adult education centre.

With a lot of effort, Ligia has gradually begun building her house with wood but her salary is not enough to carry out improvements, such as building a wooden extension to use as a kitchen. Ligia is therefore applying for her first loan to carry out this work. Ligia will use this loan to buy planed timber, nails, and wooden posts, and to pay labourers for their services.

Ligia dreams of having a pretty house that is more secure and more comfortable for her children.

loans.use: to build an extension to her house with wood to use as a kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flatscreen televisions

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her 3 children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of their family. Saima also provides sewing services and earns an income to help her husband to manage the household. 

She needs different kinds of goods such as needles, threads, pieces of cloth and machine oil for her business but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. She has therefore applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also help her to increase her monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: she wanted to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Fatoumata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé le 22 Mai 2009, vient d’entamer son dix septième cycle. Malgré les difficultés de la zone à maintenir une activité génératrice de revenues, ces membres sont d’une détermination assez solide et très courageux. Les membres sont très solidaires entre elles. L’activité principale est le petit commerce.

 Madame Fatoumata (assise à  droite avec la main levée) est l’emprunteuse vedette du  groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 fille et 01 garçon. Elle est vendeuse de pattes d’arachide qu’elle achète dans les marchés hebdomadaires.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 07 sacs d’arachide à 12000 f le sac, 12 sceaux de 20 kg  vide à 1200 f le sceau pour mettre la patte d’arachide et payer un transport de 20000 f pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Les bénéfices lui serviront de mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille d’acheter des bœufs et de la charrue pour les travaux champêtres.
texts.en:
This group was established on 22 May 2009 and has just started their 17th loan cycle. Despite difficulties in the area to maintain a business, these members have a rather solid and courageous determination. The members share a sense of solidarity. They all work primarily in small-scale commerce.

Fatoumata (who is seated on the right with her hand raised) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 37 years old, married, and a mother of two children--one girl and one boy. She sells groundnut paste that she buys in the weekly markets. 

With this loan, she plans to buy seven sacs of groundnuts at 12,000 francs per sac and 12 20-kilogram empty buckets at 1,200 francs per bucket, which she will use to put the groundnut paste into. She will also pay the transport, 20,000 francs, to deliver the goods to her area.

Earnings will serve to better take care of her family's needs and help to buy cows and a plow for farming.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts and buckets and to pay for transport

loans.name: Ismael

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter de la machine à broder pour son atelier, Ismaël âgé de 34ans  demande un premier crédit à WAGES. Il est tailleur de profession depuis 2009. A l'avenir, il souhaite devenir un grand tailleur de la place et aider ses enfants à s’épanouir. Sa femme est dans la même activité que lui et ils ont 01 enfant de 02ans en charge.
texts.en:
In order to buy an embroidery machine for his workshop, Ismaël is seeking his first loan with WAGES. He is 34 years old and has been a tailor since 2009.

In the future, he wishes to become a reputable tailor in his area and help his children develop. 

His wife also works in tailoring, and together they have a two-year-old child under their care.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Arafmo

texts.ru: Арафмо милая добрая и отзывчивая женщина из городка Куляб. Народ Куляба славится своим не сравнительным стилем гостеприимства и чувство юмора. Арафмо является одним их тех жителей прекрасного городка. Ей 33 года. Она замужем и имеет четверых детей. Дети в возрасте 11, 9, 7 и 4 годика. Арафмо после замужество все свое время потратила на детей и домашние дела. Дети повзрослели, и у нее появилось больше свободного времени. К тому же дети растут и растут их расходы. Арафмо и ее мужу теперь надо собирать денег на образование детей и покрывать растущие расходы. Она с мужем решили открыть продуктовый магазин, нашли место (помещение находится за спиной Арафмо), поставили полки и осталось только купить товар. Для покупки товара они обратились за кредитом. Она сама обратилась за получением займа, потому что МДО "Хумо" больше поддерживает клиентов женщин и создает более выгодные условия кредитования.
texts.en:
Arafmo is a sweet, kind and generous woman from the city of Kulob.  The people from Kulob are famous for their exceptional hospitality and their sense of humor.  Arafmo is one of the residents of this beautiful town.  She is 33 years old, married, and she has four children.  Her children are 11, 9, 7 and 4 years old.  After she got married, Arafmo devoted all her time to the children and the housework.  The children are older now, and Arafmo has more free time.  But as the children grow, so do the expenses of the family.  Arafmo and her husband need to save some money for their education and to cover increasing costs.

Arafmo and her husband have decided to open a grocery store.  They have found a shop (shown behind Arafmo in the photo) and have set up shelves.  The only thing that they still need to do is to buy goods.  They are taking a loan to make this purchase.  Arafmo herself is taking a loan because MLO Humo particularly supports female clients and provides more advantageous lending conditions.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale, and to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi vit avec son enfant de 08ans à Lomé. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et revend dans son atelier des pagnes, bazins, sacs et chaussures à ses clients. Pour satisfaire ses clients, elle fait un troisième crédit à WAGES. Elle souhaite devenir grossiste et aider son enfant à s'épanouir.
texts.en:
Akouvi lives with her eight-year-old child in Lomé. She is a hair stylist by profession and sells in her shop pagnes [bright, colorful fabric], damask, bags, and shoes to her customers. 

To satisfy her customers, she is seeking her third loan with WAGES. 

She wishes to become a wholesaler and help her child develop.

loans.use: to buy pagne [bright, colorful fabric], damask, bags, and shoes

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 29ans, Essi comptable de profession revend en même temps des mèches et produits d'alimentation générale à domicile. Elle s'approvisionne à Lomé et demande un premier crédit pour acheter des marchandises. A l'avenir, elle souhaite agrandir son activité et mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Essi is a young 29-year-old woman who is an accountant by profession, but who also sells general food products and hair extensions from her home.

She procures her goods in Lomé and is seeking her first loan to buy merchandise. 

In the future, she wishes to expand her business and take better care of things.

loans.use: to buy general food products and hair extensions

loans.name: Santa Clara Group

texts.fr:
El grupo llamado Santa Clara está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, con lo que podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder esforzarse por ir mejorando poco a poco.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rosalva, quien es modista y peluquera, en ambos trabajos que hace le va muy bien, es por ello que ya tiene muy buena clientela. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante y es por ello que se está esforzando para poder crecer.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros, y con esto podrá seguir dando un excelente servicio para sus clientes. Ella al igual que sus compañeras del grupo quiere poder mejorar sus vidas y ayudar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group Santa Clara is conducting a survey on eliminating poverty, with which the will be able to understand each member's situation in life, and accordingly will strive to gradually improve this.

One of the members is Mrs. Rosalva, a dressmaker and hairdressers. She is doing very well in both of these jobs, which is why she already has very good clientele. She is a very strong person, and will do her best to succeed and to continue to be able to grow.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and others things, with which she will be able to give an excellent service to her clients. Similarly, the other members of the group want to be able to improve their lives and to help their families.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other.

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Monica, who is in her mid 30s, is single with two daughters.  One of her daughters is still young while the other one is still in school. She has been running a grocery store for ten years now.  She works from 7pm to 11pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Monica's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start a catering business and increase her drinks stock. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, started to build her house, pay back her loan repayments and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy beers, sodas, juice, wines, spirits for her grocery store.  She dreams of finishing building her house.

Monica will share this loan with her loan group " Nadia" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beers, sodas, juice, wines and spirits for her grocery store.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard, instilled with a hard-working and adventurous spirit, has been making a living through mixed farming over the past 9 years with a set goal in mind: to be able to get ahead and, together with his family, build a good future. He resides in the Litein area of Kenya. His primary sources of income have been milk, poultry and some “side hustles” he does to supplement the meager income he earns from farming. Benard is seeking a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Juhudi Kilimo serves poor smallholder farmers in Kenya. This is a severely marginalized group with little access to financial services. By extending credit to the farmers, Juhudi helps them acquire assets like dairy cows, poultry, irrigation equipment, and greenhouses.  

Through this loan from Kiva lenders, Benard will buy not just an ordinary cow but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 10-20 litres of milk a day. The additional milk will result in additional income and hence improved living conditions. The income generated from selling the milk will be used to fully repay the loan, and will also go towards the education of his children. He will also benefit from the cow manure which will be used to increase the fertility level of his farm, hence increasing productivity. Through the loan he will also be able to build a bio-gas digester that will be helpful in saving energy. 

This loan will completely change his life and improve his living conditions. Benard waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венера, 44 года, замужем, мать 5 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, вместе с супругом занимаются животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 2 лошади, на 0,5 Га земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду, Венеры на сегодняшний день она имеет хорошую прибыль от бизнеса в среднем 9,300 сом в месяц (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Венера обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. Венера является лидером группы "Нуркунай", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 4 человека, всего их 5. Доходы от кредита Венера планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и накопить на приданное для ее дочери.
texts.en:
Venera is 44 years old, married, and the mother of five children.  She has a specialized-secondary education.  In order to provide a source of income for their family, Venera and her husband have been involved in animal husbandry and crop farming for the past 15 years.  Venera now has two cows and two horses on her farm.  She also grows beans on 0.5 hectares of land and then sells her production.  Thanks to her very hard work, Venera now makes a decent income from her business: 9,000 som (KGS) on average per month.

In order to further grow her business, Venera has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy two steers.  Venera is the leader of the "Nurkunai" group, which comprises an additional four members, so five people in all.  Venera is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her business and to save some money toward her daughter's dowry.

loans.use: to purchase two steers for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira, aged 46, is a mother of three sons and four daughters. Her son owns an embroidery shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However he finds this difficult due to a lack of money.  This material will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

Therefore his mother, Saira is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her son.  He will purchase an embroidery machine and raw embroidery material. Saira is feeling happy that she will be able to help her son with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery machine and raw material for her son's embroidery shop.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 36 years old. He is married with 3 children aged between 3 and 11 years, two of whom go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing rice for the past 15 years. His wife is a business woman. With this loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer and pay school fees for his children. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Valoyat

texts.ru: Валояту 39 лет. Она проживает на в городке под названием Куляб. Народ Куляба славится своим не сравнительным стилем гостеприимства и чувство юмора. Валоят жена и мать пятерых детей. У нее трое сыновей в возрасте 15, 13 и 10 лет. Двум дочкам 17 и 11 лет. Валоят занимается продажей ткани и одежды на округе городка Куляб. Она ходит по маленьким деревням и дальних селах, которым тяжело добираться до города. Валоят понимает как им тяжело и ставит не большие цены на свой товар. Уже наступила весна и Валояту теперь необходимо купить новый товар. Она собирается купить весеннюю одежу и ткани. На все это нужны средства и она надеется получить кредит, чтобы реализовать свой план.
texts.en: Valoyat is 39 years old.  She lives in the city of Kulob.  The people of Kulob are famous for their exceptional hospitality and their sense of humor.  Valoyat is the married mother of five children.  She has three sons who are 15, 13 and 10 years old, and two daughters who are 17 and 11.  Valoyat sells fabrics and clothes around the city of Kulob.  She goes to small villages and remote hamlets with poor access to the city.  Valoyat understands how difficult it is for the residents of those localities and she sells her goods at reasonable prices.  Spring is here already, and Valoyat needs to buy new merchandise.  She is planning to buy spring clothes and fabrics.  To do so, she needs some money and she is hoping to receive a loan, in order to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy spring clothes and fabrics.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 39 year old married man with 3 children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He has a business running a restaurant and at the same time earns a salary from teaching in a local government. He is challenged with low capital that make him lag behind in terms of business development. However, he has future hopes of having an expanded business to new areas. He has asked for a loan to buy plastic chairs, screen and DSTV for his business so as to attract more customers and increase his sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs, a screen and DSTV  for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cement the floor in her house.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: SIMON: Es un joven cordial de 25 años de edad, con deseos de superación. Originario de Rosita, debido a la falta de un trabajo formal, comercializa oro. Con gran esfuerzo, poco a poco ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda. Solicita su primer préstamo para terminar de construir su vivienda de concreto. Sueña con tener un negocio prospero, incrementar el inventario de su materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en: Simon is a friendly young man, 25 years old, with desires to improve himself. He is from Rosita and due to the lack of a formal job, he sells gold. With great effort, little by little he has begun the construction of his house. He asks for his first loan to finish building his concrete house. He dreams of having a prosperous business, and increasing his raw material for his business.

loans.use: to finish building his concrete house.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es: 3.	MARIA JESUS: Es una señora sonriente de 39 años de edad, originaria de Rosita, casada con 3 hijos que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad. Debido a la falta de un empleo forma y con el deseo de apoyar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, vende de manera ambulante accesorios para damas. Solicita financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda, ya que actualmente habita en casa de familiares y viven en hacinamiento. Ella sueña con tener un local para su negocio.
texts.en: Maria Jesus is a smiling woman, 39 years old, from Rosita, married with 3 children who are in primary and secondary school. Her husband works as a security guard. Due to the lack of a formal job and with the desire to support the household expenses and her children's education costs, she sells ladies' accessories as a street vendor. She asks for a loan to begin building her house, since she currently lives in a relative's house and they live in an overcrowded situation. She dreams of having a retail space for her business.

loans.use: to begin building her house.

loans.name: Omar Denis

texts.es: OMAR DENIS: Es un joven jovial de 32 años de edad, originario de Rosita. Trabaja como enfermero. Con el deseo de apoyar a su mamá y brindarle una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para construirle el piso de cascote (cemento), actualmente es de tierra. El sueña con continuar ayudando a su mama, en su salud que se encuentra delicada y en brindarle una vivienda bonita.
texts.en: Omar Denis is a friendly young man, 32 years old, from Rosita. He works as a nurse. With the desire to support his mother and offer her a secure and respectable house, he asks for a loan to install a cement floor, currently it is a dirt floor. He dreams of continuing to support his mother, who has delicate health, and offering her a nice house.

loans.use: to improve his mother's house.

loans.name: Jessenia Corina

texts.es: JESSENIA: Es una joven afable de 29 años de edad, luchadora, madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad estudia su cuarto grado (se muestra en la fotografía). Originaria de Rosita. Trabaja como docente de escuela primaria. Con gran esfuerzo, poco a poco ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de minifalda (concreto y madera). Sin embargo con su salario no le cubre para realizarle algunas mejoras como construir el cerco de maya, para brindarle mayor seguridad a su hijo. Es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para comprar maya, madera, grapas, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una vivienda bonita, segura y digna.
texts.en: Jessenia is a friendly young woman, 29 years old, determined, a single mother who has a 9-year-old son who is in fourth grade (he is shown in the photograph). She is from Rosita. She works as a primary school teacher. With a lot of effort, little by little she has begun construction of her minifalda (concrete and wood) house. However, with her salary it is not enough to pay for some improvements such as building a wire fence to offer her son more security. It is for this that they ask for a loan to purchase wire, wood, staples, nails, and pay labor costs. She dreams of having a pretty, secure, and respectable house.

loans.use: to build a wire fence

loans.name: Marbely Del Socorro

texts.es: MARBELY DEL SOCORRO: Es una señora sonriente de 31 años de edad. Originaria de Rosita, casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 11 años estudia su primer año de secundaria y un pequeño de 3 años. Su esposo trabaja como conductor. Ella cuenta con una experiencia de 11 años de ser docente de escuela primaria. Con gran esfuerzo poco a poco ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de madera, sin embargo con su salario no le cubre para realizarle algunas mejoras como la construcción de un anexo que será utilizado como cuarto para sus hijos. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, clavos, zinc, cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella y su esposo sueñan con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: Marbely del Socorro is a smiling, 31-year-old woman. She is from Rosita and is married with 2 children, the older one is 11 years old and in his first year of secondary school and the little one is 3 years old. Her husband works as a driver. She has 11 years of experience as a primary school teacher. With great effort, little by little she has begun building her house of wood. However, her salary is not enough to make some improvements such as building an addition that will be used as a bedroom for her children. With the loan, she will purchase planed lumber, nails, zinc, and pay labor costs. She and her husband dream of having a lovely house, with better conditions of security and a better environment for their children.

loans.use: to build an addition that will be used as a bedroom for her children.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
MANUEL DE JESUS: Es un señor amable, trabajador de 63 años de edad. Originario de Rosita, casado con 2 hijos: Una mayor de edad y el menor de 11 años de edad estudia su 5to grado de primaria. Su esposa es ama de casa. Debido a la falta de un empleo formal, estableció su taller de soldadura. Solicita financiamiento para cambiar madera de su casa de tambo y madera que se encuentra deteriorada. El sueña con mejorar sus equipos y herramientas de trabajo. 

En la fotografía se muestra al cliente con su hijo menor de 11 años y nietas, nietos.
texts.en:
Manuel de Jesus is a nice, working man at 63 years old. He is native to Rosita and married with two children: one adult and the younger one is 11 years old and in the 5th grade. His wife is a housewife. Due to lack of formal employment, he established his welding shop. 

He is asking for funding to change the wood on his stilt house and wood that is deteriorated. He dreams of improving his work equipment and tools. 

The photograph shows the client with his 11 year old son, grandson and granddaughter.

loans.use: to change the wood on his stilt house.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Pora, está en su ciclo número 29 del programa de comité de mujeres, además ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar e ir mejorándola.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Jacinta quien es modista, es muy Buena en lo que hace, y es por ello que ya tiene una muy Buena clientela que siempre le hace muchos pedidos de confecciones. Es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por su familia y sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Jacinta de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para sus confecciones, como ser telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros, lo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Kuña Pora group is a committee of women in its 29th cycle. They do a survey to determine the status of life of each of them and work accordingly to make it better.
One of the members is Ms. Jacinta who is a dressmaker. She is very good at what she does, and that is why she already has a very good clientele that always place many orders. She is a hardworking entrepreneur who fights for her family and loved ones.
Ms. Jacinta is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials for her clothing, such as fabric, thread, rubber, buttons and other items which would be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy fabric, yarns, rubbers, buttons and other items,

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es: FERMINA: Es una mujer luchadora de 50 años de edad, casada. Tiene  6 hijos: 5 son mayores de edad e independientes y el menor de 19 años estudia su carrera universitaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar y estudio de su hijo, desde hace 19 años vende frito, refresco en su vivienda de tambo y madera. Solicita financiamiento para comprar ingredientes e insumos para elaborar frito: pollo, filipitas, aceite, repollo, vinagre, tomate, pepino, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener un comedor que brinde las condiciones adecuadas a su clientela de Bilwi.
texts.en: Ferimina is a determined woman, 50 years old, and married. She has 6 children, 5 are adults and independent, and the youngest is 19 years old and is a university student. With the goal of having her own source of income and to support the household expenses and her son's schooling, for the past 19 years she has sold fried foods and soft drinks in her stilt house made of wood. She asks for a loan to purchase ingredients and supplies to make fried foods: chicken, filipitas [a type of banana], oil, cabbage, vinegar, tomatoes, cucumber, and other products. She dreams of having a restaurant that offers fitting conditions to her customers in Bilwi.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies to make fried foods: chicken, filipitas [a variety of banana], oil, cabbage, vinegar, tomatoes, cucumbers, and other products.

loans.name: Karen Garnet

texts.es: KAREN GARNET: Es una mujer cordial de 30 años de edad, casada con un pequeño hijo de 9 años de edad que estudia su tercer grado de primaria. Trabaja como secretaria. Con gran esfuerzo desde hace 10 años, ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda. Sin embargo, necesita realizarle algunas mejoras como: Instalarle verjas y construir el piso de cascoquete (cemento), ya que actualmente el piso es de tierra y con su salario no le ajusta, por lo que solicita financiamiento para comprar materiales de construcción: cemento, arena y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en: Karen Garnet is a cordial 30-year-old woman, married with a young 9-year-old son who is in the third grade in primary school. She works as a secretary. With a lot of effort, she began building her house 10 years ago. However, she needs to make some improvements such as installing window bars and making a cement floor since currently it is a dirt floor and with her salary she doesn't have enough. So, she asks for a loan to purchase construction materials: cement, sand, and to pay labor costs. Her dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to install window bars and make a cement floor in her house.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
En su ciclo 7 se encuentra este grupo llamado Las Mercedes, que a su vez está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, por medio del cual podrá conocer su situación de vida y esforzarse por poder mejorarlo. 
La Sra.  Rosalba es una de las que integra este grupo, ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas de todo tipo, como ser tomates, locotes, cebollas y otros, ya que ella tiene Huerta con lo cual ayuda a su familia a tener una vida digna.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante y poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
texts.en: The group called "Las Mercedes" is in its seventh loan cycle, which is also within the program of poverty elimination where each one can learn of her life's situation and work hard to improve it. Rosalba is one of its members. She is requesting a loan to buy all types of seeds, such as for tomatoes, bell peppers, onions and others, because she has a vegetable garden with which she helps her family to have a decent living. She is a very hardworking person who struggles to move ahead and be able to give her loved ones everything that she could not have.

loans.use: to buy seeds for tomato, bell peppers, onions, and others.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado Kuña  Guapa se encuentran en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo que se formó con la esperanza de que todas vayan mejorando cada día. Ellas también están dentro del  programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Simeona quien es una señora muy activa  se destaca en ella las ganas y deseos de superación demuestra siempre una actitud positiva, ella desea dedicarse a la venta de chipa, y con el préstamo quiere comprar leche, huevo, harina de maíz, queso y otros para poder hacer chipas para la venta.
La señora Simeona  está dispuesta en trabajar constantemente y mejorar su calidad de vida de su entorno familiar.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa group is in its first cycle. It is a new group that was formed in the hope that everything will get better every day. They are also in the program to eliminate poverty.
One of the members is Simeona who is a very active lady who stands on the will and desire to excel and always demonstrates a positive attitude. She wants to sell "chipa" (a cake made from cornflour), and is requesting this loan to buy milk, egg, corn flour, cheese and other items to make chipas to sell.
Simeona is willing to work hard to improve the quality of life of her whole family.

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs, corn flour, cheese and other items.

loans.name: Jovenes Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de jóvenes está integrado por 5 de ellos, cada uno de ellos está poniendo  su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser de ayuda para sus familias y sus seres queridos, para que así ellos puedan sentirse útiles.
Aldo es uno de los integrantes, es una persona con discapacidad  que se incorpora al grupo, teniendo así una oportunidad valiosa para desarrollar sus conocimientos, él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de artesanías.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar hilos, telas y demás materiales para la elaboración de artículos artesanales lo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This youth group consists of 5 members, each of them is doing their best to be of help to their families and loved ones, so that they can feel useful.
Aldo, one of the members, is a disabled person who joins the group. Having a valuable opportunity to develop his knowledge, he is engaged in the manufacture and sale of handicrafts.
He is requesting this loan to buy yarn, fabric and other materials for the production of handicrafts which will be very helpful.

loans.use: to buy yarn, fabric and other materials for the production of handicrafts.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado PRIMAVERA está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 17 mujeres que hacen todo lo posible para salir adelante con sus familias. Estas señoras mejoraron sus ingresos gracias al trabajo unido de todas y de las capacitaciones que ha ido recibiendo.
Se destaca entre estas mujeres la Sra. Stella, quien hace artesanías en ao poi, el cual es un tejido típico paraguayo. Por medio de este trabajo y de sus artesanías ayuda a sus seres queridos y les da una vida digna y sin privaciones. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que quiere salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de telas de Ao poi e hilos para poder seguir con sus artesanías.
texts.en:
The group named PRIMAVERA is in its sixth cycle of its women's committee program.  The group is made up of 17 women who do everything possible to help their families get ahead. These women improve their earnings thanks to their teamwork and the trainings that they have been receiving.  Among these women is Senora Stella who makes crafts in "ao poi," a traditional Paraguayan lace and dress.  Thanks to this work and her crafts she is able to help her loved ones and give them a life of dignity and without deprivation.  

Stella is a hardworking woman and a figther that wants to keep moving forward.  She requests this loan for the purchase of fabrics and threads so she can continue with her art of making traditional Paraguayan lace and clothes wear.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and threads to make traditional Paraguayan lace.

loans.name: Nhóm 06 Thôn Đại Đồng Quảng Chính Quảng Xương Group

texts.en:
Phương works in agriculture, raising livestock . She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future. 

Phương is 32 years old and she is married with two children. Phương is the group leader of the Nhóm 06 thôn Đại Đồng Quảng Chính Quảng Xương solidarity group, which consists of three members. Phương lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2015, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Phương has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phương has been involved in this business for 5 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Phương hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Calle Gimenez Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Calle Gimenez está en su ciclo número 2, donde cada una de las integrantes está luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y poder ayudar a sus familias, todo por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza. 
La Sra. Mercedes integra este grupo, ella tiene Huerta, y según su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza ella se encontraba en una pobreza extrema, pese a ello se esfuerza el doble para poder mejorar.
La Mercedes pide este préstamo para la compra de Semillas de Tomate, locote  y otros, lo que le ayudará  a la misma a obtener más producción y más venta el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Calle Gimenez Group is in its second loan cycle.  All of the members are striving to be able to improve their living conditions and help their families through the poverty elimination program.

Mercedes is a member of this group.  She has a garden and  was living in extreme poverty according to her poverty elimination survey.  Despite this, she makes double the effort so she can improve.

Mercedes is requesting this loan to buy tomato, chili pepper, and other seeds.  This will help her yield more crops and sales as well as improve her income.

loans.use: to buy tomato, chili pepper, and other seeds

loans.name: Km 66 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Km  66 está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres. Está ubicado en la ciudad de Caacupé, donde todas tienen la expectativa de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del programa de comités.
Wilma integra este grupo, ella se dedica a hacer comidas que hace todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, y que después sale a vender. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere crecer y salir adelante para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, condimentos, y otros para poder seguir con la elaboración de sus comidas, y seguir luchando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The group called "Km  66" is in its first loan cycle of the program of the women's committee. It is located in the city of Caacupé, where all the women expect to be able to improve their life conditions through the committee's program. Wilma is a member of this group. She works preparing meals that she makes every day from very early in the morning, and that she goes out to sell afterwards. She is a very hardworking and resolute woman who wants to grow and prosper in order to help her family. She is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, meat, spices, and other ingredients to continue preparing her meals, and keep on struggling as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, spices, and other ingredients to prepare meals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabrics, buttons and other things.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 59 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and other groceries.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lourdes aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, canned goods, noodles and other groceries

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years, widowed with seven children, and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in buying and selling fish and rice and gets additional income from cocoa growing. She started the business 10 years ago to get income. 

Grace works hard and has plans for expanding the business and supplying bigger markets but faces problems of high competition and long distances which affect her fish before delivery to market.  Grace wants a loan to buy rice and fish to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy rice and  fish to  sell to her customers.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Fe y Esperanza está en su ciclo número 18 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Lorenza es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que está esforzándose para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su humilde trabajo que consiste en el reciclado de productos que hace de manera ambulante, también los compra y luego revende al por mayor para poder tener sus ganancias. Ella está contenta con lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo honesto.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar aluminio, cartones, plásticos y demás de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, luchando por sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Fe y Esperanza Group is in its eighteenth loan cycle in the women's bank program.  All of them work and help each other get ahead.

Lorenza is a member of this group.  She's a very hardworking person who's making an effort to be able to help her family through her humble job recycling products.  She works on foot and also buys and then resells wholesale so she can earn a living.  She's happy with what she does because it's an honest job.

Lorenza's requesting this loan to be able to buy aluminum, cardboard, plastic, and other materials so she can keep working as she has been doing and striving for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, cardboard, plastic, and other materials to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 08 Thôn Phú Lương Xã Quảng Chính Group

texts.en:
Hương is 38 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Hương works in agriculture, raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for five years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2014, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hương has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the Nhóm 08 thôn Phú Lương xã Quảng Chính solidarity group. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

In the future, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Nhóm 09 Cụm 24 Thôn Tân Quảng Nham Group

texts.en:
Huệ is 48 years old and she is single with four children.  She lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Huệ works in agriculture raising poultry. She has been involved in this business for seven years. 

In 2012, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ is the group leader of the Nhóm 09 cụm 24 thôn Tân quảng Nham solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. 

The main hardship that Huệ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, she hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet used the previous loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, soap, and posho to sell. She is in retail, and at the same time has a tea room business that adds more income. She is facing a hardship of low capital, which hinders the progress of her business. However, she is working very hard to make sure she gets a better and bigger business. 

Juliet has asked for a loan to buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Jean Claude is 36 years old. He is married with two children, aged 2 and 7 years. One of them goes to school. 

He is a farmer, and he has been growing rice for the past 14 years. His wife is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy cattle.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nat makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farm laborer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nay's Group

texts.en:
Nay’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia.  Nay makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Fousseyni's Group

texts.fr:
Fousseyni, au dernier rang à gauche sur la photo et portant un vêtement noir et tenant la pochette myAgro, est membre d'un groupe de 14 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Niame, au sud-ouest de Bamako, au Mali. Fousseyni, qui est âgé de 65 ans, vit dans une famille de 39 personnes dont 17 enfants. Dans un village où l'agriculture représente l'activité dominante, cette activité lui permet d’assurer l’autosuffisance alimentaire de sa famille. 

Fousseyni entame sa première année au sein du programme myAgro et a été motivé à l'idée d' obtenir de meilleurs rendements et d'accéder à un système de paiement lui permettant de payer progressivement pour son paquet agricole. Fousseyni effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs pour sa parcelle d’un hectare. A travers cet achat, Fousseyni espère pouvoir mettre sa famille à l'abri de la faim grâce à de meilleurs rendements et à un meilleur revenu. Il envisage également de faire construire une maison et d'acheter un semoir pour améliorer sa technique de semis l'année prochaine.
texts.en:
Fousseyni, in the second row on the left in the photo, wearing black clothing and holding his myAgro passbook, is a member of the group of 14 farmers who work and live in the village of Niame, southwest of Bamako, Mali.
