Fousseyni, who is 65 years old, lives in a family made up of 39 persons, of whom 17 are children. In a village where agriculture represents the dominant activity, this business permits him to ensure food self-sufficiency for his family. 

Fousseyni is beginning his first year in the myAgro program and his motivation is the idea of getting better harvests and accessing a system of payment which allows him to pay progressively for his agricultural package. Fousseyni makes the payments in order to buy a package of OPV seeds and fertilizer for growing maize on his plot of one hectare. Through this purchase, Fousseyni hopes to guard his family from hunger thanks to better yields and a better income. He also dreams of building a house and buying a seeding machine to improve his technique for seeding next year.

loans.use: to buy OPV seeds  and fertilizer for growing maize

loans.name: Nir's Group

texts.en:
Nir’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Nir makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokna Group

texts.en:
Sokna’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokna makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller by selling groceries to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mpoza Group

texts.en:
Madalo sells different products such as beans, rice and tomatoes. She greatly depends on this business for her daily source of income. Madalo is 25 years old and has two children, and keeps three orphans.

She started this business in order to financially support her family and send her children to better schools.

She will use the loan to boost up her business. 

She hopes of expanding her business and dreams of improving her living standards. Obtaining loans have helped her to become self-reliant, and she no longer depends on her husband.

loans.use: to buy rice and tomatoes

loans.name: Flor De Itapuami Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado (Flor de Itapuami) está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan para salir adelante. Han realizado la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que les permite ir mejorando poco a poco sus condiciones de vida, y la de sus seres queridos.
Elva, una de las integrantes, hace todo tipo de comidas, que desde temprano se levanta a hacer, es muy buena con la comida, es por ello que tiene muy buena clientela. Es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora que quiere ir creciendo y mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, hortalizas, panificados y otros. Ella quiere ir mejorando cada día, es por ello que se esfuerza cada día.
texts.en:
The Flor de Itapuami group is a women's committee in its first cycle where they all work and help each other to succeed. They try to eliminate poverty and this allows them to slowly improve the living conditions of them and their loved ones.
Elva, one of the members, makes all kinds of food. She gets up early to do and is very good with the food, which is why she has very good clientele. She is a hardworking entrepreneur who wants to continue growing and becoming better.
She is requesting this loan to invest in buying supplies to make her meals, such as vegetables, meat, bread and other items. She wants to get better and this is what she strives for every day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, bread and other items.

loans.name: Riyasat

texts.en:
Riyasat is a 35-year-old woman, and the mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is vegetable seller by profession; he sells vegetables, e.g. tomatoes, potatoes, lady fingers, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Riyasat's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables to sell so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase vegetables for his business purposes.

Therefore Riyasat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband purchase the above items for business purposes. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable business

loans.name: Reya

texts.en:
Reya is aged 41 years. She is married with six children, aged between 4 and 20 years. Five of them go to school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past 21 years, while her husband is a businessman. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow rice.

loans.name: Muvafe Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado MUVAFE es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Encarnación con la unión de amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, son mujeres luchadoras que quieren salir adelante, es por ello que están haciendo a su vez la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Sergia, directora de Finanzas del Comité, quien se dedica a la elaboración y venta de manualidades. Su esposo también trabaja como mecánico y posee un ingreso estable, son una familia trabajadora que está luchando, tanto la Sra. Sergia como su esposo quieren un mejor futuro para su familia.
La Sra. Sergia pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros, para poder seguir haciendo sus manualidades, con lo cual lucha para ir mejorando su situación de pobreza. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The MUVAFE group was formed in the city of Encarnación with the union of friends and neighbors in that city who are fighting women who want to succeed, which is why they are trying to eliminate poverty.
One of them is Sergia, Director of Finance of the Committee who is engaged in making and selling crafts. Her husband also works as a mechanic and has a steady income. They are a working family but are struggling, and both Sergia and her husband want a better future for their family.
Sergia is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, rubber and other items, to continue making crafts, with which she fights to keep improving their quality of life. She is grateful for the opportunity to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, rubber and other items.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Thy’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Thy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor and a construction worker to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nun's Group

texts.en:
Nun’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Nun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en:
Yat’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Yat makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vat's Group

texts.en:
Vat’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Vat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sarak's Group

texts.en:
Sarak’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia.  Sarak makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a motor driver to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
Khim’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Khim makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ngan's Group

texts.en:
Ngan’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Ngan makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer está en su ciclo número  8vo, además están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, todas ellas tienen la expectativa de poder mejorar sus vidas para ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Zonia, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, siempre trata de tener una buena variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes, es por eso que le va muy bien y se ha hecho de fama de ser una excelente persona y vendedora. Sueña con poder tener una tienda donde poder ofrecer a sus clientes todo lo que piden.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de frutas y verduras varias en cantidad, ya que tiene mucha demanda y quiere poder cumplir con todos sus dicentes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Renacer group is now in it's eight cycle, and all of the members are participating in the poverty elimination survey. Everyone in the group has the expectation that they will be able to improve their lives and support their families in the futire. 

One of the members is Zonia. Zonia makes a living from selling fruit and vegetables, she always tries to have a wide variety to offer her customers, this has given her fame as a great vendor. 

Zonia dreams of having her own store where she can offer her customers all the things they are looking for. Zonia needs this loan to buy different fruits and vegetables in a greater quantity. She has high demand for her wares and wants to be able to meet all of her clients needs. 

Zonia is very grateful for this opportunity which will really help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn, 29, comes from Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is a garment factory worker and earns, on average, an income of USD $6 a day. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for ten years. 

Recently, some parts of her house have deteriorated, and they need to be fixed to provide a suitable living place for the household. Due to the lack of funds, she has applied for a Kiva loan via HKL to pay for her house renovation. She and her family will be thankful to the lenders for helping them with the loan funding to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay for her house renovation

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, ella al culminar sus estudios se ve trabajando en el Palacio de Justicia de su Ciudad, para poder aplicar los conocimientos que ha adquirido.
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza para poder ser alguien en la vida, y para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
María is studying law.  She envisions herself working in the courthouse in her city when she completes her studies, so she can apply the knowledge she has acquired.

She's a person who makes an effort to be somebody in life and to give her loved ones a decent life.

María's requesting this loan to pay the fees for her program, which will be a big help to her.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Auen

texts.en:
Auen, 57 years old, lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has two children. He is a palm juice harvester. On average, he is able to make earnings of USD $5 a day. So far, he has been in this career for 20 years.

Currently, he would like to request a Kiva loan via HKL to buy a motorbike. This loan will allow him to have a personal vehicle so that he can experience a convenient way of traveling. He is thankful to all lenders for the financial support. He is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly, 37, lives in community of Kandal Province, Cambodia. She is the mother of one child who is currently in school. 

To make a living and support her family, Ly has been involved in a buy-and-sell vegetable business since 2011. On average, she is able to make an income of USD 7.00 a day.

Ly wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. 

Therefore, she is taking a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

Ly is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is 29 years old and is a mechanic and spare parts seller. He is single and supports five of his siblings. He has been in this business for the last five years and is doing great.

This marks his third borrowing from Visionfund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts for resale and welding wires, and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and get more income. 

He will use the anticipated profit to educate his siblings, and in the future, he hopes to own a big motor vehicle garage.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and welding wires to serve more customers and get more income to educate his siblings.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. All of children are attending school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs and selling vegetables.

Lorena dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en:
Anastasie is aged 41 years. She is married with five children aged between 2 and 17 years. Three of them go to school. She is a farmer, and she has been growing rice for the past 19 years. Also, her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is the responsible mother of one child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 12 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. 

Her husband needs to have maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good; it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to pay for maintenance of his taxi. Therefore, Rukhsana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Rukhsana's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. 

Rukhsana also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future. Rukhsana is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her husband's taxi

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en:
Pierre is aged 43 years. He is married with five children aged between 2 and 18 years. Three of them to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing rice for the past 19 years. Also, his wife is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees of his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 38-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which, her husband is unable to generate any amount of income. Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. 

However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Shakeela has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Shakeela is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Shehzadi

texts.en:
Shehzadi is the responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Shehzadi's husband has been providing transportation services by driving a taxi for twenty years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to make maintenance of his taxi because its current condition is not good; it requires more maintenance on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial funds, Shehzadi's husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Shehzadi has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Shehzadi's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transportation services to earn a profitable income. Shehzadi also plans to make savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Shehzadi is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her husband's taxi

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Sun’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as a seller by selling groceries to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and the woman to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Somart's Group

texts.en:
Somart’s Group lives in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. 

Somart makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses as well as save time spent collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family

loans.name: Mapalaga

texts.en:
Mapalaga is a jovial woman who says that her personality is what keeps her clients coming back again and again. 

The 55-year-old mother of four is a seamstress. Mapalaga designs unique fabrics ranging from curtains to bedding such as pillows, bedsheets, and duvets. 

Demand for her fabrics is increasing at such a rapid pace that she is requesting a loan to buy a second machine and larger amounts of material so as to sustain the current demand.
 
With the loan, Mapalaga will buy a sewing machine, cotton and linen materials to replenish her stock as well as increase her capacity. She will hire someone to operate the second machine in the process, creating employment as well.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, cotton and linen materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica es de la ciudad de Itá, estudia la carrera de Contabilidad, ya en el cuarto año. Su mayor objetivo es terminar su carrera y crecer como profesional, de esa manera darle una mejor vida a sus padres y futuramente a sus hijos.
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza mucho para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yessica is from the city of Itá. She's in her fourth year studying accounting. Her main objective is to finish her degree and mature as a professional. She will be able to give her parents and future children a better life. 
She is someone who tries had to become someone in life. 
She is asking for this loan to pay for her degree fees so that she can continue with her studies.

loans.use: pay her university fees.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia es de la ciudad de Villarrica, ella está estudiando la carrera de nutrición, por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino y mejorar su vida y ayudar a su familia.
Quiere ser una profesional útil a los demás y a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, ya que necesita poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Alicia is from the city of Villarrica.  She's studying nutrition.  She wants to make her own way, improve her life, and help her family.  She wants to be a professional who's useful to others and to society.

Alicia's requesting this loan so she can pay her program fees because she needs to cover this expense.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz es de la ciudad de Concepción, ella espera terminar su carrera de Arquitectura con éxitos para ayudar a su familia en lo que fuese necesario, tener un mejor ingreso y una carrera fructífera.
Su inspiración es su madre, ya que ella siempre le ha enseñado a luchar por sus metas.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Liz is from the city of Concepción.  She hopes to finish her architecture program successfully so she can help her family as necessary, earn a better income, and have a productive career.

Her inspiration is her mother, who always taught her to strive for her dreams.

Liz is requesting this loan to cover her university fees so she can continue striving for her goals.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo es estudiante del último año de la carrera de administración de empresas. Ella comenta que proviene de una familia trabajadora que lucha para salir adelante.
Su meta es ser un profesional de muchas cualidades, ser eficaz  y eficiente para poder ser un gran administrador de alguna reconocida empresa.
El pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de sus carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is a student who is in his last year of study toward a degree in Business Administration. He says that he comes from a hardworking family that strives to get ahead. His goal is to become a professional with many qualities, such as effectiveness and efficiency, so that he can be a successful manager for a well-known company.

Lorenzo is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his degree fees. As a result, he can continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Cinthya

texts.es:
Cinthya estudia la carrera de administración de negocios, con ello quiere poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad, ella esta luchando y creciendo para poder cumplir con sus metas. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar sus gastos de manutención.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Cinthya studies business administration.  She wants to be a useful professional in society.  She's striving and growing so she can realize her goals.

Cinthya's requesting this loan to pay her university fees so she can continue with her studies.  She said she used her previous loan to pay her expenses to support herself.

loans.use: to pay her university fees

loans.name: Hiyari Group

texts.en:
Prosperia, who is in her early 40s, is single with two children who are still at school. She has been running two projects, selling charcoal and second-hand bedsheets, for three years now. She works from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
This will be Prosperia's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the charcoal stock and started selling second-hand bedsheets, and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and increase the number of second-hand bedsheets to resell. She dreams of buying more and better second-hand bedsheets. 

Prosperia will share this loan with her loan group, "Hiyari," which consist of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and increase the number of second-hand bedsheets to resell.

loans.name: Faidika   Grp  Musoma Group

texts.en:
Mariam, who is in her early 60s, is a widow with seven children, and all of them are grown-ups.  She has been running two projects, selling charcoal and fabrics, for 11 years now.  She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Mariam's 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy sacks of charcoal and increased the fabrics stock, and has paid all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to save in her bank account, made loan repayments and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase her fabrics stock. She dreams of buying a plot of land.  

Mariam will share this loan with her loan group "Faidika Grp Musoma," which consists of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and to increase the stock of fabrics.

loans.name: Mtakatifu Group

texts.en:
Revocatus, who is in his mid 50s, is single with eight kids who are still going to school. He has been running a grocery store for six years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Revocatus' first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy beers, spirits, sodas and water, which are out of stock in his grocery, and meet his customers' demand. He dreams of making his business into a bar.

Revocatus will share this loan with his loan group "Mtakatifu Group," which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy beers, spirits, sodas and water, which are out of stock in his grocery, and meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Al Asdikaa Group

texts.en:
Abir is the featured borrower for Al Asdikaa Group. She got along with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and lives at the same time.

Abir is a 36-year-old married lady who has been working in a clothing shop since three years ago to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is an ambitious and sacrificing lady who is trying hard to improve her living conditions; thus, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house and make it a healthier place. Abir is the first lady on the right of the photo.

With respect to the other group members, Lilian is the lady standing in the middle, and Inas is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her house and make it a healthier place

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Sreng, 50, lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five children. To make a living and support the family, she manages and operates a farming process, primarily cassava, and sells her agricultural product to the local dealers and customers in market. So far, she has been in this business for 15 years. On average, she is able to make earnings of USD $5 a day.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies for her farming. To continue her farming, she is borrowing some money from Kiva now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. She is thankful to lenders for the financial support. She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Jeremie

texts.en:
Jeremie is 33 years old. He is married with four children aged between 2 and 10 years. Two of them go to school. He is a farmer, and he has been growing rice for the past 14 years, while his wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.en:
Maria Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur with four children.

Maria Luz runs a tailoring shop in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Maria Luz dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: San Cayetano 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité “San Cayetano II” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní, cada una desarrolla actividades independientes, pero se ayudan las unas a las otras para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Silveria, quien integra este grupo es modista, ella es una persona muy buena en lo que hace, es por eso que ya tiene una buena clientela formada que siempre le hace muchos pedidos. Ella quiere seguir capacitándose para poder crecer y mejorar cada día. Su sueño es poder tener un taller grande donde dar trabajo a muchas personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The committee named “San Cayetano II” was formed as a result of several neighbors from the city of Santaní joining together. Each member engages in a separate business activity, but they help one another so that the can grow and move forward.

Silveria is a member of this group and works as a seamstress. She is a person who is very good at what she does. For this reason, she has a well-established clientele that is always placing many orders. Silveria wants to continue her training so that she can grow and improve each day. Her dream is to have a large workshop where she can provide jobs to many people.

Silveria is requesting this loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other supplies so that she can continue her sewing just as before. She appreciates the opportunity she has received so that she can keep growing.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other supplies.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramon hoy esta en el tercer año de la carrera de medicina, lucha para poder ser un profesional que sea útil a la sociedad y a las demás personas, es un joven luchador y sacrificado. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su carrera y sus gastos de transporte.
Pide este préstamo nuevamente para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Ramón is now in his third year of medical school.  He strives to be a professional who is useful to other people and to society.  He's a persevering and selfless young man.

He said he used the previous loan to pay his university fees and his transportation expenses.  He's requesting another loan to pay his fees so he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 26 years old. She is married and they have one child. She has been operating her business for five years, making a monthly income of 17,000 Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, and she will use the money to purchase sugar, flour and rice. 

She intends to use her anticipated profits to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to be a successful business person.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, flour and rice to sell

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
YEAN, 33, is a married woman who lives in a rural area of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children in total. 

To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business, growing rice and selling the crops to the local dealers. So far, she has been involved in this type of business for 25 years. She is able to make an income of USD 3.00 per day, on average.  

Recently, she came up with a new business idea. She wants to contract with a cashew plantation and harvest for benefit. 

Therefore, she would like to apply for KIVA loan and she will use this loan as capital investment for her business with cashews. With the support from this loan, she hopes that she can get more income and improve her living standards. 

She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support toward poor people.

loans.use: to contract with a cashew plantation and harvest for benefit

loans.name: Freciah

texts.en:
Fraciah is 42 years old. She is married with two children. She sells second-hand clothes and has been in the business for four years. She gets a monthly income of 30,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase a stock of bed sheets, mattresses and bags to expand her business. 

She plans to use the profits to expand her business. In future she wants to become a wholesaler in the second-hand clothing business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of bags and bed sheets

loans.name: Nelly Haydee

texts.es:
En  el sector conocido como El Cady en la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las socias  del Grupo De Crédito 27 de Julio. Los mismos que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como la agricultura y al comercio en general.
En este lugar vive la señora Nelly, tiene 45 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión de la cual tienen 4 hijos, tres mayores y uno de 14 años el cual estudia en colegio y es el único que aun vive con ellos. El marido es agricultor.
Doña Nelly es una mujer que le gusta trabaja para ayudarle a  su marido con los gastos que genera el hogar y los estudios de su hijo, ella se dedica al comercio, vende sabanas, toldos, edredones, toallas y varios productos más, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres o cuatro días por semana ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra por semana. Ella está muy agradecida con la institución y con las personas que ayudan para que ella pueda recibir los créditos, porque los créditos le facilitan la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar sabanas, edredones, toldos, toallas entre otras cosas. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The neighborhood known as “El Cady” in the city of Portoviejo is where the members of the “27 de Julio” (July 27th) Communal Bank meet every 15 days. They engage in a diverse number of business activities ranging from agriculture to general trade.

Sra. Nelly lives in this place. She is 45 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has four children. Three of her children are grown and her youngest son is a 14-year-old high school student. He is the only child who still lives at home. Her husband is a farmer.

Doña Nelly is a woman who enjoys working so that she can help her husband with the household expenses and with her son’s education. She is a merchant who sells bed sheets, awnings, bedspreads, towels, and various other products. Her sales are conducted by going door-to-door. She travels three or four days a week in order to offer her products on credit and collect payments on a weekly basis. Nelly is extremely grateful to Fundación ESPOIR and the people who have helped her to access the loans because they have made her life easier.

This loan will be used to buy bed sheets, bedspreads, awnings, towels, and other products. Nelly is the founder of her Communal Bank and enjoys the help that the loans have provided. Her dreams include providing the best for her son.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets, bedspreads, awnings, towels, and other products.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
This is Claudine, aged 27 years. She is married with two children, aged 1 and 3 years; they are not yet in school. 

She is a farmer and she has been growing rice for the past seven years. Also, her husband is a farmer. 

With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow for rearing.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Syrga

texts.ru: Сырга, 36 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, работала в детском саду, сейчас в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством. Супруг предоставляет услуги трактора и комбайна местному населению. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, на 2,3 Га земли она выращивает картофель для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду, Сырга на сегодняшний день имеет ежемесячную прибыль от - 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сырга обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели и 10 овец для откорма и перепродажи. Сырга является одной из 5 участников группы "Нуркунай". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и постройку дома для своей семьи.
texts.en: Syrga is 36, married, and the mother of four children. She has a high school education and used to work in a kindergarten. Now she earns the main source of income for her family by raising livestock and planting crops. Her spouse provides tractor and combine services to the local population. Syrga currently has two cows, ten sheep and a 2.3 hectare plot of land where she grows potatoes to sell. Thanks to her hard work, Syrga earns around 15,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her business, Syrga applied for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a calf and ten sheep to fatten and sell. Syrga is one of five members of the "Nurkunai" group. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in the future expansion of her business and to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and ten sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell and to buy staple products to open a small store

loans.name: Alondra Lilianeth

texts.es: ALONDRA LILIANETH: Es una joven sonriente y alegre de 22 años de edad. Originaria de Rosita, madre soltera de un hijo de 5 años que estudia su 3er nivel de pre-escolar. Ella trabaja como docente de escuela primaria. Con el objetivo de tener su propia vivienda, solicita financiamiento para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda de minifalda (concreto y madera), actualmente habita en su casa de su mamá. Ella sueña con establecer un cyber café para contar con otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Alondra Lilianeth is a young smiley and happy 22 year old woman.  She is from Rosita and is a single mother with a five year old child who is in the 3rd level of pre-school.  She works as a teacher in an elementary school.  Her goal is to obtain her own home.  She is asking for a loan in order to begin building her house made of concrete and wood. Currently she lives in her mother's home.  She dreams of starting a cyber cafe in order to develop another method of income.

loans.use: to begin building a house made of concrete and wood.

loans.name: Midian

texts.es:
Midian  es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijas mujeres de 10 y 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de frutas. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, constante, luchadora, y muy trabajadora. Su trabajo lo realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias de la ciudad caracterizada por el comercio de mercadería al por mayor y en grandes cantidades, donde acuden intermediarios y distribuidores a comprar en grandes cantidades los productos para distribuirlos a otros comerciantes, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. Midian es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio en la ciudad. Su vida la realiza con su esposo que trabaja como chófer y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de frutas por mayor, los productores del campo llegan hasta su puesto de venta a entregarle grandes cantidades de frutas que ella almacena y vende al por mayor. “heredé esta actividad de mi madre que se dedicaba a lo mismo, ahora tengo la oportunidad de introducir un nuevos productos como; yuca y plátano de freír…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes constantes la desventaja es que no cuenta con capital de inversión para ofertar nuevo productos. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio introduciendo nuevos alimentos a su oferta, ella piensa que será un negocio próspero porque sus clientes le exigen el producto y antes de producir ya cuenta con varios pedidos y desea realizar la compra de yuca y plátano de freír por mayor para ofertar nuevos alimentos a sus clientes.  Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años de experiencia en que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Midian solicita un préstamo para comprar yuca y plátano de freír por mayor, para ofertar nuevos alimentos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Midian is a 33 year old woman.  She is married and has two children ages 10 and 5.  Her business involves selling fruit.  She is hard-working, independent, a good mother, steady, a fighter, and very hard-working.  Her work is done as a walking saleswoman in different markets in the city characterized by their sales in bulk where intermediaries and distributors buy large quantities of products in order to distribute to businesses.  The area has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0 and 12 degrees centigrade.  Midian has brown skin, long black hair pulled back, brown eyes, short stature, a thin frame, and her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks with family, and Spanish, which she speaks for business and with the culture at large.  

She lives with her husband who works as a chofer and with her children who study in school.  She lives in a rented house made of brick and cement with an aluminum roof and she has running water, electricity and sewage.  Her business involves selling fruit in bulk.  Farmers come to her stall and sell her large quantities of fruit that she stores and sells in bulk.  "I inherited this work from my mother who worked in the same field.  Now I have the opportunity to introduce new products like yucca, fried plantains, etc. " she comments.  The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers.  The disadvantage is that she does not have capital to invest in offering new products.  Her dream is to grow her business by introducing new foods.  She thinks that this will make her business more successful because her customers demand the products and before producing them she already has several orders and she wants to make the purchase of yucca and plantains for frying in bulk in order to offer these new foods to her customers.  This is her first loan cycle with Kiva's field partner.  She has four years of experience in her field. 

For these reasons Midian is asking for a loan in order to purchase yucca and plantains for frying in bulk, in order to offer new foods to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase yucca and plantains for frying in bulk, in order to offer new foods to her customers.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn, 38, is married and lives in a small community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has four children who are currently in school. 

To make a living and support his family, Horn manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland located near his house. He grows rice on his farmland and sells his agricultural products to local dealers. On average, he can generate an earning of $2 (US) per day.

The current farmland, which he owns, is small and provides less benefit to him than a larger plot of land would. He wants to enlarge his farmland area but can’t afford to. Therefore, he would like a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. 

He hopes this additional farmland will help to improve his living conditions. He is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Elba Gladis

texts.es:
Elba, vive con sus dos hijos, ella es la única persona que genera ingresos para costear los gastos familiares, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero, se dedica a vender zapatos al mayoreo y al detalle, lo hace desde hace 15 años, lo aprendió con el apoyo de su papá, trabaja todos los días de ocho de la mañana a cinco de la tarde.
Invertirá en zapatos de hule y de cuero para tener mercadería con nuevos estilos, colores y tallas, esta compra le permitirá a Elba satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes y generar mayores ingresos para cubrir sus compromisos.
El objetivo que ella tiene es administrar bien el crédito para obtener mejores utilidades, resarcir su deuda y dar a su familia una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Elba lives with her two children. She is the only person who generates income to pay for household expenses.  She does not receive help from abroad. She works selling shoes in bulk and by order.  She has been doing this for 15 years.  She learned the job from her father.  She works every day from 8am until 5pm.  

She will invest in shoes made of leather and oil cloth in order to have merchandise in the newest styles, colors and sizes.  These purchases will allow Elba to satisfy her customers and generate more income to cover her responsibilities.  

Her goal is to administer her credit well in order to obtain better income, to pay off her debt, and to give her family a more comfortable life.

loans.use: invest in shoes made of leather and oil cloth in order to have merchandise in the newest styles, colors and sizes.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 43-year-old married woman with three children. She has had a phone accessories and M-PESA services business for 12 years. 

She makes a monthly income of 50,000 KES. She will use the loan to purchase phones, chargers, cartridges, and printing papers.  She hopes the business will be profitable so that she can open another branch.

This is her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya.  Her hopes and dreams for the future are educate her children and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase phones, chargers, catridges, and printing paper.

loans.name: Rehmat

texts.en:
Rehmat, 42, is the mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband, a fruit seller by profession, sells apples, bananas, grapes and other fruits. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Rehmat's husband needs to purchase different types of fruit to increase the size of his business, improve his sales and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not in a position to purchase more fruit.

Therefore, Rehmat has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to enable her husband to purchase different types of fruit to increase the size of his business. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to help her husband increase the size of his fruit business

loans.name: Jeannete

texts.en:
Jeannete, 34, is married with five children aged three to 13 years old. Three of them go to school. Jeannete is a farmer. She has been growing rice for the past 12 years. Her husband is a businessman. 

With a loan from Kiva, Jeannete would like to buy fertilizers and pay workers. The profits from her business will be used to buy a goat. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37 per cent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 per cent of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90 per cent of Rwandans (as of 2009). 

Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending for agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition, because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. 

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay workers.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 75-year-old married man with five children. He has had a rentals business for 10 years and makes an income of  20,000 KES  a month.

He will use the loan to purchase cement, sand, and ballast to construct  rental houses. He hopes this will help him to purchase land. This is his ninth loan with Vision Fund Kenya and he successfully repaid  previous loans.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to live a happy life and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and ballast.

loans.name: Jun

texts.en:
Jun is a 34-year-old man with three children. His eldest daughter attends school. Jun grew up in a very poor family and did not receive a formal education. He went to work when he was sixteen years old and learned wood processing skills. 

Jun and his wife run a successful wood processing shop and Jun is very honest and hard-working. The family bought a truck and a motorcycle for delivery purposes. Unfortunately, his father had broken his arms while delivering products. After his father was injured, Jan had no one to help with deliveries. Jun feels very depressed and he has a shortage of funds. 

He requests 20,000 CNY from Microcred, this is his third loan. He has a great credit history and will use part of the money to purchase raw materials to expand his business, and pay his father’s medical expenses. 

Jun said that with the help of Microcred, their business will develop.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials and help with medical expenses.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia isa 40-year-old woman with three children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband sells  tomatos, potatoes, onions  and other vegetables. He is responsible to feed the entire family and manage the house hold.

Sonia's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales, and earn maximum profit. However, he is not in condition to purchase vegetables for his business.

Sonia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to expand the vegetable business.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24-year-old married man, who has been working in a shoe factory since 2007 to make his living and to pay for his education.
He is an ambitious man, who both works and attends university.

Mohamad's limited monthly salary is barely enough to cover his family's needs, and sine his education is very important to him, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his university tuition fees.

He hopes to develop his career and graduate.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees.

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Sothea, 24, lives in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has three children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small farmland, primarily growing rice. She sells her agricultural products to local dealers and customers at the market. 

Sothea has been in this type of business for around five years. On average, she is able to earn $2.50 (US) a day. 

Currently, she would like to request a Kiva loan through Hattha Kaksekar to buy a motorbike. This loan will provide her with a personal vehicle to experience a convenient way of travelling. 

She would like to thank all lenders for their financial support and she awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Sr. Alfredo es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, se dedica a la venta ambulante de joyas de plata y relojes desde el año 2008, tiene una clientela formada, además es proveedor de las distintas joyerías de la ciudad.
El mayor anhelo del Sr. Alfredo es montar un local propio para la venta de sus joyas al por menor y mayor. Es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar joyas variadas para la venta, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Alfredo is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He has been selling silver jewelry and watches as a street vendor since 2008. Alfredo has an established clientele. He also is a supplier to various jewelry stores in the city.

His greatest wish is to open his own shop where he can sell jewelry, both retail and wholesale. He is a hardworking person, but above all else, he is enterprising.

Alfredo is requesting this loan so that he can buy various jewelry to sell. As a result, he can continue his sales just as before.

loans.use: to buy various jewelry to sell.

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
These members belong to a 5-member group called "God is able". They earn a living from various activities which have enabled them to improve their household finances. They live in different parts of Teshie. They sell vegetables, underwear, stationery, 'fuf, konkonte and soup', and detergent. 

Rita is a group members asking for her fifth loan. She is married and has two grown children. Her husband is a welder. The house they live in belongs to family members. Rita has sold adult and children's underwear for 16 years. She works from Monday to Saturday and uses the rest of the day to take care of her family. 

The loan will be used to buy a variety of underwear to sell to customers. This group is asking for 3,700 GHS to support business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of underwear to sell to customers.

loans.name: Chamrouen

texts.en:
Chamrouen lives in a community of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has four children. He has managed and operated a farm business on a small rice farm  located near his house for thirty years. He is able to earn 2.00 USD a day.

He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, there is no latrine in his house. He is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine to help family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Wendy Yamileth

texts.es:
Wendy, vende cosméticos por medio de revistas como AVON, ARABELA, ESIKA, etc., desde hace tres años, inicio su negocio por necesidad de recursos económicos para cubrir algunos gastos de su familia, vive en casas de su mamá, está acompaña y tiene un hijo de dos años, todos viven juntos.
Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en lociones, cremas corporales, jabones, mascarillas, labiales, etc., tendrá nuevos pedidos con los que surtirá las demandas de sus clientes y seguirá teniendo su fuente de ingresos.
Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y darle educación a su hijo para que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Wendy sells cosmetics via magazines such as Avon, Arabela, Esika, etc.  She has been doing this work for three years.  She began her business out of necessity for economic reasons in order to cover household expenses.  She lives at home with her mother and she has one 2 year-old son.  They all live together.  

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in lotions, body cremes, soaps, face masks, lip stick, etc.  This will provide her with new items that will meet demands from her customers and will help her continue to earn an income. 

Her dream is to have her own home and to give an education to her son so that he can be a professional.

loans.use: to invest in lotions, body cremes, soaps, face masks, lip stick, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Ermelinda

texts.es:
Rosa, de 54 años de edad, no estudio por motivos económicos, está casada y su pareja se dedica al trabajo en la agricultura, tienen 5 hijos pero ya todos están acompañados.

Rosa, no tiene ningún tipo de negocio, pero se dedica a la agricultura y también se dedica a los oficios domésticos desde hace más de 20 años, lo aprendió con sus padres porque desde muy pequeña le enseñaron a trabajar, sus cultivos están a 2 kilómetros desde su casa.

Con el préstamo lo necesita para comprar 2 cerditos para engordarlos y luego venderlos; además comprará insumos agrícolas.

Los sueños de Rosa, es llegar a tener una granja de cerdos y las ganancias invertirlas en el mejoramiento de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosa, 54, didn't attend school because of financial reasons.  She's married and her husband earns a living in agriculture.  They have five children who are all already married.

Rosa doesn't have a business but she earns a living in agriculture and is also a homemaker.  She learned the work from her parents, who taught her to work at a very young age.  Her crops are two kilometers from her house.

She needs the loan to buy two piglets to fatten and sell.  She's also going to buy agricultural inputs.

Rosa's dream is to have a pig farm and invest her earnings in improving her house.

loans.use: to buy two piglets to fatten and sell, and to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Rebeca Del Carmen

texts.es:
El sueño de Rebeca es tener una tienda de artículos varios, ya que desde hace más de 8 años, se dedica a la distribución de productos cosméticos y perfumes. Negocio que la ha ayudado con la economía de su hogar y ha logrado ser popular en su zona, gracia a la calidad de sus productos y a las  facilidades de pago que ofrece.
Rebeca solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de nuevos productos cosméticos como perfumes, delineadores, lápiz labial, cremas, tratamientos para el cabello, etc. Lo cual le generara mayores ganancias y podrá ahorrar para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: Rebeca's dream is to have a store that sells assorted goods.  For the past 8 years she has been working selling cosmetic and perfume products.  Her business has helped her meet household expenses and it has become popular in her area that to the quality of her products and the payments options that she offers.  Rebeca is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of new cosmetic products such as perfume, eyeliner, lip stick, creme, hair treatments, etc.  These will generate greater income and help her to save in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase new products such as perfume, eyeliner, lip stick, creme, hair treatments, etc. for her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Anny Altagracia

texts.es:
Anny Altagracia es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Anny, vivo con mis padres y estoy estudiando la carrera medicina, cuyos costo son insostenible para mí ya que soy una estudiantes de bajo recurso de un campo de castillo y estoy cursando el segundo semestre de dicha carrera  en   la universidad autónoma de Santo Domingo (UASD ) recinto de San Francisco de  Macorís.
Es importante ser agraciada con el préstamo de KIVA ya que este me ayudaría a cubrir mis estudios,  por que como dije al inicio vengo de un campo y tengo que pagar transporte, comprar libros, entre otras necesidades de mis estudios. 
Es un sueño para mi poder lograr ser médico, me gusta la carrera,  por medio a esta puedo ayudar a las personas más necesitadas ya que soy  servicial, y dentro de mis metas es ser una gran profesional y sentirme orgullosa por mi esfuerzo y gratificar a mis padres y que los mismos vean en mí su logro de sus valores infundido en mí.
texts.en: Anny Altagracia is a young student of medicine.  She is asking for a loan in order to cover educational expenses.  This is her story: My name is Anny.  I live with my parents and I am studying medicine. The costs are unsustainable for me since I am a student with limited resources from a rural area and I am studying in my second semester of Medical School in the Autonomous University of Santo Domingo (UASD) on the campus located in San Francisco de Macorís. I am grateful to Kiva for helping me with my studies, since as I said I come from the country and I have to pay for transport, to buy books, and to cover other expenses related to my studies.  My dream is to be able to become a physician. I like the field. In this way I will be able to help people in need. I enjoy helping and one of my goals is to be a great professional and to feel proud of my efforts and to make my parents proud so that they can see their values and accomplishments infused in me.

loans.use: To cover educational expenses for pursuing a Medical Degree

loans.name: Navruzsho

texts.ru: Это Наврузшо. Ему 40 лет. Он из  района Чиликул. Наврузшо женат и отец одного сына. Его жена домохозяйка она ведет домашнее хозяйство и параллельно занимается шитьем. Наврузшо ответственный и честный человек. У нее большая мечта купить малый рогатого скота и начать свой бизнес. В районе многие жители занимается этой видом деятельности и растениеводством и другие. Наврузшо именно выбрал животноводство, потому что его отец занимался той деятельности. Для старта бизнеса у Наврузшо нет денежных средств, по этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Запрашиваемый кредит поможет ему начать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
This is Navruzsho. He is 40 years old. He is from the Jilikul region. Navruzsho is married and the father of a son. His wife is a housewife; she manages the household and in parallel she sews. 

Navruzsho is a responsible and honest person. His big dream is to purchase sheep and goats and start a business. Many residents of the region work with this type of activity, with field crop cultivation and so on. Navruzsho chose livestock specifically because his father worked with this. 

Navruzsho does not have money to start a business. For this reason he applied for a loan. The requested loan will allow him to start his business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats and start a business of livestock breeding

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 35-year-old married man with three children. He has worked in a car sales showroom as a salesperson for five years.
His limited monthly salary is his only source of income for his family, since he is the sole breadwinner.

He requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees.

He hopes that he can develop his career to provide a better future for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his children's increasing school tuition fees.

loans.name: Etidal

texts.en: Etidal is a 55-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working in her grocery shop for fifteen years to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. Etidal is an ambitious and sacrificing mother, who is trying hard to develop her business. She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her inventory with new requested products and items to satisfy her customers' needs and attract new ones. Etidal hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her grocery shop.

loans.name: Loubna

texts.en: Loubna is a 32-year-old married mother of two children. She has been working as a tutor from her house for five years. She is a hardworking mother who puts much effort into helping her husband cover their living needs and expenses. Loubna is planning to develop her business site, which is located inside her house, so that she can manage both her business and family's needs at the same time. Through her acquired loan she will prepare a special tutoring room in her house to provide her students with a better educational place.

loans.use: To prepare a room in her house to run a tutoring business.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 47-year-old married woman with four children who are 25, 23, 20 and 19 years old. She has had a renting construction tools business for seven years and makes a monthly income of 15,000.

She will be using the loan to purchase construction materials and hopes this will help her to buy trappers for renting. This is her fourth loan with Vision Fund Kenya and repaid the previous loans successfully which have been profitable for her business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase  construction materials.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 46 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For 20 years, Lilia has operated a general store in the Philippines. Lilia requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to purchase more items such as bread, soft-drinks, noodles and other groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, an ever-smiling young farmer, is responsible and has had to overcome many difficulties in her life.  She has always found the strength to move forward and keep growing. 

She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture and is the proud owner of a small parcel of land and has done mixed farming for  ten years. She sells eggs and milk and earns a decent income. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Betty is passionate about dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She wakes up early every morning to milk her cows. Although this humble woman has been making profits selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk and customers flock to her farm for milk. 

Betty is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. She will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help to meet customer demand. Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught financial management skills and she will save money to successfully repay the loan fully and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph used the previous loan to purchase beans, rice and maize to resell. He sells maize and beans and grows bananas for commercial purposes. He faces fluctuating prices which hinder his progress. He hopes to construct a permanent house for his family. 

Joseph has asked for a loan to buy ground nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a 49-year-old married man living in Fort Portal Uganda. He sells produce and grows bananas. He is faced with challenges of unpredictable price changes and inadequate capital, that affects the growth of his business. He has future prospects of educating all his children. 

Innocent has asked for a loan to buy maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 35-year-old woman with 1 child residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  Her husband has run a general store for 12 years, and is  responsible to fulfill the needs of his entire family. 

Parveen's husband wants to purchase  rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, and other  items for his business but does not have the money.  Therefore Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy items and also help  him to earn a profitable income to manage his house hold and business. 

Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase the general store business.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela, age 35, lives with her family in Rawalpindi. She is the responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a retired government servant, and her son operates his own pharmaceutical sales and supply business.
 
Jameela's son would like to purchase a variety of types of medicines to offer for sale in his business, but due to insufficient financial means, he is not currently in the position to be able to buy them. Therefore, Jameela has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. She is confident that this investment will help her son to purchase necessary medicines for his business, thus enabling him to fulfill his business needs and allowing him to earn a more profitable income. She tells us that her son intends to use his increased profits to build savings, so that he can better meet the uncertain events of the future.
 
Jameela is very thankful to her Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy necessary medicines for her son to offer for sale in his pharmaceutical sales and supply business

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a responsible mother of four children who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has driven a taxi for ten years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He needs to repair and maintain his taxi but does not have the funds to do so. Therefore Naseem has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will help Naseem's husband to afford the maintenance and provide better transportation services.  Naseem  also plans to save money to meet her family's needs in future.

Naseem is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the taxi.

loans.name: Manegre 08 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr BENJAMIN est responsable du groupe  MANEGRE 08 SAPONE. Il est célibataire sans enfant  et il a 05 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage depuis 04 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 04 porcs.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne construire une porcherie.
texts.en: Mr. BENJAMIN is the official of the group MANEGRE 08 SAPONE. He is unmarried and has no children. He has five persons to support. Mr. BENJAMIN has been raising livestock for four years. He gets his supplies from nearby markets. With the money granted, he intends to purchase four pigs. He wants to use the profits from the loan to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to build a pig pen.

loans.use: to purchase 4 pigs

loans.name: Zhyldyz

texts.ru: Жылдыз, 46 лет, мать 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 16 лет назад. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, лошадь, на 1,84 Га земли она выращивает картофель для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду, Жылдыз на сегодняшний день имеет ежемесячную прибыль от бизнеса 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Жылдыз обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения объемов реализации молока, экологически чистого и очень вкусного. Жылдыз является одной из 5 участников группы "Нуркунай". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и покупку земельной доли.
texts.en:
Zhyldyz is 46 years old and the mother of three children. She has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started with this 16 years ago. She has two cows and a horse on her farm. She also grows potatoes for sale on 1.84 hectares of land. Thanks persistent work, Zhyldyz currently has a monthly income from the business of 8,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Zhyldyz turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a dairy cow to increase the volume of organic and very tasty milk for selling. Zhyldyz is one of the members of the group "Nurkunay". She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business and in purchasing land.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase the volume of organic milk for selling

loans.name: Bubuzhan
