texts.ru: Бубужан, 45 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 19 лет назад. В хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 10 овец, на 1,84 Га земли она выращивает картофель для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду, Бубужан на сегодняшний день имеет ежемесячную прибыль от бизнеса 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бубужан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Бубужан является одной из 5 участников группы "Нуркунай". Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и постройку сарая.
texts.en:
Bubuzhan is 45 years old, married and the mother of four children. She has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, she works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started with this 19 years ago. She has three cows and ten sheep on her farm. She grows potatoes for sale at 1.84 hectares of land. Thanks to persistent work, Bubuzhan currently has a monthly income from the business of 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Bubuzhan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase two bull-calves to fatten and resell. Bubuzhan is one of five the members of the group "Nurkunay". She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business and in building a barn.

loans.use: to purchase two bull-calves for fattening and subsequently reselling

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr: Enyonam est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomé avec trois enfants. Enyonam est âgée de 27 ans  et œuvre activement pour apporter sa contribution à l’épanouissement de sa famille. Enyonam vend des pagnes dans sa localité et grâce à son petit commerce, elle trouve une épargne pour favoriser son mari à subvenir aux charges de la famille. Enyonam s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Dans le but de réaliser plus de bénéfice, Enyonam veut commander des pagnes et demande ce crédit pour atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Enyonam is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with three children. She is 27 years old and works actively to do her part for her family to thrive. Enyonam sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in her town, and thanks to her small-scale commerce, she saves money for her husband to meet family expenses. Enyonam gets her supplies twice a month at the market. With the goal of realizing her profits, she wants to order some ‘pagne’ cloth and is asking for this loan to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to purchase 5 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for lumber, nails, and labor.

loans.name: Ema

texts.fr: Ema est agée 50 ans et vit à Adidogomé. Ema a quatre enfants à sa charge et vend des charbons de bois et du maïs dans les marchés et dans son quartier afin d’avoir le bénéfice nécessaire. Ema s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Ema veut commander des sacs de maïs et du charbon de bois et demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat afin d’avoir le profit nécessaire pour leur épanouissement
texts.en: Ema is 50 years old and lives in Adidogomé. She has four children to support and sells charcoal and corn at the markets and in her district, so as to earn the necessary profits. Ema gets her supplies three times a month at the market. She wants to order sacks of corn and charcoal and is asking for this loan to realize her purchases, thus earning the necessary profits for her family to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of corn and a sack of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her thesis expenses.

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, cada una de ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante. Todas forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con lo cual podrán conocer su situación de vida y conforme a ello poder ir mejorándola poco a poco y por medio de su esfuerzo.
Herminia es una de las que integran este grupo, es una persona humilde que está luchando para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna. Su trabajo es humilde, pero está contenta ya que con ello ayuda a sus seres queridos. Herminia se dedica al reciclado de productos como cartones, aluminio, cartones, papeles y otros, que recoge de manera ambulante y que luego revende. Además de ello también compra y revende estos productos en cantidad.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de aluminio, cartones, papeles en cantidad, de manera a poder revenderlos y tener los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
There are 18 women who have joined this group. All of them are giving their best effort so that they can grow and move forward. They have taken the poverty elimination survey so that they can become familiar with their living situations and do whatever it takes to gradually improve through their efforts.

Herminia is one of the members of this group. She is a humble person who strives to provide her family everything that they need to have a decent life. Her work is modest, but she is pleased that she is able to help her loved ones. Herminia recycles products such as cardboard, aluminum, paper, and other materials that she collects as a street vendor and then resells. She also buys and sells these products in quantity.

Herminia is requesting a loan in order to buy aluminum, cardboard, and paper in bulk so that she can resell them and have the income she needs to help her family.

loans.use: to buy aluminum, cardboard, and paper in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодире 55 летняя замужняя женщина. Она жительница района Пяндж. Нодира в районе живет вместе детьми и мужем. Муж занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Сама Нодира 15 лет своей жизни продвигает животноводство. Нодира и муж стараются и трудятся, чтобы  зарабатывать на жизнь. Нодира любит домашних животных и хорошо ухаживает о животных, потому что доход от животноводство обеспечивает семью. Поэтому она обратилась за  кредитом, чтобы купить скота и  и не потерять источник дохода. Нодира с большими надеждами обратилась к Вам за помощь.
texts.en:
Nodira is a 55 year old and married woman. She is a resident of the Pyandj region. Nodira lives in the region together with her children and husband. Her husband works with agriculture. Nodira has bred livestock for 15 years of her life.

Nodira and her husband strive and work hard to earn money for a living. Nodira loves livestock and looks well after the animals, because the income from the livestock breeding helps provide for her family. She applied for a loan in order to purchase livestock and not lose her source of income. Nodira turns to you with high hopes for help.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to keep her source of income

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 37-year-old married man with two children who are fourteen and six years old. He has had a wood business for six years and makes 20,000 KES in a month. 

He will use the loan to purchase  more wood  and hopes this will help him to pay for educating his children and repaying his loan. This is his eighth loan with Vision Fund Kenya, he successfully  repaid his previous loans.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to succeed and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase  more wood.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a 37-year-old married man with three children. He has sold cattle  in Makutano for seven years. His monthly income is thirty thousand KES.

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to purchase cows and goats. He plans to use the profits to educate his children. In the future, he hopes to become a dairy farmer and have financial stability.

loans.use: to buy more cattle.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a restaurant business and requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

She successfully repaid  her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Candelaria dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business

loans.use: to buy additional utensils and ingredients for her restaurant.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She earns additional income raising pigs.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to purchase more groceries.

loans.name: Osanna

texts.en:
Osanna has a vocational education, and her specialty is in nursing. Since 2009, she has worked as as a nurse at the military commissariat in Sevan, a city in the Gegharkunik region. She lives in Sevan with her husband, who works as a driver, and together they support their two school-aged children. 

At present, Osanna's husband is suffering from health problems, and he requires medical treatment. In order to afford this treatment, Osanna has requested a loan in the amount of 400,000 Armenian drams. The loan funds will be great help to Osanna and her family, as it is vital that her husband pass this course of treatment.
 
This charming lady and her entire family offer their thanks to their lenders for giving them such great support and help.

loans.use: to pay for the medical treatment of her husband

loans.name: Abdul Nuru

texts.en:
Abdlu Nuru is aged 63 years, married with 13 children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.

He operates a sewing workshop mainly making clothes like dresses, trousers, school uniforms. He also gets additional income from his cocoa trade. He started the business to raise income for his family and pay school fees for the children. His main challenges are limited capital, competition and high costs of materials. He wants to construct a permanent house in future and educate his children.

Abdul Nuru has asked for a loan to buy cloth for making uniforms.

loans.use: to  buy cloth for making uniforms.

loans.name: Onik

texts.en:
Onik is 45 years old and lives in Sevan city which is in the Gegharkunik region. Onik lives here with his big family; his wife, his son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. 

Onik has a speciality in architecture and has worked in this speciality for many years. His wife works at the kinder-garden. 

Onik has a great request and hopes that Kiva lenders will be kind to support him in such an important situation. His beloved wife has health problems and this loan will help him to solve it quickly and properly.  This loan of 600,000 AMD will be enough to solve his wife’s health problems.

loans.use: to take care of his wife’s health problems.

loans.name: Reyna Inocenta

texts.es:
Reyna, ha tenido un resultado positivo con la inversión del crédito anterior en el cultivo de granos básicos y en la crianza de cerdos, las cosechas han sido más abundantes y los ingresos han mejorado.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para pagar la recolección de la cosecha de maíz por medio de regadío y de caña de azúcar, así como también su debido procesamiento, espera realizar los trabajos en el tiempo justo para obtener los mejores resultados.
texts.en: Reyna had positive results with her last loan growing basic grains and raising pigs. Her harvests were abundant and her income improved. She is requesting a new loan to pay to harvest her corn and sugar cane as well as pay to process it and for irrigation. She hopes to do these at the proper time to get maximum results.

loans.use: to pay to harvest her corn and sugar cane as well as pay to process it and for irrigation.

loans.name: Zhongmei

texts.en:
Zhongmei is a 25-year-old pregnant woman. Zhongmei and her younger brother co-run a barbershop. Zhongmei and her brother were born in a poor family, and their mother abandoned them as young children. Their father raised them alone and they did not receive an education. 

Her husband is an auxiliary policeman and earns a very low income, he could not make ends meet.
 
Zhongmei requested 10,000 CNY form Micorcred. This is her third loan and she has a good credit history. She wants to use the money to expand the business to make enough money to support the family. She believes that she could use her energy and hard-work to create a good living for her unborn child.

loans.use: to expand their business.

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui vit à Adidogomé avec un enfant à sa charge. Divorcée, Kafui est âgée 35 ans et très active pour leur développement. Pour relever les défis quotidiens, Kafui prépare de la bouillie et des beignets qu’elle vend dans son quartier. Grâce  à son épargne Kafui subvient aux charges quotidiennes mais nécessite encore plus de revenus. Kafui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché pour avoir ses ingrédients. Pour augmenter son bénéfice, Kafui sollicite ce prêt pour commander des bols de maïs et un sac de farine de blé.
texts.en: Kafui lives in Adidogomé with a child to support. Kafui is 35 years old and is very active in their development. To alleviate life’s challenges, she makes porridge and beignets, which she sells in her neighborhood. Thanks to her savings, she covers day-to-day expenses but still needs more income. She supplies herself once a month at the market to obtain her ingredients. To increase her profits, Kafui is requesting this loan to order tubs of corn and a sack of wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase 67 tubs of corn and a sack of wheat flour

loans.name: Kanlé

texts.fr: Agée de 58 ans, Kanlé est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses trois enfants à Adidogomé. Pour avoir un niveau de vie favorable et couvrir au minimum les charges de ses enfants, Kanlé vend des pagnes dans son quartier. Cette activité lui génère un bénéfice qui est loin de palier à sa situation de précarité. Kanlé s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Kanlé demande ce prêt pour acheter des pagnes pour vendre et réaliser plus de bénéfice et pourvoir favorablement aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Kanlé, aged 58, is a married woman who lives with her three children in Adidogomé. For proper living conditions and to cover her children’s basic expenses, she sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) in her neighborhood. This business generates a profit that is nowhere near alleviating her precarious situation. Kanlé gets her supplies three times a month at the market. She is asking for this loan to purchase some ‘pagne’ cloth to sell and make more profit, so that she can meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 2 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Gye Nyame Group

texts.en:
This is the Gye Nyame group, and it consists of six members who live in Teshie-Accra. Together they have applied for a loan in the amount amount of 2,900 GHS to invest in their businesses. These include the sale such items as cooking items, grocery goods, shirts, shoes, wiring, control boards, and charcoal, as well as hairdressing services. 

Isaac, age 37, is the featured borrower in this group. He is a hard-working married man with two dependent children, and he lives with his family in Teshie. He was unable to pursue his education beyond elementary school. Isaac started out as an apprentice auto mechanic, and five years ago he was able to start up his own auto mechanic business. His business has steadily improved year after year, but most of what he earns in profits goes toward the expenses of his family and into the family savings. 

Though he has good experience, his income does not provide him with enough capital to expand and improve his business. For this reason, he has applied for a loan in the amount of 500 GHS from ID Ghana. He will use his loan funds to purchase control boards to install in his customers' cars. He will also buy electrical wires and an alternator. These investments will allow him to to better service his customers' vehicles and to attract a larger clientele. 

Isaac looks forward to further expanding his business in order to provide his family with as much money as he can.

loans.use: to purchase control boards to install in his customers' cars, as well as to buy electrical wires and an alternator

loans.name: Aichurok

texts.ru: Айчурок 31 год, замужем, мать 5 детей, старшие -школьники. У нее среднее образование, уже много лет Айчурок занимается сельским хозяйством. У Айчурок есть 2 коровы и 1,0 Га арендованной и 0,22 ГА собственной земли, где Айчурок выращивает ячмень для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айчурок обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS), полученные средства она направит на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита помогут Айчурок в будущем развить ее бизнес и построить сараи.
texts.en:
Aichurok is 31 years, married and the mother of five children. The eldest is of school age. She has secondary education and has worked with agriculture for many years already. Aichurok has two cows, 1.0 hectares of rented land and 0.22 hectares of own land. There she grows barley for selling. The monthly income is around 10,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Aichurok turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). She will direct the loan received to purchase sheep. The income from the loan will help Aichurok to develop her business in the future, and to build a barn.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla est un homme marié de 34 ans et très entreprenant. Komla vit à Adidogomé avec deux enfants. Komla travaille activement pour leur bonne éducation. Pour cela Komla fabrique des chaussures qu’il vend dans son quartier pour trouver le revenu leur permettant de couvrir les charges quotidiennes. Komla s’approvisionne une fois par mois marché. Pour commander des semelles et des peaux pour faire les chaussures répondant mieux à la volonté de ses clients, Komla demande ce crédit pour financer son activité et réaliser plus de profits pour élever ses enfants
texts.en: Komla is a married man, 34 years old, who is very entrepreneurial. He lives in Adidogomé with his two children. He works actively to provide the right education for them. To do so, Komla makes shoes, which he sells in his district to earn the income enabling them to cover day-to-day expenses. He gets his supplies once a month at the market. To order some soles and leather for making shoes that meet the wishes of his customers, Komla is asking for this loan to finance his business and to make more profit for raising his children.

loans.use: to purchase shoe-making material

loans.name: Xiaoyu

texts.en:
Xiaoyu is a 37-year-old woman, who was raised her 5th grade daughter alone. Her husband  works installing water pipes and electricity. It is a dangerous industry, and he works away from home.  Xiaoyu runs her business and cares for her daughter and  parents. Her father is ill and that makes things difficult for the family.
 
Xiaoyu has run a garment business for a long time and earns a small income. In order to provide a better living, Xiaoyu requests 20,000 CNY  from Microcred. She wants to use part of the money to support her father's medical expenses and expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for her father's medical expenses and to expand her business.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 34 years old. He is married and blessed with one child aged three years. He has had a hardware business for four years and makes a monthly income of 50,000 KES. 

He will be using the loan to purchase materials for sale like cement, nails, iron sheets, barbed wire, etc., which will be profitable, and hopes this will help him repay the loan and save more for future investments.

This is his second loan with Vision Fund Kenya and he repaid his first loan successfully. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase materials for sale like cement, nails, iron sheets, barbed wire, etc., and use the income to repay the loan and save more for other investments

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman, age 58 and widowed, operates a tailoring business from her home to earn her living. When her husband passed away in 1990, she started an additional business to earn additional income to support her family, through the sale of cosmetics, accessories, and mobile phones. This allowed her to improve her living and cover the family's increasing expenses. She has worked hard to develop her secondary business as much as she can, because she wants to make sure she can build good savings toward her future needs.

Though Nariman's business income is good, it is not enough both to cover her living needs and to develop her business at the same time. For this reason, she has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua. The loan funds will allow her to increase her business merchandise with a special spring and summer cosmetics collection that will attract customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special spring and summer cosmetics collection that will attract customers and increase her income

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
This lady’s name is Siranush and she is 28 years old. She lives with her mother and sister in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region. Her father and brother are temporally abroad in the Russian Federation for work and from there they support their family.

Siranush, having no higher education, started from 2005 until today working at different markets and shops as a salesgirl.

Siranush hopes that her request will be accepted by kind Kiva lenders. She needs this loan in order to solve the health problems that she has now. She thanks beforehand and wishes all the best to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to solve her health problems

loans.name: Gye Nyame 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Gye Nyame 2. The members of the group have a variety of businesses, and they have joined the micro-finance institution ID-Ghana in order to successfully carry out their trading activities. 

Their loan funds will be used in a number of ways. For example, one person will purchase sewing supplies; another will invest in shock absorbers, car shafts, and engine oil; another will buy charcoal; and another will purchase bread, eggs, and coal pots. All the members of the group live in traditional families in Teshie, Accra. 

Favour, pictured in the middle, sells sugar cane, cassava, and plantains to earn her living. She plans to use her loan to buy a supply of sugar cane, cassava, and plantains to offer for sale to her customers. She is expecting to make a good profit as a result of this investment. Thanks to this profit, Favour will be able to contribute more toward the daily expenses of her large family, as well as to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy a supply of sugar cane, cassava, and plantains to offer for sale

loans.name: Manegre 03 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr SAЇDOU est responsable du groupe  MANEGRE 03 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage depuis 20 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 06 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour épargner afin de pouvoir réinvestir dans son activité. Il ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Mr. SAЇDOU is the official of the group MANEGRE 03 SAPONE. He is a married father of five children. The oldest is 17 years old, and the youngest is 2. Three children go to school. He has seven persons to support. Mr. SAЇDOU has been raising livestock for twenty years. He gets her supplies from nearby market. With the money granted, he intends to purchase six sheep. He wants to use the profits from the loan to save money, so as to be able to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to ensure his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to purchase 6 sheep

loans.name: Manegre 04 Sapone Group

texts.fr:
Mr ANDRE est responsable du groupe  MANEGRE 04 SAPONE. Il est marié et père de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait de l’élevage depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 10 moutons.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour construire sa parcelle. Il ambitionne agrandir son activité et assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Mr. ANDRE is the official of the group MANEGRE 04 SAPONE. He is a married father of five children. The oldest is 24 years old, and the youngest is 2. Three children go to school. He has seven persons to support. Mr. ANDRE has been raising livestock for ten years. He gets his supplies from nearby market. With the money granted, he intends to purchase ten sheep. He wants to use the profits from the loan to build on his parcel of land. His ambition is to expand his business and ensure his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to purchase ten sheep

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
Sasun is 34 years old and he lives in the village of Tsovagyugh in Gegharkunik region. As he says, he was born into a peasant family and from a very young age he dreamed of becoming a skilled and clever farmer like his father.

Now he takes care of the farm that his father established 30 years ago. Here he has a lot of cows, calves, sheep and chickens. With the help of his mother, Sasun sells beef and mutton, also his farm’s milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese and eggs at the city’s wholesale market. He is also good in land cultivation; he cultivates potatoes, cucumber, tomatoes, greens and peppers on his plot of land. This harvest he also uses for his family. Sasun is married and he has two children.

Sasun needs this Kiva loan since he must start his agricultural activities. He will buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel and also some fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel and also some fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Milciades

texts.es:
Milciades es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, Es una persona que se esfuerza   por ser alguien en la vida.
Milciades quiere ser un profesional digno que ayude a las demás personas de la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder estudiar.
texts.en:
Milciades is from the city of Curuguaty. He is studying for a degree in Business Administration. Milciades is a person who strives to make something out of his life. He wants to become a decent professional who helps other people in society.

Milciades is requesting this loan so that he can pay his degree fees. As a result, he will be able to continue his studies. He appreciates the opportunity he has received so that he can study.

loans.use: to pay his degree fees.

loans.name: Ikatu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado IKATU está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres integrado por 21 mujeres todas ellas vecinas y amigas, el nombre del grupo quiere decir en castellano “se puede”, ya que ellas saben que si se puede mejorar con el esfuerzo de todas.
Paola es una de las integrantes quien se esfuerza cada día para mejorar y todo por medio de la venta de prendas que viene haciendo, lo cual también la ayuda a mantener a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere ir creciendo por medio de las capacitaciones que ha ido haciendo dentro del grupo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named “Ikatu” is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. There are 21 members, all of whom are neighbors and friends. The name of the group means “You Are Able” in Castilian. They know that they can improve by giving their best effort.

Paola is one of the members. She strives each day to improve and works hard at selling clothes. As a result, she is able to sustain her family. Paola is a hardworking individual who wants to grow by utilizing the training seminars that she has attended with her group.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers, and other garments so that she can continue her sales as before and improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers, and other garments.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old single man who has been working as a salesperson for two years to make his living and to pay for his education expenses. He is an ambitious man who is working and is still completing his Master's degree.

Ali's limited monthly salary is barely enough to cover his family's needs since he is the sole breadwinner for seven members of his family. Since his education is very important to him, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay for his increasing university tuition fees. 

He hopes to develop his working career and graduate to work in his domain.

loans.use: to pay for his increasing university tuition fees

loans.name: Suleiman

texts.en:
Suleiman is a 25-year-old single man who sells clothes to cover his needs and expenses. He is an ambitious man and a hard worker who has a good reputation among his customers.

Suleiman is trying desperately to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua.  With this loan, he will  open another clothing shop which will increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to open another clothing shop.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, es propietaria de una tienda en la que ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad, atiende a sus clientes todos los días de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, cuenta que su negocio está funcionando desde hace más de ocho años, vive junto a su familia y sus hijos, ella realiza labores domésticas y también genera ingresos para disminuir las necesidades familiares.
Para ofrecer un mejor inventario a sus clientes invertirá el financiamiento en la compra de pan, huevos, pastas, detergentes, lejía, etc., con ello su negocio será más competitivo, espera que sus clientes puedan encontrar lo que están buscando, así tener mayores ventas y mejores ingresos.
Sus sueños son ampliar su negocio, satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y dar as u familia una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Reina is the owner of a store where she offers her clients basic food items. She takes care of her clients every day from 7 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon. She says that her business has been functioning for more than 8 years. She lives with her family and children. She does domestic work and also generates income by lessening the family's needs.

In order to offer a greater inventory to her clients she will invest in financing the purchase of bread, eggs, pasta. detergents, bleach, etc. Doing this her business will be more competitive and she hopes her clients can find what they are looking for. Then she will have better sales and more income. Her dream is to expand her business, satisfy her customer's needs and provide her family with a more dignified life.

loans.use: to buy bread. eggs, pasta, detergents, bleach, etc and make her business more competitive.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is a farmer. He was born in the village of Gagarin in the Gegharkunik region, and he loves the nature and beauty of his village so much that he has never left it. He has a farm in Gagarin, and it provides the only income for his wife and son. 

All three members of the family work on the farm. They share the care of the livestock (cows, bulls, pigs, sheep, and lambs) and the poultry, and together they cultivate their plot of land, where they grow potatoes, green vegetables, cabbages, carrots, and tomatoes. 

Artur sells his vegetable produce as well as meat, milk, cheese, butter, and eggs at the local wholesale market. Some of these goods are sold to resellers, and some directly to his regular customers. 
 
Artur has requested a loan because he would like to buy an additional cow, as well as fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow and to purchase fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Mutio

texts.en:
Mutio, age 55, operates two businesses to earn her living. Some of her income comes from farming, and some comes from her salon business. She has operated her salon for seven years. Between her two businesses, Mutio earns an approximate monthly income of KES 25,250. She and her husband are blessed with six children. 

This is Mutio's third loan with Vision Fund Kenya, and she has repaid both her previous loans successfully. She will be using the loan to purchase shampoo, hair oil, hair pieces, and a variety of beauty products for the salon. With the expected profits from this loan investment, she intends to buy a vehicle-washing machine and to improve her farming business.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to provide for her children's education and to offer her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, hair oil, hair pieces, and a variety of beauty products for the salon

loans.name: Jenniffer

texts.en:
Jenniffer is 45 years old. She is married and blessed with 4 children. She has had a retail shop business for 5 years making a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

She will use this loan to purchase stock of sugar, rice and flour to sell.  She hopes this will enable her to increase her income and educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to be successful and to expand her retail shop by selling more retail goods.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice and flour to sell.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten, age 54 and widowed, works hard to meet the needs and expenses of her beloved children. She is a sacrificing mother who is trying her best to improve her family's living conditions, for she is their only breadwinner. 
 
She has requested a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua in order to cover necessary medical expenses for her son. She wishes for longevity and good health for him. 

Her primary goal is to stay capable of providing for her family, and she hopes eventually to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to cover necessary medical expenses for her son

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a 27-year-old single lady who started working as a tutor five years ago to cover her needs and expenses. Besides her business, she is still continuing her university studies. 

She is an ambitious lady who has a lot of dreams for the future, but due to increasing living costs, her income is becoming a bit limited. For this reason, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her university tuition fees.

Nisreen hopes to finish her university studies and start a new business, which will increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her university tuition fees

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, age 55, is an auto mechanic. He offers tire and repair services, and he has been engaged in this business for 20 years. He earns an additional income through farming. He is able to earn a monthly income of about KES 52,700. He and his wife have raised two children, now ages 20 and 24 years old. His dream is to be able to support them in pursuing higher studies.

This is Paul's seventh loan term, and he plans to use his loan funds to purchase tires and tubing for his auto repair business. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase farm inputs to improve his farming.

He hopes to expand his business so that he can help support his children's education.

loans.use: to buy tires for his auto mechanic business

loans.name: Agathe

texts.en:
Agathe is 31 years old. She is married with three children between the ages of three and nine years old. Two of them go to school. Agathe is a farmer, and she has been growing rice for the past 12 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow rice. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay for medical insurance.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow rice.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha, age 34 and married, has run a school for the past two years. She had always wanted to contribute toward the cause of education, and therefore she decided to open a school that could provide a quality education to the children in her community. Aisha has worked hard to manage her school and to ensure its quality of learning, and today, there are over 80 students enrolled. 

Aisha has requested a loan in the amount of of PKR 100,000. She will use her loan funds to buy student chairs, install a back-up electricity system, and conduct necessary repairs in the school building. She wants to provide her students with a safe and comfortable learning environment. 

Her goal is to expand her school so as to be able to enroll more students.

loans.use: to buy student chairs, install a back-up electricity system, and conduct necessary repairs in the school building

loans.name: Vrezh

texts.en:
Vrezh is 49 years old and lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. He lives here with his retired mother, wife and his son, who is on his last year of school.  Vrezh’s wife is a tailor at the city’s fabric district. 

Vrezh already has 11 years running his small business which thankfully covers the main needs of his family. In his own small workshop, he repairs and also makes men shoes. He mentions that the work of repairing has more orders than of shoe making, but he has regular customers who give him good orders each season. 

He dreams that he would be able to sell his handmade shoes himself in his own shop, but this is connected with great finances and waste. Still, with this loan, he asks to develop his shoe making craft. He will buy some raw materials and also some equipment both for shoe repairing and making.

loans.use: to buy some raw materials and also some equipment, for both for shoe making and repairing.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
This woman lives with her family in the frontier village Aknaghbyur in the region of Tavush. Her name is Armine, and having no higher education, she is still a skilled farmer with the help of her beloved husband. Armine has two school-aged children. 

On her farm, Armine perfectly manages swine breeding, poultry and beekeeping. All the family income comes from farming; from her farm she sells pork, poultry, eggs and honey. Her farm’s honey is very pure and tasty, and the flowers from which her farm’s bees make the honey rise in the fields which are clean, far from dust and any kind of rubbish so the honey is sold very quickly and mainly to her regular customers.  

Armine mentions that bee keeping and swine breeding is very profitable in the region where she lives. She also has a rich orchard which gives her harvests of persimmons, nuts, figs and apples for sale and for family use as well. 

She requests this loan aiming to buy with it several bee families and also several piglets to develop her farm.

loans.use: to buy several bee families and also several piglets to develop her farm

loans.name: Ara

texts.en:
Ara is happy to have a chance to cooperate with Kiva lenders for the second time, and he hopes his request will be accepted this time also. Ara lives in the city of Kapan of the Syunik region. He lives there with his wife and retired mother. His wife now works as babysitter, and Ara is still engaged in providing taxi services in the entire district of Syunik using his own car. 

This time Ara is requesting this loan as his mother has some health problems. This loan need is very urgent, and will be greatly helpful since with it Ara will cover his mother’s medical wastes.

loans.use: to cover his mother’s medical wastes
